loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Mrs Judith is 32 years old and has 5 children together with her husband Eulices.

Judith has had a business selling cold drinks and sweets for a long time. Eulices is a fisherman and he works for himself as he owns 2 little fishing boats. Together they work hard and constantly make an effort to offer well being and security to their beloved children.

Judith requests the loan in order to invest in her business and to help Eulices buy fishing equipment necessary for a good performance. With your help Judith will be able to materialize her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Judith, se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas y dulces desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 32 años y es madre de cinco hijos, su querido esposo, Eulices, es trabajador independiente y se dedica a al pesca gracias a que es propietario de dos botes. Judith en compañía de su esposo trabajan arduamente y se esfuerzan a diario a fin de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad a sus queridos hijos.

Ella desea el préstamo para invertirlo en su negocio y sobre todo para apoyar a Eulices con la compra de los materiales de pesca necesarios para su buen desempeño. Con tu ayuda la señora Judith concretará sus objetivos.

loans.use: Buy more supplies for a shop selling refreshments and to buy fishing equipment

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
Mrs Ofelia is 56 years old and has 3 sons whom are already independent. She is single and has been selling groceries for a long time. The concern over the well-being of her beloved ones has led her to an improvement path and she aims to reach every one of the goals that she sets herself.

Ofelia would like now to expand her business and with time become an important distributor of basic commodity products in her city. That is why she would like to buy a mean of transportation that will allow her to deliver the orders from her clients. Mrs Ofelia hopes for the selfless help of your noble and kind hearts in order to launch this project.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Ofelia de 56 años de edad, es madre de tres hijos los cuales ya son independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes desde hace mucho tiempo, es soltera y su preocupación por el bienestar de los suyos la conducen por el camino del progreso y se propone alcanzar cada una de sus metas.

Ofelia quiere acrecentar su negocio y con el tiempo llegar a convertirse en una importante distribuidora de artículos de primera necesidad de su ciudad, para este fin requiere también de una movilidad que la ayude a transportar los pedidos de sus clientes. La señora Ofelia espera la ayuda desinteresada de tu noble y bondadoso corazón para poner en marcha este plan.

loans.use: To develop her groceries business buying a transportation mean that will allow her to deliver the orders from her clients

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José has sold basic commodity products for a long time, he is a street vendor and daily travels around the different communities close to the city to sell his products.

After a lot of work and effort, he has finally saved enough to establish himself. He would like to have a small store at home from which he can sell his products and profit to be close to his family and enjoy the company of his beloved ones.

That is why he requests a loan to buy the construction materials that will allow him to build a small warehouse.

Let’s grant his petition so that this hardworking father can offer his services from an established store at his home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

José, durante mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad de forma ambulante desplazándose a diario por las diferentes comunidades de su ciudad; después de mucho tiempo de trabajo ha podido ahorrar lo suficiente para establecerse en casa con esta ocupación a fin de estar más cerca de su familia y disfrutar de la compañía de sus seres queridos.

Con este deseo en mente solicita un préstamo para adquirir los materiales de construcción que le hacen falta para poner en marcha su pequeña bodeguita en casa.

Posibilitemos su petición para que este trabajador padre pronto pueda brindar sus servicios desde la comodidad de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy construction materials to build a small store to sell his products at home

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
42 year-old Margarita P.’s works every day selling food and providing excellent customer service . She has three children for whom she provides the essentials so they can continue studying and progressing. She is a single mother and despite having a huge responsibility to care for her children she has always shown herself to be capable of obtaining everything needed.

Margarita sells food in a hired place, but her aim is to construct a site form which to sell cold drinks: for this she needs capital, which will help her to realise her goal. She needs your help, to make her wish come true.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Vender comida y dar una buena atención a sus clientes es el trabajo diario que realiza la señora Margarita P. de 42 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, a los que les brinda lo necesario para que sigan estudiando y progresen. Ella es madre soltera y a pesar de tener una responsabilidad muy grande con sus hijos siempre se mostró segura y capaz de conseguir todo lo que se propone.

Margarita vende comida en un lugar apropiado, pero su objetivo es construir un local para la venta de bebidas heladas, por lo que requiere de un capital el cual le ayudará con el cumplimiento de su propósito. Ella necesita tu apoyo, para cumplir su deseo.

loans.use: Consolidation of her business and construction of a new sales space.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Mrs Olga has been selling typical Peruvian food (like salchipollos, salchipapas and others) at night for a long time, with success. She is 30 years old and has 2 children, Gianpol and Nicolle. Her children have become her biggest strength and motivation to improve and provide them wellbeing and safety.

Together with her beloved husband, Javier, who works as a teacher, they have decided to offer their children an excellent education so that they can reach the goals they set for their respective futures.

Olga would like to improve her business and that is why she would like to build a well-established food stand so she can offer a better service to her clients.

With your help, Olga will be able to reach her objective.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Olga, se dedica a la venta de comida por las noches (salchipollos, salchipapas y otros) desde hace mucho tiempo con éxito, ella a sus 30 años de edad es madre de dos hijos Gianpol y Nicolle, que se han convertido en su mayor fortaleza y motivo para progresar con el objetivo de otorgarles bienestar y seguridad.

En compañía de su querido esposo, Javier, quien trabaja como profesor se han propuesto brindarles una excelente educación con el propósito de que cada uno de ellos alcancen los planes que se propongan en un futuro. Olga desea progresar con su negocio y para ello quiere construir un local para brindar un mejor servicios a sus clientes.

Con tu ayuda la señora Olga logrará su objetivo.

loans.use: To improve her business building  a well-established food stand so she can offer a better service to her clients

loans.name: María

texts.en:
María is fifty years old and she and her husband have five grown children that attend university.  For more than three years, María has been selling an assortment of perfumes, deodorants and women’s clothing.  Her and her husband are working hard to support the children’s studies since they are unemployed.
Every two weeks, María goes to purchase goods at the Fleet Market, where goods can be obtained at very low prices.  She explains with enthusiasm that she makes a monthly profit of about US $100.
Currently, the businesswoman is talking about expanding her business and attracting more customers.  She has requested a loan to purchase additional goods and new ones such as body lotion and hair care products.

loans.use: The loan will be invested in clothing and care products for a small store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny Luz, aged 36, belongs to the Community Bank ‘Women progressing towards the future’ in the settlement of La Fortaleza. She is mother of five children who study in a modest educational centre in their town. Her husband Germán helps her in all her decisions and both are determined to provide their children with a good education so that they can become professionals.

Jenny has a small grocery store and she is dedicated to the sale of groceries and other essential items. She wishes to expand and improve the business’s facilities. Jenny Luz dedicates herself to this activity in order to help her husband with the maintenance of their home and the full satisfaction of their children’s needs. With your help, this hard-working mother will be able to realise her goal in a short time.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jenny Luz de 36 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal “Mujeres rumbo al futuro” del asentamiento humano la Fortaleza, es madre de cinco hijos los cuales estudian en un modesto centro educativo de su ciudad, su esposo, Germán, lo apoya en todo lo que decide y ambos se han propuesto brindar a sus hijos una buena educación para que lleguen a ser profesionales.

Ella tiene una pequeña bodega y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, tiene el propósito de acrecentar y mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio, Jenny Luz se dedica a esta actividad para apoyar a su esposo con la manutención de su hogar y la plana satisfacción de las necesidades de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda esta trabajadora madre logrará su propósito en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Expansion/Renovation of her business

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto has worked as a scrap-iron recycling merchant for a long time: his daily routine of going to collect, buy and sell these materials has allowed him to progress and achieve his ambitions. Carlos is thirty years old and is the father of a wonderful and very beautiful daughter. He and his partner Karina have the final responsibility from educating, loving and helping their daughter at all times.

Carlos Alberto has always aspired to become the biggest scrap-iron recycler in his town, however in order to realize this dream, he needs capital in order to construct a store with the aim of stock-piling all his recycling from their follow-on sale from this space. Let us help this father, who with effort and dedication will continue his hard work for prosperity.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Carlos Alberto, se desempeña como reciclador de chatarra desde hace mucho tiempo, su rutina diaria de ir a recoger, comprar y vender estos materiales le ha permitido progresar y alcanzar lo que se ha propuesto.Tiene 30 años de edad es padre de una hija maravillosa y súper cariñosa, él junto a su conviviente la señora Karina, tienen la finalidad de educar, amar y apoyar a su hija en todo momento.

Desde siempre el señor Carlos Alberto aspira con convertirse en el más grande reciclador de su ciudad, sin embargo para la realización de este propósito, necesita de un capital para construir un almacén a fin de acopiar todo lo que reciclado para su posterior venta desde este espacio.Apoyemos a este padre que con esfuerzo y dedicación sigue trabajando arduamente por prosperar.

loans.use: Construction of a storage depot

loans.name: Juana Irene

texts.en:
Juana, a sixty-four year old woman, is the owner and operator of a grocery store in her community.  She is a well experienced businesswoman since she has been entrepreneur for a long time.  “All my life, I have been in business,” she says. 
Juana has seven grown children, three of whom are boys, which she raised on her since her husband had left her.
She says that it’s an exploit raising a lot of children alone, with nobody’s help but God’s.  She worked a lot and made a lot of sacrifices for her offspring.  
Currently, she has a popular and profitable grocery store. The store is in a good location and has very good hygienic conditions.   Juana is requesting a loan (the second one she will take from our organization) to replenish her store in order to keep satisfying her customers’ needs and increase her income.  That way, María will improve her living condition.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of goods to replenish her grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta is a humble mother whose life has always been connected to ranching and farming. This experience and the effort that she puts into her family every day is reflected in her household. She and her husband have lovingly created a stable home. Every day the couple leaves home very early to take care of their cows and bulls in order to provide for their five dear children who are all students at the community's modest education center. Their main activity during the sowing and harvest season is livestock. They purchase animals so that after a certain period of time they can sell them at the Acostambo fair. This hard-working family's wish is to receive a loan so that they can purchase more feed for their beloved animals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Modesta, es una humilde madre de familia, su vida siempre ha estado vinculada a las actividades agrícolas, gracias a este hecho obtuvo mucha experiencia la cual se ve reflejada ahora en su hogar debido al esfuerzo que le dedica día a día a esta labor en beneficio de su familia.Ella y su esposo han forjado con mucho amor un hogar sólido y a diario desde muy temprano abandonan su hogar en compañía de sus vaquitas y toros, en búsqueda del sustento diario de sus cinco queridos hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando en el modesto centro educativo de su comunidad. Su principal actividad en épocas de siembra y cosecha es la ganadería, compran animales para al cabo de un tiempo venderlos en la feria de Acostambo.El deseo de esta trabajadora familia es obtener un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de alimento para sus queridos animalitos.

loans.use: To buy more cattle feed.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
The desire to get ahead constantly encourages Milagros to find a way to satisfy her household needs. She currently lives with her husband and six-year-old daughter, to whom she owes her daily joy. Based on a sister-in-law's advice, she decided to join the business world selling the country's top brand-name cosmetics. She has successfully been selling for eight years, in spite of not having a fixed selling stand. She has a display case to sell her products to neighbors. Every day Milagros walks from house to house selling her products. Her warmth and experience helps her sell the products. Just like every enterprising woman, she wants to continue to succeed, and this is why she wants to have a stable locale where she can not only sell cosmetics but also sandwiches and sweets. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to achieve each of her goals. Support an enterprising woman like Milagros. She appreciates your contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Los deseos de progreso motivan constantemente a Milagros a buscar la manera de cubrir satisfactoriamente las necesidades de su hogar. Actualmente vive con su esposo y su pequeña niña de seis años de edad, a quienes le debe su alegría diaria.Por consejo de unas de sus cuñadas empezó su incursión en la actividad mercantil con la venta de cosméticos de las mejores marcas de su país, lleva ocho años dedicándose a esta actividad con mucho éxito y a pesar de no contar con un puesto de ventas seguro, sus ventas compensan muy bien esta falta. Acude a su esposo amistades vecinas y a su hermana para exhibir su vitrina con los productos para su comercialización. Adicionalmente día a día Milagros camina para ir de casa en casa a ofrecer sus productos y con la calidez de su trato y experiencia en la venta de estos productos asegura la venta de sus productos.Como toda mujer emprendedora desea seguir superándose, por esa razón desea tener un local estable donde no sólo ofertará cosméticos sino también ofrecerá bocadillos y dulces. Con este propósito solicita un préstamo para alcanzar cada una de las metas que se ha propuesto.Apoya a una mujer emprendedora como Milagros, ella agradece tu colaboración.

loans.use: A boost of capital will increase product sales and help to rent a safe business space.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee is a hard-working, dedicated woman who puts a lot of effort into what she does because she wants to create a promising future. She is currently single but in the future she wants to establish a stable family. Right now her biggest desire is to enjoy every day alongside her loved ones. She lives in a small home with her sister and is always lovingly taking care of and spoiling her nieces and nephews. To follow her dreams, a year ago she decided to sell sugar cane juice which she sells by displaying glasses of the juice to people. Haydee is very happy because she is seeing the fruits of her labor reflected in the income she brings in. Sometimes she doesn't sell very much but she compensates for this on other days. She is very thankful to her father who encouraged her to buy the necessary items to begin this small business. She is applying for a loan so that she can increase sells by buying more sugar cane to make her delicious juice.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee, es una dama muy trabajadora y se desempeña con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo porque quiere forjarse un futuro prominente. Aún es soltera y desea en un futuro establecer una familia sólida.Ahora su gran anhelo es disfrutar de cada uno de los días en compañía de sus seres queridos actualmente comparte las instalaciones de una pequeña morada con su hermana y siempre está al cuidado de sus pequeños sobrinos a los que cuida con amor y siempre les engríe.Para continuar con sus anhelos ha decidido hace un año ha vender jugo de caña, que ofrece mostrando sus vasitos a las personas, está muy contenta porque ahora observa el fruto de su trabajo reflejado en las ganancias que recibe, aunque existan ocasiones en los que la venta es mínima éste hecho se compensa con otros días en los que no se da basto ella sola.Está muy agradecida con su papá, porque fue él quién la animó a comprar lo necesario para la implementación de este pequeño negocio. Solicita un préstamo para incrementar sus ventas con la compra de mayor caña para la oferta de su delicioso jugo.

loans.use: A boost of capital will increase sells.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
Delfina is a responsible mother. 14 years ago, watching the necessities that her children went through daily got her to start selling groceries. With her daily work the business became more sustainable and now she wants to improve it even more.

Thanks to this activity she maintains her two sons of 24 and 23 years old each who are studying at a center for superior studies. Her long years of experience have served her to make out of her store one of the best stores around. She has the desire to improve her sales center, to increase the quantity and diversity of services, in order to satisfy completely her community's members. Lets make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can reach every one of her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Delfina, es una madre de familia responsable. Al observar las necesidades por las que atravesaban sus prójimos día a día, hace 14 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes; con su desempeño diario su negocio se vuelve más sostenible y desea mejorarlo aún más, gracias a esta actividad mantiene a sus 2 hijos de 24 y 23 años que están estudiando en un centro superior de estudios.Los largos años de experiencia le han servido para hacer de su tienda una de las mejores. Tiene el deseo de mejorar su centro de ventas para ofrecer más y diversos servicios que mantengan a los miembros d su comunidad totalmente satisfechos.Hagamos posible su petición para que esta trabajadora madre alcance cada una de sus metas.

loans.use: Inject capital into her  small sales center in order to offer more services to her community

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Doña Victoria is a very entrepenurial and hardworking woman. Her years of experience raising diverse types of animals has helped her progress in spite of the bad economical situation that her family went through.

Her inconditional motherly love is what drives her to work. She has nine children out of whom only two remain at home. She cares and prays every day for her little animals' wellbeing so that she can offer them at a very good price at her city's Coto Coto fair.

The desire to contribute to finish her children's careers satisfactorily is what drives Victoria to request your help in order to consolidate her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Victoria, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, sus años de experiencia en la labor de crianza de diversos animalitos le sirvieron para progresar a pesar de los momentos de escasez económica por las que atravesó su familia, su amor incondicional de madre le impulsa a trabajar, tiene nueve hijos de los cuales sólo dos continua bajo su cobijo.A diario vela por el bienestar de sus queridos animalitos a fin de ofertarlos a muy buen precio en la feria de Coto Coto de su ciudad. El deseo de contribuir con sus hijos para que estos puedan finalizar satisfactoriamente sus careras la llevan solicitar vuestra ayuda para consolidar su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Inject capital to consolidate her small business

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is very responsible in her role as a mother, and she wants to continue improving her business in order to benefit her family. She became separated from her husband many years ago and now she maintains her family through hard work. She wants her children to finish their studies successfully so that they will be able to manage in society without problems. After much searching, Elizabeth has established a small stall in the busiest city market in order to sell fresh chickens to the housewives of her city. She hopes to invest more money in the adaptation and implementation of her small space in order to increase her sales with the aim of providing a better quality of life for her dear children. Let’s make it possible for this mother to continue developing her business with success.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Elizabeth, es muy responsable con sus roles de madre y quiere seguir progresando con su actividad para beneficio de su familia, se separó hace muchos años de su esposo y ahora los mantiene con su desempeño.Desea que sus hijos culminen con satisfacción sus estudios a fin de que estos se desenvuelvan sin dificultad dentro de su sociedad. Después de mucho buscar se ha establecido en un pequeño puesto de ventas del mercado más concurrido de su ciudad para ofertar desde este lugar pollos frescos a las bellas amas de casa de su ciudad.Anhela invertir mayor dinero en la adecuación e implementación de su pequeño espacio para incrementar sus ventas a fin de otorgarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus queridos hijos.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta madre siga desempeñándose en esta actividad con éxito.

loans.use: To improve and supply a small stall for selling poultry

loans.name: Cenaida

texts.es:
Mrs. Cenaida C. has built a family over many years with children who value hard work and honor above all. She is very happy with how her family has turned out. When the economic crisis was very urgent in her house Cenaida’s dear children had to interrupt their college studies in order to work. For this reason Cenaida began a small transportation business of motorcycle rickshaws which she currently runs. Cenaida covers short routes with great success, and the dream of this hard-working mother is to repair her motorcycle rickshaws in order to begin covering longer routes with greater earning potential and more security. She is asking for your help in order to make this dream a reality soon.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cenaida, ha construido durante muchos años una familia, cuyos hijos tienen como valor principal el trabajo esforzado y honrado y está muy feliz por los resultados que ha obtenido. Cuando la crisis económica era muy apremiante en casa sus queridos hijos tuvieron que interrumpir sus estudios en los centros superiores de su ciudad para trabajar, fue así como se inició su pequeña empresa de transportes de mototaxis que administra actualmente Cenaida con mucho éxito, cubren rutas cortas y el anhelo de esta trabajadora madre es reparar los daños de sus motos para iniciar la cobertura de rutas más largas con mayores ganancias y más seguridad.Solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de cristalizar este sueño en poco tiempo.

loans.use: Repair motorcycle rickshaws

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very creative and warm woman. She is a happy mother of four children who are still in school and she does not waste the opportunity to enjoy every day of their company. At home she produces beautiful textiles with her wonderful hands. She makes very beautiful blankets and rugs that help her to have a small extra income to cover the needs of her home. She commercializes her products with friends in her home town and as well as in the city of Cerro of Pasco. Her wish to increase her production made her request your help through a loan. Let's make her wish possible so that this hard-working mother can keep on granting the well-being to her loved children.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una mujer muy creativa y muy cálida en su trato. Ella es una feliz madre de cuatro hijos que están aún en etapa escolar y no desaprovecha la oportunidad para disfrutar día a día de su compañía. Produce en casa bellos tejidos, con sus manos maravillosas elabora mantas y tapetes muy hermosos que la ayudan a tener unos ingresos extras para la satisfacción plena de las necesidades de su hogar, comercializa sus productos con las amistades que posee en su ciudad y también cuando se desplaza a la ciudad de Cerro de Pasco. Su deseo de incrementar su producción la conducen a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre siga otorgándole bienestar a sus queridos hijos.

loans.use: To have a bigger working capital to increase her production.

loans.name: Francisca Colombina

texts.en:
Francisca is a forty-seven year old single mother of four children.  To make a living and support the studies of her children, Francisca has turned into a dynamic businesswoman.  She has worked many jobs including: cleaning woman, selling women’s clothing, promoting beauty products, and preparing and selling sandwiches.
Currently, she owns and operates a small cafeteria within her house, which she opened five years ago.  The cafeteria is her principal source of income.
“Every day, I ask God wisdom and patience to continue the business and achieve my goal,” she says. 
With the loan, Francisca will buy raw materials to keep preparing delicious meals for the people of her community.  Profits from business will be used to repay the loan and to support her children's studies.

loans.use: the entrepreneur will use the loan to buy raw materials for her small cafeteria

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Octaviana

texts.en:
Octaviana is a mother of four children, two boys and two girls, which will soon go to university.  She is a very persistent woman that has been running a small cafeteria in her community for one year.  She produces an assortment of delicious sandwiches, hot dogs, empanadas and juices in the morning.  For lunch, she serves traditional Dominican meals such as moro, which is a mixture of rice and beans.  Her cafeteria is well visited and people who go to eat there once generally return. 
Octaviana wants to make a good income to keep on supporting her children's studies.  With this loan, she will purchase raw materials such as fresh bread, butter, vegetable oil, ketchup, spices, rice and beans so she can keep on preparing delectable meals for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to continue food production for a small cafeteria

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Team work undoubtedly is one of the keys to obtain a positive fruit at the end of the day and this is what Frida does every day when working with her loved husband who has a wonderful skill to repair devices. This has long ago turned into the main economic activity of her family. This is how Frida and her husband decided to sell second-hand gadgets. They mainly repair TV sets and radios, occasionally other devices like blenders, calculators, etc. Frida knows that sometimes sales are low but her saving skills help them for these difficult moments. Now they commercialize these goods in the streets; nevertheless their desire is to be able to establish in a place. Frida is requesting a loan to acquire a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them to the public in general. Let's support a close family and compromised with her development.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El trabajo en equipo sin duda es una de las llaves para obtener un fruto positivo al término de la jornada y eso es lo que aplica Frida cada día en la labor diaria de su querido esposo que tiene una maravillosa habilidad para la reparación de artefactos; ésta desde hace mucho tiempo se ha convertido en la principal actividad económica de su familia, fue así que Frida y su esposo decidieron dedicarse a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de segunda. Reparan en mayor cantidad televisores y radios, ocasionalmente otros artefactos como licuadoras, calculadoras, etc. Frida es consciente que a veces las ventas son bajas pero se compensan con otras y su habilidad de ahorro le sirven para estos momentos difíciles, por el momento comercializan estos bienes de manera ambulante; sin embargo su deseo es poder establecerse en un local. Frida hace lo solicitud de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de artefactos en desuso a fin de repararlas y venderlas al público en general que solicita estos bienes. Apoyemos a una familia unida y comprometida con su desarrollo.

loans.use: Buy a bigger quantity of non-working devices in order to repair them and to sell them.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
When the family needs are pressing and you need to take care of them when it is a question of supporting those who you love the most; all of this was the reason that impelled Irma to sell cosmetics three years ago after a friend advised her to do so. Her desires of progress and the establishment of a space to sell clothes pushed her to request a loan in order to make her dreams come true in short time. She is grateful of your support and promises to repay the loan in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Las necesidades son apremiantes y urge atenderlas si se trata de sostener a los que más quieres, estos acontecimientos impulsaron a Irma a vender cosméticos hace tres años por consejo de una de sus amigas que le aconsejó para que se dedique a este rubro. Sus deseos de progreso y la implementación de un espacio de ventas de prendas de vestir la impulsan a solicitar un préstamo a fin de cristalizar este deseo en corto tiempo. Agradece vuestro apoyo y se compromete a retornar tu ayuda en seis meses.

loans.use: Establishment of a space to sell clothes.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es:
Verónica is a young mother with a big desire of improvement and self-development. Her only desire is to grant the well-being to her four-year-old loved son who is her only company. She doesn’t have the economic support of anybody, she is a single mother. Everyday she leaves her home very early to do different activities for the sake of her little one. She works half-time delivering letters for a shipping company and when she finishes her shift she sells cheese in the evenings. She brings these delicious cheeses from trips she makes to her home town, Junín. The desire to increase her small business of selling cheeses has lead her to request your help through a loan. Let's make her wish possible so that this hard-working mother keeps on granting the well-being to her beloved little one.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Verónica, es una joven madre con muchos deseos de superación y desarrollo, con el único objetivo de otorgarle bienestar a su querido hijo de cuatro años que es única compañía. Ella no cuenta con el apoyo económico de nadie, es madre soltera y día a día abandona su hogar muy temprano para realizar diversas actividades en beneficio de su pequeño, trabaja como repartidora de cartas en una empresa de correos a medio tiempo y cuando termina su turno por las tardes se dedica a la venta de quesos. Estos deliciosos quesos los trae de los viajes que realiza a su tierra natal, Junín. El deseo de incrementar su pequeño negocio de venta de quesos la llevan a solicitar vuestra ayuda a través de un préstamo. Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre siga otorgándole bienestar a su adorado pequeño.

loans.use: Increase working capital to sell a bigger quantity of cheese.

loans.name: Mérida

texts.es:
Merida is very hard-working woman. It's amazing the strength that she has to do hard tasks and simultaneously work in her business. The love to her little ones, age 4 and 1 give her all that strength. For the past two years during the weekends, she has been selling a drink made with the Maca plant, baked custard, bread with cheese among other food in the streets. She used to sell this products at the school coffe shop when she was a teenager, and then she became independent to start her own business. Now she is very happy because with this activity she is able to cover her family’s needs. He has found a very profitable opportunity where her loved husband works. There are a lot of people who goes around this area. Her desire of progress and well-being has lead her to request the help of your noble heart in order to obtain the quantity that she needs to invest it to buy the materials necessary for the distribution of her desserts and sandwiches.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mérida, es muy trabajadora y empeñosa, es increíble las fuerzas que tiene para realizar tareas duras y a la vez dedicarse a su negocio. El amor a sus pequeños de cuatro y un año son toda su fuerza. Ella tiene dos años dedicándose a la venta de agua de maca, leche asada, pan con queso entre otras viandas por las calles de la ciudad, los fines de semana, ésta idea surgió porque ella en sus años de adolescencia ayudaba en la venta de estos productos en un cafetín escolar; se independizó para crear su propio negocio, ahora está muy contenta con su desempeño porque esta actividad le otorga la capacidad de satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Ha encontrado una oportunidad muy provechosa en el lugar en el que se desempeña su querido esposo para ofertar sus deliciosas viandas ya que hay mucha gente que transita por este lugar. Sus deseos de mejora y bienestar la llevan a solicitar la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que necesita para invertirlos en la compra de materiales necesarios para la distribución de sus postres y sándwiches.

loans.use: Buy the necessary utensil for the distribution of her prepared food.

loans.name: Etty

texts.es:
Doña Etty is a mother of 3 who are studying at a modest educational center in her beautiful town. Her children represent her driving force and continuous effort. By recommendation from a relative, she sells cosmetics of a prestigious international brand, and she has been very successful doing this for the past five years. It is her wish to start a small store at home and she requests a loan to be able to carry out this activity. Support doña Etty so she may continue to create a prosperous future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Etty, es madre de 3 hijos que aún se encuentran estudiando en un modesto centro educativo de su hermosa ciudad, ellos se han convertido en el gran motor de su vida y esfuerzo continuo.Oferta cosméticos de una prestigiosa marca internacional por recomendación de un familiar y está muy satisfecha debido a que ya son cinco años de desempeño continuo y exitoso.Su deseo de aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa la conducen a solicitar vuestro apoyo a través de un préstamo con el objetivo de desenvolverse también en esta actividad desde la comodidad de su hogar. Apoya a Etty para que continúe forjando un buen futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to set up a small store at home.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Solutions have always been part of doña Julia’s philosophy as she has always found options to solve the economic challenges of her home because she wants to see a happy and satisfied family. Therefore she decided to start a grocery store at her own house so she could be with her children. She started with few items but little by little she has increased the stock. Her children are attending school and the youngest, who is five years old, has become her companion and partner in the mornings when they tend to many customers. It is her wish to increase sales at her small store and she appeals to you for support so she can make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Las soluciones siempre han sido parte de la filosofía de Julia, ya que siempre ha buscado salidas rápidas para las dificultades económicas de su hogar y esto porque quiere ver a su familia muy contenta y satisfecha.Por esa razón decidió aperturar una tienda de venta de abarrotes en su misma casa, inició con poca mercadería pero poco a poco empezó a surtirla más, lo hizo para no alejarse de sus hijos. Sus hijos aún se encuentran en la escuela de su comunidad y el más pequeño tiene cinco años, él se ha convertido en su compañía y socio por las mañanas en las que atienden los pedidos de muchas personas.Tiene el deseo de incrementar las ventas de su pequeño establecimiento y recurre a vuestra ayuda a fin de obtener la cantidad que requiere para hacer de este sueño un hecho real.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase stock and improve sales at grocery store.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Doña Aurora, a young mother, has the strength which allows her, together with her dear husband, to provide satisfaction and well-being to their beloved family. They decided to start a small general store at home to increase the family’s standard of life but unfortunately ten months later her husband was robbed when transporting merchandise he had bought wholesale from a store to his home and now he has to stay in bed because of the injuries caused and the household suffers great pain and economic crisis. Due to the check-ups and continuous pain, doña Aurora has decided to provide for treatment in spite her economic difficulties and she now sells the products from her general store as a street vendor to increase earnings and provide well-being for her dear husband. Thus she has decided to increase the stock and sale to the population of her town. Let us help this industrious mother succeed so her beloved husband may recover.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

La fuerza es una fortaleza que tiene sin duda Aurora, joven madre de familia que siempre ha trabajo con su querido esposo para procurarle satisfacción y bienestar a su querida familia.Decidieron aperturar una pequeña bodega en casa a fin de incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia, lamentablemente a diez meses de haber consumado este deseo su esposo sufrió un asalto cuando trasladaba la mercadería que había comprado en una tienda al por mayor hacia su domicilio; este hecho trajo una enorme pena y crisis económica en su hogar debido a que los daños que le causaron estos inescrupulosos sujetos le causaron mucho daño y a consecuencia tiene que permanecer postrado en cama hasta su recuperación.Los exámenes y continuos dolores han hecho que Aurora decida someterlo a un tratamiento a pesar de la dificultad monetaria por la que atraviesan y ha decidido vender los productos de su bodega también de manera ambulante a fin de obtener mayores ganancias para procurarle bienestar a su querido esposo. Con este propósito en mente desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos a fin de ofertarlos en mayor cantidad a la población en general de su ciudad.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre logre recobrar la salud de su querido esposo.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to increase sales at a general store.

loans.name: Noemí

texts.es:
Noemí is a young girl who recently got married. She sells vegetables close to her home at a small stand which she sets up efficiently every morning. She has no children yet as she wants to get properly started with her business in order to offer comfort and safety to the little ones that will brighten up her home in the future. She wants to increase sales by purchasing potatoes but she needs the support coming from your noble heart in order to reach her goal. Noemí thanks you in advance for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Noemí, es una joven muchacha que ha contraído matrimonio hace poco, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un pequeño espacio cerca de su domicilio en un stand que ella acondiciona eficientemente todas las mañanas. Aún no tiene hijos porque desea establecerse en este negocio a fin de poder otorgarles con su desempeño bienestar y seguridad a los pequeños que vendrán pronto a alegrar su hogar.Desea incrementar sus ventas con la compra de papa y con este propósito en mente solicita la ayuda de vuestro noble corazón a fin de cristalizar su propósito. Noemí agradece por anticipado tu disposición de apoyarla.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes to increase sales.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Doña Ninfa is a lady with a strife for self improvement, daily she is very successful selling cosmetics, perfumes, creams, lotions, etc. for ladies and gentlemen. She has three young children who need attention and care from their beloved mother and for many years her job has allowed her to meet the needs of her family without problems. Nevertheless, her interest in raising the standard of living of her family makes her request a loan to set up a business selling juice at home. Let us make her dream come true so that her little ones may have more security and peace.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Ninfa, es una mujer con muchos deseos de superación, día a día se desenvuelve con mucho éxito en la venta de cosméticos, perfumes, cremas, lociones, etc; para damas y caballeros.Tiene tres hijos aún pequeños que necesitan de toda la atención y cuidado de su querida madre; la actividad que desempeña en compañía de sus pequeños durante muchos años la ha ayudado a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar sin ningún problema; sin embargo la inquietud de realizar otra actividad en casa para elevar el nivel de vida de casa, la conducen a solicitar un préstamo con el objetivo de instalar una pequeña juguería en ella.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto los pequeños de Ninfa tengan mayor seguridad y tranquilidad.

loans.use: Setting up a business selling juice at home.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina is very happy to see that her business has improved this past year. Two years ago, she decided to purchase a copy machine and offer photocopy services in her own home to the students in her city. She also sells office supplies following her customers’ suggestions. Because of Dina’s efforts, not only is her family happy, but also her neighbors now that they have found a convenient place to buy their much-needed supplies. She is requesting this loan because she would like to expand her business space. Let’s make this hard-working mother’s dream possible so that she can keep helping other families.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Dina, está muy contenta porque ha visto que su negocio ha mejorado en este último año; debido a que hace dos años decidió instalar en su propia casa una fotocopiadora para brindar sus servicios a la comunidad estudiantil de su ciudad, además de este servicio por recomendaciones decidió surtirla con útiles de escritorio. Con esta decisión no sólo esta contenta la familia de Dina sino también sus vecinos debido a que han hallado un cómodo lugar para realizar las compras más urgentes.Ella desea implementar aún más su pequeño establecimiento y por esa razón solicita un préstamo.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta trabajadora madre siga ayudando a más familias.

loans.use: Expansion of business space

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina works tirelessly every day from dawn to see the results of her work. She is an expert pastry baker and produces a huge variety of products such as pies and snacks. In order to distribute her products to different stores in town, doña Guillermina learned the art of bakery when she was a very successful student at an occupational training center. She started production at home in order to generate economic benefits for her family. At the moment she is renting an oven to bake her snacks but she wants to build her own oven so she can increase her production as the flour she uses has suffered a substantial rise in cost and for this reason she has had to reduce the production of snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina, trabaja incansablemente cada día desde muy temprano para ver los frutos de su trabajo.Ella es una experta pastelera que produce una inmensa variedad de productos como: empanadas y bocaditos a base de harina; para distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas de su ciudad.Guillermina aprendió el arte panadero cuando estudió en un centro de formación laboral; al culminar con satisfacción esta etapa de aprendizaje decidió implementar su centro de producción en casa a fin de generar ingresos en beneficio de su familia. Por ahora alquila un horno para la cocción de sus bocaditos y anhela construir su propio horno para incrementar su producción debido a que la harina materia prima de su trabajo durante estas semanas ha sufrido un incremento en su valor muy notable y desde luego su producción ha disminuido.

loans.use: Building of an oven in order to increase production of snacks and pies.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very hard working and honorable lady. Every morning she leaves her small home to offer her delicious desserts throughout the city. She does this because she lacks the money needed to rent a space in a marketplace and this is the only form of income she currently has for her and her family being that her husband’s job is seasonal. This hard working woman wishes to better the quality of life of her two children through her hard work. That is why she is asking for the help of your giving heart in order to obtain the amount needed to invest in ingredients and products needed to continue selling her delicious desserts. Let's facilitate this petition so Graciela con accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Graciela, es una dama muy trabajadora y honrada. Todas las mañanas abandona su pequeña morada para desplazarse por las calles de su ciudad ofertando sus deliciosos postres; realiza esta actividad de esta forma debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente que le permita alquilar un espacio cómodo y seguro ya que muchas veces esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos económicos de su querida familia; debido a que su esposo se desempeña en trabajos eventuales.Esta trabajadora mujer desea incrementar el nivel de vida de sus dos pequeños con su labor y por esta razón acude en búsqueda de la ayuda de tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de recipientes e ingredientes para seguir produciendo sus deliciosos postres.Posibilitemos su petición para que Graciela consiga su propósito.

loans.use: Incremento de capital para acrecentar su producción. <b>Increase her capital to expand her production.<b>

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of containers and ingredients to increase capital for further expansion of business.

loans.name: Sonqollay Group

texts.en:
“Sonqollay”, which means “my heart” in quechua, is a new communal bank which was started with 17 associates. Some of these members were members of other communal banks before.

The associates start to save with an initial deposit of 100, 150, or 200 soles. They then receive a loan which will be invested in their business. The associates work in different types of businesses such as: selling chicken, groceries, fish, cattle, meat, ice cream, bread, food, weaving, and transportation.

Each associate has a different history that they can tell. One example is Liz, who has a small grocery store. She started with only a small amount of capital; with this loan, she will be able to expand her business. On the other hand, Maura is an artisan. She weaves beautiful tapestries and wall hangings. She learned this art from her parents when she was very young. Maura was invited to join this bank by her sister who is a member of another communal bank. Maura hopes to export her tapestries and constantly innovate her art. Meanwhile, Haydee makes ice cream. She started her business with a manual machine; with her savings, she was able to buy an automatic ice cream maker.

The associates need loans of different sizes. Some need 300, 450, or 600 soles reaching a total of 6000 soles in loans from the communal bank. (1USD = almost 3 Peruvian soles). They will invest these loans in buying things such as sugar, milk, beans, rice, fish, soap, flower, butter, animals, wood, and dyes which are necessary for their businesses. Their dreams are to have their own land, house, or business, and for their children to be professionals and improve their economic standing.

loans.use: The associates will invest these loans in buying things such as sugar, milk, beans, rice, fish, soap, flower, butter, animals, wood, and dyes which are necessary for their businesses.

loans.name: Kak

texts.en:
Mr. Kak L., 25, and his wife, Mrs. Pheakdey Chhoun, 25, have been married since 2002. They have one daughter, who is two years old. Kak and his family live along National Road Number Five, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. Pheakdey is working in a garment factory in Pon-Nhea Loe district. Kak is a motorbike taxi driver. He uses his motorbike to carry garment workers from his village to the garment factory, and also to carry people and goods from his village to Phnom Penh.

Kak is requesting this, his third loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $700. He will use this money buy a new motorbike (second hand) for his taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun O. and her husband, Mr. Lorn Nao, have been married since 1991. Savun and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about twenty kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She is in the business of selling fish and weaving silk. She started her business in 1991. Her husband does farming and fishing. They have five children—one son and four daughters. One of the daughters is married and lives in a separate house. Another one of the daughters weaves silk at home, and the other two are studying in the local school. The son helps with the farming.

Savun is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $300. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay for the preparation of her daughter’s loom.

loans.use: To buy silk materials and prepare loom

loans.name: Chariyas

texts.en:
Mrs. Chariyas E., 26, and her husband, Mr. Saren Srey, 27, have been married since 2002. They have two sons, both of whom are still young and are at home. She and her family live along National Road Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. Chariyas sells grocery items in front of her house, which she has been doing since early 2007. Her husband is a driver for a company in Phnom Penh. He travels from home to work by motor taxi.

Chariyas is requesting this, her first loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $600. She will use this money to buy a motorbike for her husband to use to travE. to work in Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To buy one motorbike for her husband to travel to work

payments.comment:
Dear lender,

Mrs. Chariyas El paid off her loan early before contract.

Thank you.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Mrs. Chea S., age 32, is a widow and works selling dry fish at a busy market to make about $5 each day in revenue. She has one child who is not working and her aunt also depends on her income. She would like to request a loan of $700 in order to purchase more dry fish to expand her inventory to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase dry fish to expand her inventory.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna K., age 41, has been married since 1985 and has four children, two sons and two daughters. She is currently in business buying mango and sapodilla from villagers and reselling them in the market. She has been in this business since 2005. In addition, she also buys and resells pork. Her husband has been a construction worker since 2000. Her four children are living under her custody. Her two sons are working as construction workers with her husband, and one daughter is working at a garment factory. The youngest daughter is attending kindergarten in the village.

Vanna is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase mango and sapodilla from villagers to resell in the market, as well as filling the land around her house.

loans.use: To buy fruits to resell, and to fill the land around her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Mr. Phin Ruos, age 36, has been married since 1994 and has two children, one son and one daughter. He is currently in the business of contracting with villagers to build and repair houses. He began his construction contracting business in 1998. His wife, Mrs. Sokhon Yi, age 38, is a housewife. She is looking after her two children at home and sending them to study at school in the village.

Phin is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $800. He will use this money to purchase a motorbike to use in his construction business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mrs. Phal L., age 34, was married in 1994 and has four sons. She has been in the business of growing vegetables since 1991. In addition, she also sells fish in the market. Her husband, Mr. Roeun Dem, age 33, is a fisherman and grows vegetables with his wife. Their children are still young and attend the primary school in the village.

Phal is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to a purchase water pumping machine, seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to expand the fish-selling business.

loans.use:
To purchase a water pumping machine, seeds, fertilizer, and
pesticides, and to expanding expand her fish-selling business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sok Khom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khom Hain, age 45, was married in 1998 and has three sons. She has been in the business of growing, purchasing, and reselling vegetables since 1997. She grows vegetables on her farmland in the village, purchases some vegetables from nearby villagers, and resells to wholesalers at Deum Kor market. Her husband, Mr. Visal Chab, is currently in the business of purchasing vegetables from farmers in Kampong Cham province and transporting those vegetables with his small truck to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. He also assists his wife in growing vegetables in the village. Their young children are studying, but they also help their parents when they are off from school.

Sok Khom is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $800. She will use this money, added to money she has, to buy a small truck for her husband that will be better for transporting the vegetables.

loans.use: To help buy a small truck for her husband

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mich

texts.en:
Mrs. K. Mich, age 29, was married in 2000 and has one son and two daughters. Since she got married, she has been in the business of growing corn and cucumbers on her farmland in the village. Her husband, Mr. Yard Yin, is also in business with her in the village. They sell their products to the middleman who comes to purchase directly in the village.

K. has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and a secondhand water pumping machine.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, plus a secondhand water pumping machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ant

texts.en: Mrs. Ant S., age 24, works with her husband operating a taxi to make on average $6 each day of profit. She has two children who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a new car to replace the old, broken down taxi. A more reliable car will allow them to operate the taxi business more efficiently and save them money that would have been spent on the car repairs.

loans.use: To purchase a new taxi to replace a broken one.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Oy

texts.en:
Mrs. Oy C., age 40, was married in 1971 and has one son and four daughters. She has been in the business of growing vegetables on her farmland in the village since 1979. In addition, she also weaves silk at home, along with her two daughters. The youngest daughter is studying at school in Khsach Kandal district and she assists her mother in weaving silk when she is off from school. Her husband, Mr. Kroeun Rean, is a farmer, and their son helps his father in the farming activities.

Oy has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $1,200. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and some of the money will be used to buy silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides, and to purchase silk materials and pay fees for preparing a loom

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Chea Rin's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin C. was selected to be a group leader by her group members for a loan from MAXIMA. In the group there are two families, including hers.

1. Mrs. Rin C. (shown in photo at the left with her husband) has been married since 1979 and has three sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of growing vegetables since 1980. In addition, she also weaves silk at home. Her husband, Mr. Theun Thon, is currently cooking for wedding ceremonies. All of their children are living under the custody of their parents. Two of their sons are carpenters, and their two daughters are studying at the primary school in the village. Rin has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides in order to expand her farming business.

2. Mrs. Naream C. (shown in photo at the right with her husband) has been married since 2002 and has one son. She has been weaving silk at home since 2000. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production within the same year. Her husband, Mr. Sivath Khos, is a carpenter employed in the village. Naream is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time, in the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to expand farming business; and to buy silk materials and sewing thread, and pay for loom preparation

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Werdi Laksana Group

texts.id:
This group was formed because there is a desire from several members of the society to diligently rear pigs more seriously and with better management.  Previously, they heard of animal rearing groups based on Dinari Foundation, which receive instruction and funding capital.  With 7 members, this group is headed by Ni Kadek Sumarni and is named Kelompok Werdi Laksana.
 Kelompok Werdi Laksana obtained good and proper instruction and training on how to rear pigs, financial management, and methods of warding off diseases.  When the knowledge of the members is adequate, Kelompok Werdi Laksana received a loan, which will be used to purchase superior quality piglets and quality supplies.  This is in order to achieve the maximum output from the level of quality as compared rearing local pigs.
 Having the construction and support from the funding loan, kelompok Werdi Laksana is optimistic that they will be able to materialize a successful business.

 Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer. 

Kelompok ini terbentuk karena adanya keinginan dari beberapa anggota masyarakat untuk menekuni usaha ternak babi lebih serius dan dengan manajemen yang baik. Sebelumnya mereka sudah mendengar tentang kelompok ternak bentukkan Yayasan Dinari yang mendapat binaan dan pinjaman modal. Dengan anggota sebanyak 7 orang, kelompok ini diketuai oleh Ni Kadek Sumarni dan diberi nama Kelompok Werdi Laksana.
Kelompok Werdi Laksana mendapat pembinaan dan pelatihan tentang cara beternak babi yang baik dan benar, manajemen keuangan dan tata cara penanggulangan penyakit. Setelah pengetahuan anggota cukup, Kelompok Werdi Laksana mendapat pinjaman modal yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli bibit babi unggul dan pakan yang berkwalitas. Hal itu dimaksudkan agar hasil yang didapatkan akan lebih maksimal dari sekedar memelihara babi jenis lokal.
Dengan adanya pembinaan dan didukung oleh pinjaman dana, kelompok Werdi Laksana optimis akan dapat melaksanakan usahanya dengan sukses.

loans.use: Purchase superior quality piglets and quality supplies (Membeli  bibit babi jenis unggul dan pakan berkwalitas)

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa H. has been married since 2000 and has one son and one daughter. She has been weaving silk at home since 1998. She learned to weave silk from her sister and started her silk production within the same year. Her husband, Mr. Sal Puth, is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables.

Channa has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice already. Now she is requesting another loan, in the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine for her husband so that he can expand his farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pumping machine for her husband

loans.name: Kung

texts.en: Kung C., age 48, works with her husband, pictured here in her place. They both are electricians, and collectively make around $15 a day in revenue. Mrs. C. and her husband have six children. One works as a laborer in Korea, one is a factory worker, one works at a Casino, and the other three are married and live separately. Mrs. C. would like a loan of $500 to purchase more wires and electrical tools to support and grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase electrician tools and wires for her business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: New Budding (Tunas Baru) Group

texts.id:
Kelompok Tunas Baru (New Budding Group) resides in Desa (Village) Melaya Krajan Kecamatan Melaya. Kelompok Tunas Baru consists of housewives who agree to form a group to rear pigs. Why name the group Tunas Baru (New Budding)? Because the group usually pioneer or become example of growth and is usually imitated by other housewives who do not posses business activities in their family. Each member receive a loan of Rp. 1.500.000,- (about USD160) which will be used as piglet and supplies funding. With this funding each member usually rear 2 piglets. Each year Kelompok Tunas Baru usually sells the pigs twice, once every 6 months. On average profit from each member for each sale is Rp. 200,000,- (about USD20). Besides rearing pigs, Kelompok Tunas Baru also has group conformity standards, which includes meeting routinely, once a month. In such meetings, members mutually share experiences in pig rearing. Most of the times the members gained positive outcome, usually learning better ways of pig rearing. Members are also valid organization is able to regulate the family’s output. The desire of Kelompok Tunas Baru is to become the group that yield by way of assistance of funding from Dinari.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kelompok Tunas Baru beralamatkan di Desa Melaya Krajan Kecamatan Melaya. Kelompok Tunas Baru terdiri dari ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang bersepakat untuk membentuk suatu kelompok yang memiliki usaha beternak babi. Mengapa diberi nama Tunas Baru? Supaya kelompok ini bisa menjadi pelopor atau contoh yang bisa tumbuh dan bisa ditiru oleh ibu-ibu lainnya yang tidak memiliki usaha dalam rumah tangganya. Setiap anggota mendapatkan pinjaman sebesar Rp.1.500.000,- yang dipergunakan sebagai modal bibit dan pakannya. Dengan modal ini setiap anggota bisa memelihara 2 ekor babi penggemukan. Setiap 1 tahun kelompok Tunas Baru bisa menjual babinya 2 kali, dijual per 6 bulan. Rata-rata keuntungan dari masing-masing anggota per panen Rp. 200,000,-. Disamping usaha ternak, kelompok Tunas Baru juga memiliki kebersamaan dalam kelompok seperti pertemuan rutin yang diadakan setiap bulan. Dalam pertemuan ini anggota saling tukar pengalaman dalam beternak babi. Banyak sekali hal positif yang diterima oleh anggota kelompok Tunas Baru, anggota bisa belajar bagaimana cara memelihara ternak yang baik. Anggota juga bisa berorganisasi yang benar dan bisa mengatur pengeluaran rumah tangga. Harapan dari kelompok Tunas baru supaya kelompok ini bisa menjadi kelompok yang berhasil lewat bantuan dana yang diterima dari Dinari.

loans.use: Purchase superior piglets and quality supplies (Membeli bibit babi jenis unggul dan pakan berkwalitas)

loans.name: Phun

texts.en: Mrs. Phun O., age 45, works making traditional cakes and sells them to the people in the local market earning around $4 each day in revenue. She has six children, one who is a taxi driver, one who works selling sugar cane and juice, two who are enrolled in school, and two who are married. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase rice to stock and resell in large quantity for a profit when the price of rice is growing up. This will help increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy rice at a low price to sell when the price goes up.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Noun

texts.en:
Mr. N. Noun is a widower with five children, three sons and two daughters. Two of his children are married and living in different houses with their families. Two sons and one daughter are currently living with him in Po Mongkul village. He is in the business of buying firewood from other provinces and reselling it to a brick kiln at Ponhea Leu district. He started this business in 1995. From 1979 to 1995, he was a farmer and grew rice.    

He has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now he is requesting another loan in the amount of $500. He will use this money to expand his business, by purchasing more firewood from other provinces and reselling it to a brick kiln at Ponhea Leu district.

loans.use:
To buy firewood from other provinces and resell it to the brick 
kiln at Ponhea Leu district.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sendel

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Sendel originated from the village of Manistutu. A large portion the residents’ source of income is from farming. Ni Wayan Sendel and husband, Ketut Sukra, livelihood is from compatible crop rotation. Ni Wayan Sendel borrowed from Dinari Rp. 3.000.000,- (about USD320). This funding will be used to purchase corn seeds and pay for cultivation. Also since it is the rainy season all farmers cultivate compatible crop in the rice fields. Ni Wayan Sendel buys corn seeds Rp. 1.000.000,- (about USD100) for the 2 hectare land. Ni Wayan Sendel and husband do not usually farm the whole plot of land. Ni Wayan Sendel use day labor to plant and maintain the cornfields. Commencing from plowing the land, then planting the corn seeds. When the corn seeds sprout and removing weeds around them. Finally fertilizing them. Until harvest, Ni Wayan Sendel incur labor Rp. 1.500.000,- (USD160). Ni Wayan Sendel is borrowing Rp. 3.000.000,- (USD320), also creates jobs for those who are not able. Gross revenue from the cornfield of Rp. 4.000.000,- (USD425). The net income for Ni Wayan Sendel and husband will be Rp. 1.500.000,- (USD160) per harvest over a period of 3 months.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Sendel berasal dari Desa Manistutu . Sebagian besar mata pencaharian penduduk Manistutu adalah sebagai petani. Ni Wayan Sendel dan suaminya, Ketut Sukra, hidup dari hasil bercocok tanam. Ni Wayan Sendel meminjam modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp.3.000.000,-. Modal ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit jagung dan biaya pemeliharaannya. Apalagi sekarang musim penghujan semua petani beramai-ramai bercocok tanam di sawah. Ni Wayan Sendel membeli bibit jagung Rp.1.000.000,- untuk 2 hektar tanahnya. Ni Wayan Sendel dan suaminya tidak bisa mengerjakan semua kebunnya. Ni Wayan Sendel mencari buruh harian untuk menanami juga memelihara kebun jagungnya. Mulai dari mengolah tanahnya biar gembur , setelah itu baru menanaminya dengan bibit jagung. Setelah tumbuh bibit jagungnya lagi digemburkan sambil mencabuti rumput yang tumbuh disekelilingnya. Terakhir baru memberi pupuk . Sampai panen Ni Wayan Sendel menghabiskan biaya buruh Rp.1.500.000,-. Ni Wayan Sendel senang dengan pinjaman Rp. 3.000.000,- bisa juga membuka lapangan pekerjaan bagi orang yang tidak mampu. Adapun pendapatan kotor dari hasil kebun jagungnya Rp.4.000.000,-. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang didapat Ni Wayan Sendel dan Suaminya adalah Rp.1.500.000,- per panen selama masa pemeliharaan 3 bulan.

loans.use: Purchase corn seeds and pay for labor (Membeli bibit jagung dan biaya pekerja)

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Sokunthea has been married since 1990 with two sons. She is a teacher and currently teaching at a primary school in Ponhea Leu district. She has been a teacher since 1990. Her husband, Mr. SAO Nheb, is in business of running a motor taxi with a carriage at the back. He is currently transporting people from villages to work at the garment factory at Ponhea Leu district. Their sons are studying at the local school. They are working hard and hope their children can be sent to pursue higher education.     

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times already. Now she is requesting another loan in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to buy a motorbike for her husband so that he can improve his transportation service.

loans.use:
To buy a motorbike for running romork (motor taxi with 
carriage at the back)

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun C., 22, is married and works as a housewife cooking food and looking after her little four children. Her husband is the one who supplement her household. He works as a construction worker earning typically about $4each day. Her mother living with her is employed as a servant in a house and makes around $35 each month. Mrs. Sun C. is humble to ask for a loan to repair her house building a solid roof and wall around to protect from the leaking dring a rainy season.

loans.use: To repair her house installing a solid roof and wall to protect from the leaking during a rainy season.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Nengah Darik

texts.id:
Currently, chocolate production is very essential support to Ni Nengah Darik’s family. Because the price of chocolate is high at Rp. 12.000,- (USD1.30) per kilogram. Ni Nengah Darik owns a cocoa plantation of 2 hectare. Ni Nengah Darik and her husband converted her farmland to cocoa plantation. However, if the cocoa plants are not well maintained, the production will not be good. Therefore Ni Nengah Darik and her husband borrowed from Dinari Rp. 3.000.000,- (USD320) to buy cocoa seeds. The cost of each cocoa seedling is Rp. 500,- (USD0.50). Ni Nengah Darik buys 400 seedlings at a total cost of Rp. 2.000.000,- (USD200). The balance funding of Rp. 1.000.000,- (USD100) used for medicine because cocoa pest is vicious. The effect of the cocoa pest destroys the fruits turning them black. Ni Nengah Darik spray about Rp. 1.000.000,- (USD100) of medicine on the pest. If sprayed, the cocoa fruits will be good. Every fortnight, Ni Nengah Darik harvest 60 kilogram which can be sold for Rp. 12.000 (USD1.30) per kilogram.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Saat ini hasil coklat sangat menunjang kebutuhan keluarga Ni Nengah Darik. Karena harga coklat sangat mahal bisa mencapai Rp.12.000,- per satu kilogram. Ni Nengah Darik memiliki kebun coklat 2 hektar . Ni Nengah Darik dan suaminya tidak lagi bertani, semua sawahnya ditanami coklat. Tetapi coklat tanpa dipelihara dengan baik hasilnya tidak bagus. Oleh sebab itu Ni Nengah Darik dan suaminya meminjam modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp. 3.000.000,- untuk membeli bibit coklat. Harga satu pohon bibit coklat Rp.500,-. Ni Nengah Darik membeli bibit coklat 400 pohon dengan harga keseluruhan Rp. 2.000.000,-. Sisa modal Rp.1.000.000,- dipakai untuk membeli obat - obatan, karena hama coklat saat ini semakin ganas. Efek sampingan yang ditimbulkan oleh hama coklat , biji coklat membatu dan busuk warnanya hitam ( kangker coklat ). Ni Nengah Darik menghabiskan obat semprot hama coklat hampir Rp.1.000.000,-.Kalau sudah disemprot buah coklat bijinya bagus. Setiap 2 minggu Ni Nengah Darik bisa panen 60 kg dengan harga Rp.12.000,- per kg .

loans.use: Purchase medicine and cocoa seedlings (membeli obat-obatan dan bibit kako)

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sarum (age 49) has been married since 1979 and has two sons and two daughters. She has been in the business of growing bananas since 2004. In addition, she purchases mango from villagers she contracts with and resells it in the market. She is also running a grocery store from home. Her husband is a farmer and is currently growing rice and vegetables on his farm land in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $500. She will use this money to purchase mango from villagers, and then resell the mango in the market, and to buy more grocery items for her stock.

loans.use: Purchasing mango from villagers she contracts with and buying more grocery items for her stock

loans.name: Try

texts.en: Mrs. Try S., age 24, runs a stand in front of primary school selling various kinds of biscuits and candies to students passing by, making around $1.50 each day of profit. She has four children, one who works with her husband repairing tires and the rest are students. She would like to request a loan of $600 in order to purchase a motorcycle to use for improving her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for improving her business transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Phun is a widow with four children, one son and two daughters. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1967. However, during the Khmer Rough regime she stopped weaving and she began her silk production again after the regime collapsed in 1979. Currently, her four children are living with her in the same house in Khbal Koh village. Three of her children have jobs and only youngest daughter is studying.      
 
She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and buying flyer wood for repairing her house.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom, and buying flyer
wood for repairing her house.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Thoeun has been married since 1987 and has four children, one son and three daughters. She has been in the business of running a grocery store since 1995. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home. Her husband, Mr. YOU Khat, is a farmer. He raises cows in the village. Their children are studying in the local school.
She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time for the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to purchase more grocery items for her stock so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Luh Nandi

texts.id:
