Besides farming, Ni Luh Nandi also rear cows. Ni Luh Nandi rears 3 mother cows since they were 6 months old. At this moment, Ni Luh Nandi, requires additional funding of Rp. 5,000,000,- (about USD530) which will be used to purchase another mother cow. Because currently with 3 cows it has not generate maximum returns. 2 cows are currently pregnant. In order to minimize the cost of feed, sufficient greens like grass, leaves of the jackfruit, and other tyoes of greens thus requiring lots of effort from Ni Luh Nandi to cut grass everyday. Annually, net income from the off-springs is Rp. 2.500.000,- (USD260) per off-spring. Thus from the earnings from this effort will be used to pay the family’s expenses and children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Selain sebagai petani Ni Luh Nandi juga memiliki usaha beternak sapi. Ni Luh Nandi memelihara 3 induk sapi yang sudah dipelihara dari umur 6 bulan. Saat ini Ni Luh Nandi membutuhkan tambahan modal sebesar Rp.5,000,000,- yang nantinya akan dipergunakan untuk membeli 1 induk lagi. Karena saat ini dengan memelihara 3 induk sapi masih dirasa belum menghasilkan hasil yang maksimal. Dua induk sapi yang Luh Dandi pelihara saat ini sedang dalam keadaan hamil. Untuk pengeluaran pakannya tidak seperti sapi penggemukan , cukup dengan hijauan seperti rumput, daun nangka, dan masih banyak lagi hijauan yang lain Tetapi ini membutuhkan tenaga Ni Luh Nandi untuk menyabit rumput tiap hari . Setiap 1 tahun dari hasil anaknya saja Ni Luh Nandi mendapatkan keuntungan bersih Rp.2.500.000,-.per ekor.Jadi dari keuntungan yang diperoleh ini bisa dipergunakan untuk biaya kebutuhan hidupnya dan juga biaya sekolah anak –anaknya.

loans.use: Purchase cows (Membeli sapi)

loans.name: Leakhena

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Leakhena is single and lives with her old mother and other brother and sister. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 2004. Her mother is also weaving silk at home with her, which she learned to weave in 1965. Her sister is assisting her to weave at home as well. 
 
She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan for the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to buy more land next to her house, so that in the future she will build a house for her sister when she gets married.

loans.use: To buy more land next to her house

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Manik

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Manik owns a general store. Ni Nyoman Manik has two children. Her elder child is already married while the younger is in grade 5 SD. Her husband is a farmer. Daily, Ni Nyoman Manik commences work at 4 am. Waking up Ni Nyoman Manik, ready herself to get to the State morning market. Ni Nyoman Manik purchases all essential supplies for the general store. Returning home by 7 am, Ni Nyoman Manik starts cooking fish, prepares rice, boils vegetables, makes a variety of cakes, and finally sugar syrup for ice drinks. Ni Nyoman Manik besides selling prepared food also sells the raw ingredients. Funds from the loan from Dinari Rp. 4.000.000,- (about USD425) will be used as working capital for funding the purchase of essential supplies for the general store. Prior to obtaining this loan from Dinari, daily profit earned was Rp. 25.000, - Rp. 30.000,- (between USD2.60 to 3.00). With this loan from Dinari, daily profit is expected to increase thus allowing Ni Nyoman Manik to fund her child’s education and the family’s essential expenses.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Manik memiliki usaha warung yang sudah lama ditekuninya. Ni Nyoman Manik memiliki 2 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah menikah dan anaknya yang kedua baru kelas 5 SD. Suami Ni Nyoman Manik bekerja sebagai petani. Setiap hari Ni Nyoman Manik memulai usahanya mulai jam 04.00 pagi. Bangun tidur NI Nyoman Manik sudah bersiap –siap untuk pergi ke pasar pagi di Negara. Ni Nyoman Manik membeli semua kebutuhan warungnya . Sampai dirumah jam 07.00 Ni Nyoman Manik mulai memasak ikan, membuat nasi, merebus sayur, membuat aneka kue, dan terakhir membuat gula untuk es. Ni Nyoman Manik selain membuat makanan siap saji, juga menjual makanan mentah. Modal yang di pinjam dari Dinari Rp.4.000.000,- akan dipergunakan untuk modal usaha yaitu membeli kebutuhan warungnya. Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, keuntungan yang di dapat perhari Rp. 25.000,- sd Rp. 30.000,-. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari keuntungan perhari diharapkan bisa meningkat karena dengan keuntungan ini Ni Nyoman Manik bisa menyekolahkan anaknya dan untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: Add capital to fund the general store business (Menambah modal usaha untuk melengkapi fasilitas warungnya)

loans.name: Yoeum

texts.en: Mrs. Yoeum H., 26, is married with three under school-aged children and works selling variety of grocery products to the people in her area, making on average around $5 each day in revenue. Her husband is employed by a private company and typically makes $3 each day. Mrs. Yoeum H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation. This will enable her to purchase grocery products from a market further away. It will make her work faster, easier and will save her a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business's transportation.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Putu

texts.id:
Ni Putu M. is a mother of 2 children who works hard everyday. She wakes up early to sell merchandise around her village, Manistutu. Her husband, I Kt Sutama works as a farmer. Besides peddling, Ni Putu M. owns a pig farm with 11 pigs. Ni Putu M. hopes to get $550 loan from Dinari. Ni Putu M. hopes to purchase 11 pigs for $28 each, or $318 each. Her children are also involved in helping Ni Putu M. running th farm after school. Ni Putu M. buys pig feeds directly from supplier as it is cheaper. Each day she spends about $2.20 for feed mix, like concentrate and wheat. Ni Putu M. also pays special attention to her penś cleanliness. She works hard to run her simple wooden pig farm. After 6 month, the 11 grom piglets can be sold for $880. The cost for feeds and piglet is around $660, so she earns $220 profit each 6 month cycle. Ni Putu M. is passionate in pig farming. SHe hopes that Dinari can support her business.

Translated from Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Putu M. ibu dari 2 orang anak yang setiap hari harus bekerja keras bangun pagi-pagi untuk berjualan keliling di desa Manistutu. Suaminya, I Kt Sutama, bekerja sebagai petani. Selain sebagai pedagang Ni Putu M. memiliki usaha beternak babi sebanyak 11 ekor. Ni Putu M. mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari sebesar Rp.5.000.000,-. Ni Putu M. membeli 11 bibit babi dengan harga perekor Rp.250.000,- jadi semuanya Rp.2.750.000,-. Ni Putu M. tidak sendiri mengerjakan semua ini, anaknya tetap membantu setelah pulang sekolah.Untuk pakan Ni Putu M. langsung membeli kesuplayer biar lebih murah. Setiap hari modal yang dikeluarkan untuk biaya pakan Rp.20.000,- untuk campuran pakan seperti dedak dan konsentrat. Untuk kebersihan kandang sangat diperhatikan oleh Ni Putu M.. Walaupun dengan kandang kayu Ni Putu M. tetap bersemangat untuk memelihara babi. Setelah 6 bulan 11 babi penggemukan dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.8.000.000,-. Setelah dipotong pakan dan modal bibit yang menghabiskan biaya Rp.6.000,000 keuntungan bersihnya menjadi Rp.2.000.000,-. Ni Putu M. senang dengan usahanya ini , harapannya Dinari bisa terus membantu usahanya ini .

loans.use: Purchse piglets and feeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more grocery products o meet her growing customer demands.

loans.name: Rany

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Rany has been married since 1999 and has one son and one daughter. She has been in the business of running a grocery store since 2006. In addition, she is also weaving silk at home. Her husband, Mr. YOU Khat, is a farmer. He is raising cows in the village. Her husband attended year 9 at high school but Rany did not finish primary school. Therefore, they hope they can send their two children to pursue higher education. They are currently studying at local school in the village.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA two times already. Now she is requesting another loan for $600. She will use this money to purchase more grocery items for her stock to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchasing more grocery items for her stock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Naran

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Naran is single and currently living with her old parent and other four brothers and sisters. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1984. Her mother is also weaving silk and one of her sisters is weaving at home as well. Her father is assisting to spin thread and silk.  
 
She has borrowed money from MAXIMA eight times already. Now she is requesting another loan of the amount of $300. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.name: Sifatbonu

texts.en:
D. Sifatbonu is 40-year old lady. Sifatbonu and her husband, who is an entrepreneur, have a large family. There are three children of school age.

Sifatbonu is working hard to earn an honest livelihood. For 13 years already Sifatbonu has been running her own business. She started with baking national bread, which is called “lepeshka”, and other types of bread. She gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

Initially Sifatbonu only baked the bread and lepeshka but never sold them herself. Gradually the business expanded and the children grown up. Today it is the family business where the husband and the elder daughter are helping, since now Sifatbonu has a trading place in the central market of the city. The family business is stable; Sifatbonu has the clientele that allows her to improve the income of the family.

Sifatbonu has been a client of IMON for 2 years already, having a positive credit history. Today Sifatbonu requests 750.00 US Dollars in order to purchase flour, firewood, and coal for baking lepeshka and bread. Sifatbonu would like to ensure that she is ready to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of flour, firewood, coal

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. P. has been a member of our programme for a long time, but she was resting for months due to a problem with her arm. She has three children and she is supporting them in school and in everything. Her husband is a good carpenter and this is another alternative income for her and the family.

She is restarting again from the first loan and she planning to use this one to start up an elei printing business (block printing on cloth).

She works on her elei prints six days of the week including Saturdays, and she only delivers her goods on Saturdays. Her usual customers are flea market owners, retail shop owners, and even village people. She is young and active and she is making a new start now.

loans.use: Buy materials for  elei printing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mr. N. Vanny has been married since 1987 and has five children, two sons and three daughters. He is currently weaving silk at home. He learned to weave silk from his wife and started his silk production in 1993. He used to serve the army during the civil war. His wife has been a silk weaver since 1980. It's a skill she learned from her neighbor.  Now Vanny and his wife have trained their eldest daughter to weave as well.  
 
He has borrowed money from MAXIMA six times already. Now he is requesting another loan of the amount of $500. He will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms, and to set up another loom for his daughter.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the looms. 
And to set up another loom for his daughter.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
M. Ibrohim is 19 years old. He is not yet married and lives together with his parents and three sisters. His parents did not spare themselves working hard to raise him and his three younger sisters. Today he is helping his parents and earning for his future and the future of his sisters. 

Ibrohim has been working since he was sixteen. For three years already Ibrohim has been producing the eastern sweets which are called “nabot”. Nabot is made from sugar syrup that is boiled in a huge cauldron for several hours. After cooking, the nabot is left in the cauldron for 7-10 days to become hard. Then the nabot is taken out of the cauldron and is ready for use. The nabot is very sweet and health-giving. It helps with fever and stomach diseases. People say that in ancient times, when one was traveling, he would take with him bread and the nabot, both giving strength and energy. 

Today Ibrohim requests 600.00 US Dollars. He is planning to buy  sugar for producing nabot. This is Ibrohim’s first loan; however he is quite sure that he shall pay it in 12 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of sugar for producing of the eastern sweets “nabot”

loans.name: Lagi

texts.en:
Lagi A. is a widow with seven children. Her husband died some years ago and she is still fighting for her children’s future. She has had no job and she is now joining the SPBD programme for help.

This is her first loan and her plan is to start up a pancake business, together with her existing plantation. She is from the village of Saoluafata where a secondary school is located, and she is planning to sell pancakes at this school for more money. Lagi is striving to the limit to make sure her children will have a better education and be successful in the future.

loans.use: Buy chemicals and bush knives for her little farm, and a bag of flour and a fryer for her pancakes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Shahrabonu

texts.en:
Faizullaeva Shahrabonu is a 40-year old loving mother of three children. The elder son is already a student and the younger are going to school. Shahrabonu and her husband, the cook, are dreaming that all three of their children shall have higher education.

Shahrabonu has been selling bread and the national bread “lepeshka” in the local market of Chklalovsk city. She has been already in this business for 14 years. Bread is the main dish on any table. That is why Sahrabonu’s business is rather successful and stable; she has had her bulk buyers for many years already, which allows her to have a stable income for her family.

Shahrabonu has already taken a loan from IMON and was very accurate and precise in her payments. Today she requests 350.00 US Dollars as she is planning to purchase more bread in order to enlarge the range of goods. Shahrabonu promises to pay the loan in 6 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of bread for enlarging the range of goods.

loans.name: Feao

texts.en:
Feao is an active and responsible mother who is a member of Vaiusu Center. Feao is thirty-nine years of age, and she has four children. Her husband died in 2003 while her children were still very young and she is still fighting to make them survive. Her business is a Flea Market and also she runs a successful shop in her village.

These are the sources of income she is relying on and she is grateful for this opportunity she has to borrow money from us to sustain her business. She is honest and she is one of our most successful business women ever since she joined the programme.

loans.use: Buy material and paints for Elei Printing and inventory for her shop

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. Vanny has been married since 1982 and has four children one son and three daughters. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor and started her silk production in 1985. Her husband is assisting her to spin thread and silk at home. He sometimes helps her weave as well. Two of their children got married and live in different houses with their families. The other two are living with them, one is sewing cloth and another one is studying in the local school. 

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. Now she is requesting another loan of the amount of $200. She will use this money to purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
To purchase silk materials, sewing thread, and fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom

loans.name: Thong

texts.en:
Mrs. H. Thong has been married since 1997 and has one son and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother, and started her silk production in 1995. Her husband is running a motor taxi business. Their two children are studying in the local school. 

She is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the first time of the amount of $400. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike for her husband to help his motor taxi business, which could help him to provide better service because the current motorbike is too old.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to run a motor taxi

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MAXIMA Mikroheranhvatho Co., Ltd. - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Faasalafa

texts.en:
Faasalafa is a thirty-eight-year-old mother from the village of Satapuala. She is an old member of our programme and this is her second loan.

Faasalafa makes and sells pork buns as her business. She sells them at the village primary school and she also supplies her pork buns to shops on the Mulifanua wharf.

She sells five days of the week and she usually gets about $150 a day. This is her second loan and she is looking forward to receiving other loans to help her with home improvement. She is one of our most reliable members and she is still very active.

loans.use: Buy a pot, flour, yeast, and other ingredients for her pork bun business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Mrs. Hoa R. is 49 years old and is a widow with three children. She works as a housewife cooking food for her family. Her children work together to raise their standard of living. One of them runs a groceR. stand selling provisions of  food to the people in her community. She makes on average around $5 each day in revenue. Another one is employed by a private company earning around $70/ each month and the rest of whom is married and stays separate. Mrs. Hoa R. hopes to use this loan to purchase extra groceR. products to expand her daughter stand in order to meet her client’s need and make more of a profit.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her daughter to meet her clients' needs.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mohammad Hashim

texts.en:
Mohammad Hashim lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and is the sole breadwinner for his family.

He has a carpentry shop with a number of talented apprentices, but he needs to complete his tools of the trade, so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy new carpentry tools. In that way he will be able to attract more customers and make a good income to help his family whom he dearly loves.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his carpentry shop

loans.name: Reth

texts.en: Reth S. is a 34 years old, married, and has two children. She works by selling various grocery products to her community, and makes on average a total of $10 or $12 a day. Her husband is a blacksmith who makes about $10 a day in revenue. She has two children, one who is a student and another one who is currently too young to attend school. She would like a loan of $1000 to purchase more blacksmithing tools and resources for her husband’s business, and better support her family.

loans.use: Purchasing blacksmith tools and materials

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Hochiniso

texts.en:
M. Hochiniso is 43 year-old mother of 2 children. Her husband is a driver, and they both are loving parents. Hochiniso and her husband are working hard to ensure the future for their kids.

Hochiniso has had her business for 15 years already. She started as a seller of clothing. Gradually she became more involved in this business and decided to open her own trading place. Now she is selling women's clothes in the store, which is located in the central local market.

Today Hochiniso requests 3,400.00 Somoni ($1000 US) for purchasing new women's clothes to sell. This is her second loan with IMON. Hochiniso paid her first loan in a timely manner. Now she would like to thank everybody for supporting her and to ensure she shall pay the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Purchasing of new goods for increasing stock

loans.name: Mohammad Ali

texts.en:
Mohammad Ali lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and a very talented young man. He lives with his own family and has a retail shop where he works part-time.

He would like to expand his business so he wants to take out an individual loan to buy extra inventory such as baskets, powders, shampoos, and different food items to attract more clients and make a good monthly income to support his family. This will assure him and his family of a brighter future. He is very happy to have the opportunity to get this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like baskets, powders, shampoos

loans.name: Ambarniso

texts.en:
I. Ambarniso is 39 years old. Her husband is an entrepreneur. Together they are raising three children.

Ambarniso is selling clothes for kids in the central local market. She has been in this business for more then 10 years. Her business is very stable, which allows her to improve the level of living of her family. The income from her business allowed her to repair her house.

She has been the client of IMON for about 6 years. For this period of time she has shown herself to be a very accurate client with positive credit history. Today Ambarniso requests 3,400.00 Somoni ($1000 US) for purchasing new kids' clothes to sell. She thanks everybody who is supporting her and shall pay the loan in 5 months.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothes for kids

loans.name: Thorn

texts.en: Mrs. Thorn B., age 45, runs a stand at home selling variety of grocery products to the people in her community, making on average around $15 each day in revenue. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and typically makes around $7.50 each day of income. She has 5 children; One of them is employed as a garment worker making $80 each month and the rest of them are students. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her clients’ needs.

loans.use: To expand her inventory of grocery products.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Burgunova

texts.en:
M. Burgunova lives in Spitamen. She has been a client if MicroInvest only since 2007 but she has shown herself to be a reliable client who understands and respects MicroInvest loan procedures.

Mrs. Burgunova is very experienced in her business (about 30 years). Her stand is located at a flea market. She is engaged in selling summer shoes and needles. She works with a direct supplier that is why the prices for her goods are lower than typical flea market prices.

Working in a market, however, she meets with stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers. This will allow her to carry out new business plans and to develop her existing business. Mrs. Burgunova is requesting a loan of US$ 475 to widen her existing inventory and thus improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to expand her existing inventory and to improve her financial situation

loans.name: Turdiev

texts.en:
Turdiev Z. lives in Nausky district, Tajikistan; he is married and has 5 children. He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he has shown himself to be a serious and strongly-motivated client. The amount he has been allowed to borrow has continually increased and that shows the stability of his business.

Mr.Turdiev is engaged in food production (preparation of various pies and doughnuts, such as traditional pies named “cheburecky” and sambusa). He is very experienced in this business, having been in it for about 20 years.

Working in this business sector, he has to face stiff competition; that is why he wants to widen his existing business by adding new recipes to his offerings. This will allow him to increase the family income and to plan for new business development.

Mr.Turdiev is requesting a loan of US$ 825 for this purpose.

loans.use: for the further development of his baked goods business

loans.name: Kasulu D Group

texts.en:
Amina, age 24, has a daughter who is 3 years old. She owns a food vendor business, which she began 3 years ago. Her business is open from 8am to 8pm daily, and she makes a monthly profit of about $227.

Amina hopes to take a loan with Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business and to open a salon business. She will be sharing this loan with her subgroup members who are shop owners, clothing saleswomen, and food vendors.

In the picture, Amina is first on the right.

loans.use: To increase her business and to open a salon

payments.comment: This business was accidently posted with a loan term of 16 months instead of 16 weeks. Tujijenge is apologizing for this mistake. The loan term has now been completed as of this month and Kasulu D group has repaid the loan successfully.

loans.name: Thei

texts.en: Mrs Thei N., 22, is married with one little kid and lives with her husband in SiemReap province, where is the vital tourist site in Cambodia. She works selling souvenir products in front of Angkor Temple to a number of tourists passing through. By the time, her husband work driving a trailer attached with a motorcycle to transport passengers making around $5 per day. Mrs. Thei N. hopes to use this loan to change her husband old trailer which is frequently fixed and waste her family a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase  a  new trailer for her husband to operate a business.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong P., 47, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in a part of Siem Reap province, Angkor complex, where is the main tourism site in Cambodia. She works as a housewife, while her husband is the one who supplement her household by producing a kind of Khmer musical instrument called “ TRO”. He can typically make on average around $2 each day from selling his outputs to a number of tourists passing by. One of her children, meanwhile, works selling souvenir items opposite Taprum temple and some of them work assist their father in producing “ TRO” and a few kinds of instruments. Mrs. Hong P. and her husband would like to request for a loan to help them purchase woods to expand their inventory during this coming high season.

loans.use: To purchase wood to produce more quantity of instruments to meet her clients' demands.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for CREDIT, a partner of World Relief - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Morries I Group

texts.en:
Enid is 32 years old and married with five children of ages 15, 13, 7, 5 and 10 months.
She plans to buy more products for her store.
With the extra profits, she intends to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for BRAC Uganda - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en:
Rose is 32 yrs old. She is a single mother of 3 children.
She plans to buy a plot of land and also pay school fees for her children from the profits gained from her public pay phone business.

loans.use: Buy her own public pay phone

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 40 year-old woman. She is married with three children.
Her current business is making and selling bricks.  Teddy intends to renovate her rental houses from the profits made out of the business.

loans.use: To buy land where she can make bricks for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old.
She is a widow with five children. Currently, she wants to venture into the business of fruit vending. She would like to begin another business from the profits made.

loans.use: To buy a fridge so that she can make more fruit juice

loans.name: Safina's Group

texts.en:
Safina is 30 years old and married with 3 children. She sells matooke (green banana food) and tomatoes in the market to earn a living.
She  intends to use the profits to buy more foodstuffs from the villages. In addition she plans to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Julliet's Group

texts.en: Julliet's venture is selling matooke (green bananas). She intends to use the profits to buy a plot of land, pay school fees for her children and also expand her current business.

loans.use: To buy more matooke (green bananas) and  increase her stock

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret is 34 years old and married with 5 children. Her current business is selling charcoal on a small scale.
She intends to construct a house from the profits gained and also pay school fees for the children

loans.use: To buy more trees for making charcoal

loans.name: Asencia

texts.es:
For the last 28 years Asencia H. has dedicated her work to the sale of grocery items in the marketplace in the Villa Adela area. She began with very few products. Currently she also organizes games of chance but with the products she sells. In other words, they organize their own form of trades using clothing items and grocery items. She gets a small commission for organizing the events. Asencia lives only with her son, as she became a widow not too long ago. She lives in a home next door to two other tenants. She needs the loan to be able to increase her inventory and be able to buy items at wholesale prices, thus reducing her costs and increasing the income for her and her youg son.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Wendy Wise

Asencia H., hace 28 años que se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en un puesto de su propiedad en el mercado de la zona de Villa Adela, comenzó con muy pocos productos, pero los más importantes de la canasta familiar. Actualmente se dedica de forma paralela a organizar juegos de azar pero con los productos de su puesto, es decir que juegan una especie de Pasanaku con prendas de vestir y víveres, donde ella recibe una pequeña comisión por organizadora y aprovecha de vender su mercadería. Asencia vive con su hijo, puesto que enviudó no hace mucho, en una casa junto a dos de sus inquilinos. Ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, comprar víveres al por mayor, lo que resulta una reducción en el gasto y un mejor ingreso para ella y su pequeño hijo.

loans.use: Ella precisa de capital para poder incrementar su mercadería, comprar víveres al por mayor, lo que resulta una reducción en el gasto y un mejor ingreso para ella y su pequeño hijo.   <b>She needs the loan to increase her inventory and buy at wholesale prices in order to decrease costs and increase income for her and her son.<b>

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora G. Flores is the mother of four school-aged children and is married to a haulage contractor. She works as a vender in seasonal markets, which means that depending on the time of the year, she buys her products and sells them in the principle markets of the city. Her high sales seasons come generally at the holidays near the end of the year, at artesanal markets, at Carnival (similar to Mardi Gras), and during the feast of San Juan.

Along with this activity, Nora dedicates her free time to making slips and bolts of cloth, which she subsequently sells by walking around the markets and plazas in her area. In addition, taking advantage of all the trips that she makes to buy and sell merchandise, Nora sees to buying replacement parts for electrical and home appliances, an activity which over time and little by little has become a wholesale business.

Nora needs money in order to strengthen her seasonal market stall, since the season of Carnival is approaching as well as the beginning of the school term, which are both good times for Nora to generate strong income.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Nora G. Flores es madre de 4 hijos, todos en edad escolar, y casado con un transportista, se dedica al comercio de mercadería de temporada, es decir, dependiendo la época del año, ella compra sus productos y vende en las principales ferias de la ciudad. Sus temporadas de venta alta generalmente son las fiestas de fin de año, alasitas, carnavales y la fiesta de San Juan.

Paralelamente a esta actividad, Nora en sus ratos libres se dedica a la confección de enaguas, y centros de tela, las que posteriormente las vende deambulando en las ferias y plazas de su zona. De igual forma, aprovechando sus viajes que realiza tanto para vender como para la compra de mercadería, Nora se encarga de comprar repuestos para electrodomésticos, y línea blanca, actividad que poco a poco y con el tiempo ya la ha convertido en mayorista.

Nora requiere de dinero para poder dar más fuerza a su puesto de venta de mercadería de temporada, ya que próximamente se acercan las fiestas de carnavales y el inicio de clases, que son una buena oportunidad para ela de generar buenos ingresos.

loans.use: To strengthen her seasonal market stall.

loans.name: Severina

texts.es:
Severina F. Quispe is the owner of a grocery store located in her own home. It is a rather well-stocked store which over time, almost 8 years, has become one of the most important in the area. Severina has even installed a long distance and local phone booth in the store in order to better accommodate her clients.

Along with this activity, Severina works buying and selling hats and women’s shawls, which she displays in her store, often selling them on credit.

Currently Severina lives in her own house along with her children and their spouses, but she needs money in order to improve and better supply her store. Her aim is to increase her income and thereby assist her children and soon her grandchildren.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Severina F. Quispe, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes ubicada en su mismo domicilio, es una tienda bastante bien surtida, que con el paso del tiempo, casi 8 años, se ha convertido en una de las tiendas más importantes de la zona, al extremo de que Severina ya ha instalado una central de llamadas de larga distancia y local para mayor comodidad de sus clientes.

Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de sombreros y mantas para la mujer de pollera, mismas que aprovecha y vende dentro de su propia tienda y muchas veces al crédito.

Actualmente Severina vive en casa propia al lado de sus hijos y sus parejas, pero precisa dinero para poder incrementar y abastecer mejor la tienda, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y así colaborar a sus hijos y próximamente a sus nietos.

loans.use: To improve and better supply her store.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana Inés S. Gonzáles is one of the presidents of the association called Comunal Luz del Ande del Centro Focal de Villa Adela. She works with all sorts of stationery and serigraphy. She has her own workshop in her house. Her works in serigraphy can be done on paper or on any other type of support.

Thanks to her knowledge in serigraphy, she has been able to open up a small library which she herself administrates and provide all sorts of reading materials. She used to work at a printing shop but since her pregnancy hasn't been able to continue due to the toxic materials such as gasoline, metalic inks, etc. and she din't want to put her and her baby's health at risk. Due to this, she had to leave this job.

Ana is requesting a loan to purchase basic materials to do her printing jobs and to purchase more stationery since school is about to start and this is the time when she makes the most money.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ana Inés S. Gonzáles, es el nombre completo de una de la presidenta de la Asociación Comunal Luz del Ande del Centro Focal de Villa Adela. Su principal actividad es el trabajo con todo tipo de papelería y serigrafía. Ana posee su propio negocio y un pequeño taller ubicado en su propia casa, desde ahí realiza los trabajos en serigrafía a pedido tanto en papel como en cualquier otro tipo de soporte. Gracias a la serigrafía ella ha podido reunir sus productos y aperturar una librería, la que ella misma administra y provee de todo tipo de material, tanto de escritorio como escolar. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una imprenta, pero desde su embarazo, no ha podido continuar, puesto que los materiales tóxicos como la gasolina, las tintas metálicas, tiner y otros afectaban tanto su salud como la salud de su hijo, por tal motivo tuvo que dejarlo. Ana precisa de capital para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de materia prima para sus trabajos de imprenta, principalmente lo que refiere a la papelería, tomando en cuenta la proximidad de la época de inicio de clase, lo que le representará en caso de prever una mejor ganancia para su negocio.

loans.use: To purchase basic material for printing and to purchase more stationery

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
Ayda M. is single and a mother of 3 children. She makes 'saltenas' (Bolivian sweet meat pastries) with the help of her older son who helped her buy 2 industrial ovens which they use to the fullest to keep up with demand.

Ayda has been doing this for the past 20 years. She learned this trade from her husband whom she met when she was just a little girl and used to only sell 'saltenas'. She now has passed on the trade to her older son.

At this time, Ayda is owner along with her son of the 2 industrial ovens which they use to make 'saltenas'. They also own 4 small and mobile ovens which they distribute along the areas of El Alto.

Her older son is currently going to college and is almost done. His major is in systems engineering. This is Ayda's major reason as to why she needs a loan so that she can help her son with tuition and to invest into their business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Ayda M., soltera y madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas, oficio que realiza con su hijo mayor, quien la incentivó para la adquisición de dos hornos industriales, con los cuales pueden hacer frente a la demanda existente. Ayda se dedica a este rubro hace más de 20 años, cuando ella era pequeña y era solo vendedora. En uno de esos puestos conoció al que fue su esposo, quien le enseño el oficio y ahora ella lo ha transmitido a su hijo mayor. Actualmente Ayda es dueña, conjuntamente con su hijo de dos hornos industriales para el horneado de salteñas, y de cuatro hornos móviles y pequeños, los cuales los distribuye en los más concurridos barrios de la ceja de El Alto. Su hijo mayor, el soporte de su negocio esta cursando los últimos cursos de la carrera de Ingeniería de Sistemas, motivo por el cual Ayda precisa de dinero para poder colaborar a su hijo con sus estudios, y al mismo tiempo reforzar la inversión en insumos para su negocio.

loans.use: To invest into business and to help pay for college tuition

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina H. is an owner of a little convenience store. She's had this store for more than 19 years. She was able to purchase her merchandise with the loans she obtained from Pro Mujer. Señora Regina is married and has 9 children. Her children are all married and some already have kids of their own.

Señora Regina gets her merchandise from Santa Cruz at a wholesale price which she then sells at a profit. She's also a great cook and she prepares special dishes at request only. This gives her the opportunity to make a little extra cash on the side.

At this time, she would like to purchase more merchandise for her convenience store since business is going great. She would like to continue buying at whole sale prices so that she can make more profit.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Regina H., es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes, misma que la tiene hace mas de 19 años, iniciando sus primeras compras gracias a los créditos otorgados por Pro Mujer. La Señora Regina, esta casada y es madre de 9 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad y en algunos casos casados y con hijos. Regina aprovecha el tiempo para vender de forma paralela todo tipo de mercadería que le traen de forma directa desde Santa Cruz. Asi también Regina tiene mucha habilidad para la preparación de platos especiales, por tal motivo se ha dedicado a la preparación de comida a contrato, lo que siempre le representa un ingreso extra para su sustento. Actualmente el comercio de mercadería es lo que más le ha rendido a Regina, por lo que ella precisa de capital para poder comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad, lo que permite rebajar el costo e incrementar las ganancias, tomando en cuenta que ella no tiene un puesto de venta exclusivo para esta mercadería.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for store

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
Delicia A. Rivas is married to a shopkeeper and she is a mother of 3 children. She sells cosmetics from house to house. Her clientele is made up of mostly friends and neighbors in the area. She has been doing this for 2 years. She's a representative of the most popular cosmetic companies in Latin America which is Avon.

Previously, Delicia used to sell basic food supplies, but she had to stop doing this because of the long distances she had to travelled and it was a day-long type of job.

At this time, Delica owns her home with one of her sons. Her husband does a lot of work-related travelling and she needs to provide for her family, especially to the needs of her daughter who currently needs a computer for school. This is why Delica would like to invest more money into her business so that hopefully she can make a bigger profit.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Delicia A. Rivas, casada con un comerciante y madre de 3 hijos, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante, sus principales clientes son sus amistades o conocidos del barrio o de la zona. Ya son 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, representando a una de las empresas populares de cosméticos en latino América (AVON). Anteriormente a esta actividad, Delicia se dedicaba a la venta ambulante de víveres de primera necesidad, pero por razones de salud tuvo que dejar, ya que las distancias eran muy largas a recorrer, y era trabajo de todo el día. Actualmente Delicia vive en casa propia, con uno de sus hijos, su esposo se encuentra ausente por razones de trabajo, lo que le obliga a responder por las necesidades de su casa, principalmente las de estudio de su hija, la que precisa de una computadora para poder proseguir su carrera. Es por eso que Delicia precisa de dinero para poder generar mayor ganancia en su egocio, de esta forma comprar lo que su hija necesita.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly I. Quiroga de Rengel is the owner of a beauty salon. She is a hairdresser and her business is located in the area of Achachicala in the city of La Paz. She started as a cleaning assistant, then as a styling assistant, and slowly she learned the business. Currently Nelly has taken hairstyling and refresher courses in Argentina. Her business currently has what it needs to provide a good service to her clients, and she also has two assistants that work in shifts, thus helping her give a better attention to all her customers. Nelly will use the loan to buy new furniture and fixtures for her business, since all her current furniture has already used all of its useful life, and she needs to have new furniture and fixtures in order to better serve her customers during the high demand of the carnival season.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Nelly IIlanes Quiroga de Rengel, es dueña de un Salón de Belleza, ella es peinadora, y su negocio esta ubicado en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz. Hace mucho comenzó como ayudante de limpieza, posteriormente como asistente de estilismo, y poco a poco fue aprendiendo el oficio. En la actualidad Nelly ha aprobado importantes cursos de actualización y estilismo en la Argentina, Actualmente el Salón cuenta con todas las comodidades para su clientela, además de contar con dos dependientes asistentes, que trabajan por turnos, colaborando para una mejor atención. Nelly precisa de dinero para poder renovar todo el mobiliario de su salón, tomando en cuenta que el tiempo de vida util del que actualmente posee ya se ha cumplido, y es urgente preparar todo por la demanda existente principalmente ahora que se acercan las fiestas de los carnavales.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and fixtures for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa Q., widow of Bautista, is the mother of 6 children whom she has been able to support through her ability to work with wool, to knit, and to fabricate jerseys as well as other items which she makes by hand in order to sell in the commercial centers of her area and the city of El Alto.

Thanks to the credit she has received from Pro Mujer, Teresa has been able to buy a sewing machine, with which she has increased her production and at the same time satisfied the demand that existed. However, this has still not been sufficient, since she has 6 children to feed and care for.

For this reason Teresa needs capital in order to increase her supply of raw material, and in this way elevate her production so that it will create a better income for maintaining herself and her 6 children.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa Q. Vda. De Bautista, es madre de 6 hijos, a los cuales supo sacar adelante con su habilidad para realizar trabajos en lana, tejodos, chompas y otros, los que fabricaba a mano para poder luego vender en los principales comercios de su zona y de la ciudad de El Alto.

Gracias a los créditos de Pro Mujer, Teresa pudo coprar una máquina de tejido, con la cual ha incrementado su producción y del mismo modo a satisfecho la demanda que existía, pero aún no es suficiente, ya que son 6 hijos los que debe alimentar y cuidar.

Por tanto, Teresa precisa de capital para poder incrementar la compra de su materia prima, y de esta manera elevar su producción para que esto represente un mejor ingreso para el sustento de ella y de sus 6 hijos.

loans.use: To increase her supply of raw material and thereby elevate production.

loans.name: Sartiah

texts.en: Sartiah is a 25-year-old woman. Before she joined MBK, her husband M. was the only one in their family who worked. But, since joining MBK, Sartiah has been able to start her own business - she now makes bamboo matting at her house, and typically earns US$20 per month. Sartiah needs IDR 1,000,000 to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Honorata

texts.es:
Honorata Q. de Poroma is married and has two children. She is considered an expert cook and is the owner of a family boarding house on 16th of July Avenue in the city of El Alto. She has been in business for 4 years, which all started the moment she was able to acquire a restaurant thanks to some contacts. Currently, Honorata has a boarding house with a restaurant that is well equipped, and in fact has opened a some telephone booths within her restaurant for the convenience of her diners. Despite all of this, Honorata requires capital to undergo some repairs in the boarding house in addition to stocking ingredients necessary for the preparation of her dishes. Only in this way will she be able to receive a greater number of diners and generate what is necessary to satisfy her family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Honorata Q. de Poroma, casada, y madre de dos hijos, es considerada una experta cocinera, y dueña de una pensión familiar que atiende en la Av. 16 de Julio de la Ciudad de El Alto, ya son 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y todo comenzó el momento que gracias a unos contactos, se adjudicaron la atención de un restaurante. Actualmente Honorata tiene una pensión restaurante muy bien equipado, e incluso a dispuesto la apertura de unas cabinas de llamadas dentro de su propio restaurante, para mayor comodidad de sus comensales. Pese a todo eso, Honorata precisa de capital para realizar algunas refacciones dentro de la pensión, como también la provisión de insumos para la preparación de sus platos, solo de esta manera podrá acoger a un mayor número de comensales y generará lo necesario para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

loans.use: Honorata requires capital to undergo some repairs in the boarding house in addition to stocking ingredients necessary for the preparation of her dishes.  Only in this way will she be able to receive a greater number of diners and generate what is necessary to satisfy her family's needs.

loans.name: Justa

texts.es:
Justa Álvarez used to be an emergency nurse. She had to retire from doing this due to an accident she suffered which left her in poor health. Due to this, she had to find other ways to make a living. She began selling bakery goods/pastries out of her home. She has experience doing this since she would help her mother, who was a master when it came to baking.

Justa takes orders and also delivers her baked goods to the local schools in the area. She also works there as a temporary assistant/secretary in the evenings.

In her free time, she also provides all sorts of legal services such as birth certificates, college certificates, identification cards, etc. which provide her with some money.

At this time, Justa would like a loan to purchase main ingredients to bake a variety of pastries since school is starting, and this is the time when she makes the most money. She lives with her 2 sons and 2 grandchildren in the house she inherited from her father in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Justa Álvarez, trabajó como enfermera auxiliar, actividad que tuvo que dejar a causa de un accidente que afectó mucho su salud. Por tal motivo tuvo que dedicarse a otra actividad, como es la repostería, trabajo que realiza desde su domicilio y aplicando las enseñanzas de su madre quien era maestra en técnicas de repostería. Generalmente justa trabaja a pedido, llevando sus productos al centro educativo donde también cumple funciones de secretaria auxiliar del magisterio en el turno de la noche. En su tiempo libre se dedica a realizar todo tipo de tramites, como ser certificados de nacimiento, títulos de bachiller, cédulas de identidad y otros que le representan siempre un ingreso pequeño. Actualmente Justa precisa de capital para poder incrementar la variedad de sus productos en repostería, la compra de insumos es vital para poder dar continuidad a su negocio, puesto que la temporada de inicio de clases esta cerca, y es una temporada ideal para generar recursos para su subsistencia, tomando en cuenta que sus dos hijos y sus dos nietos viven con ella en la casa que les dejó su suegro.

loans.use: To purchase more bakery ingredients

loans.name: Rokayah

texts.en: Rokayah is a 47-year-old woman whose husband H. has been unemployed for quite a long time. To support her family, Rokayah sells plastics such as bottles, glasses, etc., earning US$3.7 per day. She is requesting a loan of US$175 to expand her business, so that she could earn more income and pay for her children's education. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Daisy M. Chávez has sold plastic products for 25 years. She makes trips to the area of Desaguadero where she buys her merchandise, and later takes to the cities of Cochabamba and Santa Cruz. Daisy has a sales shop at the Lanza Punata de Cochabamba market, where she obtains the most sales. She travels to the city of Cochabamba twice a week, and to the area of Desaguadero twice a month. Daisy requires capital in order to purchase enough merchandise that will permit her to make less frequent, but more productive trips in terms of what merchandise she takes back. This is the only way she will be able to confront her obligations as a widow and raise her three children who are of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Daisy M. Chávez, es comerciante de artículos de plástico hace 25 años, realizando viajes a la localidad de Desaguadero, donde se aprovisiona de mercadería, que luego lleva a las ciudades de Cochabamba y Santa Cruz. Daisy tiene un puesto de venta en el mercado Lanza Punata de Cochabamba, ciudad donde genera su mejor venta. Semanalmente realiza dos viajes a la ciudad de Cochabamba y al mes un total de dos veces hasta la localidad de Desaguadero. Daisy requiere de capital para poder aprovisionarse de mercadería, que le permita realizar viajes menos frecuentes pero pero más productivos en referencia a la mercadería que trae, solo de esta manera podrá hacer frente a las obligaciones que le depara el ser viuda y criar a tres hijos que se encuentran en edad de estudio y formación.

loans.use: Daisy requires capital in order to purchase enough merchandise that will permit her to make less frequent, but more productive trips in terms of what merchandise she takes back.  This is the only way she will be able to confront her obligations as a widow and raise her three children who are of school age.

loans.name: Nurani

texts.en: Nurani is a 44-year-old woman who owns a small shop which sells snacks, crispy chips, cigarettes, etc. Since Nurani joined MBK, her business has been growing very fast, and she has been able to earn US$4.7 per day. Her husband A. has no regular job. Nurani is asking for a loan to buy more inventory for her shop. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory for a shop

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida M. belongs to the communal Association “Joyitas de Oro” from the Centro Focal Villa Tejada. Currently she is in her second round and she makes hats and other clothing items. She has been doing this since she was 15, and she learned this craft from her parents. Her main customer base is in Cochabamba, where she already has some customers that are in charge of distributing her products. She also has customers in La Paz, in the main markets and fairs and in the fair “July 16” that takes place in the city of “El Alto”.

Frida will use the loan in order to buy more raw materials, such as clothes, brooches, and linings that will allow her to generate the necessary revenue to help her cover her needs as well as those of her two sons.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Frida M. es perteneciente a la Asociación comunal Joyitas de Oro del Centro Focal Villa Tejada, actualmente se encuentra en el segundo ciclo de permanencia y se dedica principalmente a la confección de sombreros, gorras y otro tipo de confecciones. Esta es una actividad que realiza dede sus 15 años de edad, aprendiendo el oficio de sus padres. Su principal mercado se encuentra en la ciudad de Cochabamba, donde ya tiene un grupo de clientes que se encargan de comercializar su producto. De igual forma en la ciudad de La Paz, en los principales mercados y ferias y en la ciudad de El Alto en la populosa feria 16 de Julio. Frida precisa de capital para poder comprar una mayor cantidad de materia prima, como ser telas, broches forros y otros que le permitan generar los recursos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de ella y de sus dos hijos.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina Manani de Gutiérrez is married and a mother of 4 children. She belongs to the Buen Corazon of Villa Adela Association. She sells food. She prepares all types of native dishes. She has 20 years of experience in this field. She learned to cook from a very early age. She used to help her mother prepare all sorts of delicious dishes.

At this time, Justina attends the local fairs that take place in the various towns across the state of La Paz. One of her main objective is to attend specialty fairs such as Andean tourist fairs and seafood fairs, etc.

Justina would like to purchase all the food ingredients necessary to make her delicious dishes so that she is able to attend these specialty fairs. This is her only way to make money and pay for her bills.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Justina Manani de Gutiérrez, casada y madre de 4 hijos, pertenece a la asociación Buen Corazón de Villa Adela, es comerciante de comida, prepara todo tipo de platos de la gastronomía nacional. Ya son más de 20 años de experiencia en el rubro, este es un oficio que aprendió desde muy chica, cuando ayudaba a su madre en la preparación de tanta variedad de platos. Hoy en día, Justina tiene presencia en las principales ferias de especialidad, que se llevan a cabo en distintos pueblos y provincias del Departamento de La Paz. Uno de sus objetivos es participar de las ferias turísticas andinas, y en distintas ferias tanto del pescado, como de otras especialidades. Para este objetivo Justina precisa de capital, para poder costear los gastos de participación y compra de insumos, solo de esta manera podrá generar los ingresos necesarios y consolidar convenios importantes.

loans.use: To purchase food ingredients

loans.name: Supinah

texts.en: Supinah is a 32-year-old mother who makes bamboo matting at her house, earning US$24.4 per month. She has been running this business to support her family, since her husband S. has been unemployed for quite a long time. Supinah is a member of MBK, and is asking for a loan to increase her business capital. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Increase in business capital

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Guadalupe N. de Osco is married and has two children. She sells fruits in la Ceja de El Alto and has been doing so for three years now, whereas previously she was a homemaker. Currently Guadalupe buys her merchandise from trucks that come from different parts of the country, mainly from the tropics and areas of low elevation such as Luribay and valleys of La Paz. Two years ago, Guadalupe was able to buy a shop from which to conduct her sales, but had to close it down and work as a domestic worker due to a harsh winter and resulting scarcity of fruit. She requires the capital to restart her business and take advantage of the season, the better climate and the upcomming end of the year celebrations.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Guadalupe N. de Osco, casada y madre de dos hijos, se dedica a la venta de frutas en la Ceja de El Alto. Ya son más de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad, puesto que anteriormente solo se dedicaba a las labores de casa. Actualmente Guadalupe compra su mercadería de los camiones que llegan de distintas zonas del país, principalmente del trópico y zonas bajas, como Luribay, y los Yungas paceños. Hace 2 años Guadalupe logro comprar un puesto de venta, pero a raíz del invierno crudo que se vivió en el país y la escasez de fruta, tuvo que cerrar su puesto y dedicarse a trabajar como empleada doméstica. Por tal motivo, ella precisa de capital para poder reactivar su negocio aprovechando la temporada, como también la mejora del clima y la proximidad de las fiestas de fin de año.

loans.use: Requires the capital to restart her business and take advantage of the season, the better climate and the upcomming end of the year celebrations.

loans.name: Sumyati

texts.en: Sumyati is a 34-year-old woman whose husband A. R. has been unemployed for a long time. She has therefore started her own business to support her family by selling crispy chips, snacks, candy, ice, household goods, etc. at her small shop, earning US$10.5 per day. Sumyati is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to expand her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lupe

texts.es:
Lupe Edna M. manufactures shoes in the traditional cholita style for a living. She has worked alongside her husband for two years now. Prior to this, she worked at an office as a secretary, but unfortunately had to leave that work once her son was born and because she got married. The art of shoe making was learned from her family, who also taught her husband, and is now what supports her family. Currently they have a workshop at their home equipped with semi-industrial machines that were bought thanks to Pro Mujer. Her main market is in the carnivals and has a few clients who take her merchandise all the way to Perú. The name of Lupe's business is named after her daughter, Duvaly. Lupe needs capital in order to buy bulk raw material since she knows that demand is strong and she has a possibility of exporting a high quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Lupe Edna M., se dedica a la confección de calzados de cholita, trabaja junto a su esposo hace ya dos años. Anteriormente ella trabajaba en una oficina como secretaria, lastimosamente tuvo que dejar ese trabajo por el nacimiento de su hijo y por que se casó. El arte de la confección de los zapatos lo aprendió de su familia, quienes también enseñaron a su esposo y ahora es el sustento de su familia. Actualmente cuentan con un taller que funciona en su domicilio, equipada con maquinaria semi industrial, mismas que compró gracias a Pro Mujer. Su principal mercado se encuentra en las ferias y cuenta con algunos clientes que llevan la mercadería hasta el Perú, el nombre de la empresa de Lupe lleva el nombre de su hija Duvaly. Lupe precisa de capital para poder acceder a la compra de materia prima al por mayor, en vista que la demanda es fuerte y tiene la posibilidad de exportar un producto de calidad.

loans.use: Lupe needs capital in order to buy bulk raw material since she knows that demand is strong and she has a possibility of exporting a high quality product.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
Clotilde A. sells clothes- all types of clothes, but mainly junior and kids clothes on foot. She is one of the bulk salespeople in the area, buying and selling by the dozen. To date, she totals 6 months of work in this trade, making trips to Oruro, Potosí, and on occasion, all of the interior to buy merchandise to sell. Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Clotilde A., se dedica a la venta de ropa, todo tipo de ropa, pero principalmente ropa juvenil y ropa para niños de forma ambulante, es una de las mayoristas de la zona, comprando y vendiendo por docena En la actualidad ya suman 6 meses de trabajo en el rubro realizando viajes tanto a Oruro, Potosí, y en ocasiones a todo el interior para poder comprar la mercadería para la venta. Clotilde precisa de capital para poder incrementar y mejorar su mercadería, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poder instalar su puesto de venta, que será una herramienta importante para la venta de fin de año.

loans.use: Clotilde is in need of capital in order to increase and improve her sales, with the goal of bettering her income and be able to establish a retail shop which will be an important tool for end of the year sales.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es:
I have a construction project in my home that has gone unfinished due to lack of money. I need to finish it and all I need to do is build the concrete roof. The space we have is very reduced and I have young kids too; I would like to finish to be able to accommodate them. I am asking for $500 to build a concrete ceiling over two rooms and apply a finish to the walls of my home.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar en mi vivienda ya que la tuve que detener por falta de dinero, necesito terminarla solo tengo que poner el techo de concreto, el espacio que tenemos es muy reducido y tengo hijos pequeños también me gustaría enjarrar para poder habitarlos”. Solicito $ 500.00 dlls para poner el techo de concreto de dos cuartos y enjarrar las paredes de mi vivienda..

loans.use: Concrete ceiling construction for two rooms and wall finish.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma C. Cortez works as a secretary in her husband’s automotive repair shop. They have owned this shop located on the road to Viacha for the past 6 years. The garage is rented and they have 5 employees with expertise in the different branches of automotive mechanics. This is a family business in which her sister-in-law also works. The shop is equipped with the machinery necessary for automotive repair, and they repair things like fuel injection cars. Irma is requesting this loan in order to buy a small vehicle that will permit her to provide roadside assistance because this is the most lucrative activity for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Irma C. Cortez, trabaja como secretaria en el taller mecánico de su esposo, con quien conjuntamente han instalado un taller hace 6 años en el camino a Viacha. Actualmente el taller se encuentra en un ambiente alquilado, y trabajan con 5 dependientes en distintos rubros de la mecánica. Se trata de una empresa familiar, donde su cuñada trabaja con ellos. El taller ha sido equipado con maquinaria adecuada para el tipo de trabajo que realizan, como la reparación de cerebros electrónicos, y automóviles a inyección. Irma precisa de capital para la compra de una pequeña movilidad que le permita realizar los auxilios en carretera, que son los que representan mejores ingresos para el taller.

loans.use: Purchase of a small vehicle to provide roadside assistance

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is 37 years old and married with 7 children. She was born in Mayagba village of Magburaka in Sierra Leone. Her husband is a radio mechanic at Mabguraka town. Fatmata sells palm oil in the market and has  been doing so for a long time. With the income from her sales, she is an asset to her family. Fatmata’s income is used mainly to pay for her children’s school expenses and medical bills.  As her husband's income is irregular, Fatmata’s income plays a crucial role in meeting her family’s expenses.  With her previous loans, she managed to expand her business and is therefore requesting a $300 loan for the same purpose.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling palm oil in Magburaka market.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Adama

texts.en: Adama S. is 35 years old and married with five children. She runs a small local restaurant in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. Adama is very grateful to SMT because she can now generate enough income to meet her family's daily needs and expenses. To expand and diversify her business, Adama plans to acquire a refrigerator to chill the drinks she sells and enable her to make additional sales. She is therefore requesting a $350 loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: She would like to buy a refrigerator to further expand her business and attract new customers.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
My home is very comfortable for my family, but in reality, we would like to make it a bit larger. I am thinking about making some modifications to the kitchen and buying some doors which we need; you can see our furniture is a bit cramped. I am asking for $1000 to expand the kitchen and buy doors.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

“Mi casa en muy cómoda para mi familia, pero en realidad nos gustaría ampliarla un poco, pienso hacerle algunos arreglos a la cocina y comprar unas puertas que me hacen falta ya que si se dan cuenta tenemos los muebles un poco amontonados ” Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para ampliar un poco la cocina de mi casa y comprar unas puertas .

loans.use: Expanding the kitchen and buying doors for my home

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa K. is a 37 year old woman who is married with five children. Hawa’s husband is a petty trader and both of them have to work hard to generate income to meet their family's expenses. Hawa has been running a restaurant business for the last five years.

Before becoming an SMT client, Hawa used to obtain items for her business from a Lebanese merchant on credit. She realized that the expense involved in such loans is considerably high and could not meet her daily repayment. With subsequent loans from SMT she reduced her purchases on credit and her income increased. Hawa’s aim now is to build a permanent retail shop with her own capital and she is therefore requesting a $300 loan.

loans.use: To increase her revenue by  purchasing more items with cash and saving money by not purchasing on credit.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en: Ishmael J. is a middle-aged man married with two children.  He rears sheep and goats and sells them in Kabala, Sierra Leone. Ishmael has ten years' experience in buying, rearing and selling sheep and goats. With his previous loans from SMT, his capital increased.  He is requesting an $800 loan to expand his business by purchasing more goats and sheep.

loans.use: To increase his herd by purchasing 2 additional goats and sheep.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 32 years old. He is married and has two children who are both studying in school. He is living with his elderly parents in a rented house. He is responsible for all their life expenses. He has a small carpentry shop. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase new wood and some raw materials to help him in his business of refurbishing and selling the furniture. He also wants to renovate the shop to increase his income and develop his business.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new wood

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía T. has a small stand on Tumusla Ave. in the city of La Paz, where she sells sneakers, slippers, and sandals. She also owns several other stands located in the main market in the city of El Alto. She constantly travels to the city of Oruro and to the town of Desaguadero, where she buys merchandise to replenish her businesses. Sofía has three children, the youngest of whom is 6 years old. For this reason, it is necessary for her to invest more capital in maintaining her business and staying in the market. She needs to invest heavily because she faces stiff competition. Sofía’s objective is to sell her products wholesale, so she needs the loan in order to be able to buy products in the abovementioned places because buying wholesale is more economical than buying in smaller quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Sofía T., tiene un puesto de venta de zapatillas, pantuflas y sandalias en la Av. Tumusla de la ciudad de La Paz, al mismo tiempo es dueña de otros puestos ubicados en la principal feria de la ciudad de El Alto. Constantemente realiza viajes a la ciudad de Oruro y a la localidad de Desaguadero, de donde compra su mercadería para abastecer sus puestos. Actualmente Sofía es madre de 3 hijos, el menor de 6 años, por tal motivo, es necesario realizar una importante inyección de capital para poder mantenerse en el mercado, puesto que si bien el rubro necesita de una fuerte inversión, la competencia es mucha. El objetivo de Sofía es la venta de su mercadería al por mayor, por lo que ella precisa de capital para poder realizar la compra en los lugares ya mencionados, puesto que el precio de la compra al por mayor baja sustancialmente a comparación de la compra por unidades o docenas.

loans.use: To invest in her business and sell her merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Yangi

texts.en: Yangi T. is 35 years old and married with four children. She sells rice, sugar and flour in Kabala town of Sierra Leone. She has been selling these items for over ten years now but due to a lack of business capital, she has been unable to improve her business significantly. With her previous loans, Yangi expanded her business to some degree. She is now able to pay her children’s school expenses without difficulty and can meet other family expenses. Yangi would like to earn more profit by diversifying her business and is therefore requesting a loan of $1,000.

loans.use: Diversify her business by selling additional food items to attract new customers

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Wurikia

texts.en: Madam Wurikia B. is 35 years old and married with two children. Wurikia started her business with a small amount of capital but expanded her business with suqsequent loans from SMT.  Like any other woman in Sierra Leone, her main priority is the education of her children and building a family house.  She would like more loans to expand her business and to earn additional income to fulfill her dreams.  She is therefore requesting a $550 loan.

loans.use: She would like to expand her business gradually so that she can begin to fulfill her dreams.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María P. Angola is married to a taxi driver and is a mother of 4 children. She bakes for a living, thanks to an industrial grade oven that she acquired not too long ago. With this tool, she prepares all sorts of products which she sells under contract and individual orders for either birthday parties, weddings and other events. The rest is taken to school kiosks in her area. In addition to this activity, she also buys a variety merchandise from Oruro, a city she travels to twice a month. She has done this kind of work for 6 years now and is turning out to be better than baking exclusively. For this reason, María requires capital in order to buy ingredients for baking, as well as buying more merchandise which she plans to sell on credit and recover more than her initial investment over a moderate period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

María P. Angola, casada con un chofer de taxi, y madre de 4 hijos, se dedica a la repostería, gracias al horno industrial que no hace mucho adquirió. Con esta herramienta ella se dedica a la preparación de todo tipo de productos, los cuales vende a contrato y pedido, ya sea para fiestas de cumpleaños, matrimonios y otros, y el resto lleva a los kioscos de las escuelas y colegios de su zona. Paralelamente a esta actividad, ella se dedica a comprar todo tipo de mercadería que trae de Oruro, ciudad a la que viaja dos veces al mes. Ya son 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad, y al parecer le esta resultando mejor que solo dedicarse a la repostería. Por tal motivo, María precisa de capital, para poder acceder tanto a la compra de insumos para la repostería, como para la inversión en la compra de más mercadería, la cual piensa vender al crédito y recuperar mucho más de lo invertido en un mediano plazo.

loans.use: María requires capital in order to buy ingredients for baking, as well as buying more merchandise which she plans to sell on credit and recover more than her initial investment over a moderate period of time.

loans.name: Wonday

texts.en: Wonday is 38 years old and married with four children. She sells food items in the market town of Kabala in Sierra Leone. She is one of SMT’s good clients.  She has a healthy repayment history with a wealth of business knowledge.  Her plan is to become one of the most successful businesswomen in Sierra Leone and she would like to expand her business gradually but surely. She is therefore requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business gradually so that she can reach her goal of becoming one of the most successful businesswomen in Sierra Leone.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Christian Children\'s Fund - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sarrah

texts.en: Sarrah is 40 years old and married with 3 children. She runs a small business selling palm oil and locally-made soap in the Kabala town of Sierra Leone.  Sarrah's sales are not very high because she lacks capital. She used previous loans to diversify her business and engage in selling palm oil wholesale. She has been one of SMT’s more successful clients since SMT was established. She is requesting a $350 loan to expand her business.

loans.use: She would like to buy more palm oil to sell wholesale to meet her customers' demands.
