Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To take down an old room and build two new ones

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en: Mrs. Mabel O. is married with 2 children, lives in Benin City; she has a store where she sells provisions & Foodstuff. She solicits for the loan of $275 to buy more provision and foodstuff for sale. She has been in this business since 2002.

loans.use: To buy more Provisions & Foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel P., her husband, Rafael Chuquimia, and their two children live with Isabel's parents in the Tembladerani district in the city of La Paz. Isabel sells groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, canned powder milk, etc.) to homes around her area, and her husband works as a city public transportation driver. Isabel's parents gave the family two rooms to live in but they need to build a bathroom and a kitchen so that they can live comfortably. The loan she is applying for will go towards building the bathroom and placing a reinforced concrete floor in the kitchen. This is the third time Isabel has asked for a loan. Reviewing her socioeconomic activity qualifies her to apply for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Isabel P. vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Rafael Chuquimia y sus dos hijos. La señora Isabel vende abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche en polvo en latas, etc.) a domicilio en su zona y su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte publico en la ciudad. Las dos habitaciones que ocupan fueron cedidas por sus padres pero tienen la necesidad de construir un baño y una cocina para comodidad de la familia. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de un baño y loza de hormigón armado para la cocina. Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To bulid a bathroom and cover the kitchen floor with reinforced concrete.

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience N. is 45 years old, married with 7 children, and lives in Benin City. She has a store where she sells provisions and runs a bar. She is in need of a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more provisions and drinks to sell. She is a LAPO member. She learnt her trade from her sister and has been in this business since 1980.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Zubeda's Group

texts.en: Zubeda M., Sada A.,  Mwavita M. ,and Mariam T. are four members of the Wanawake Wema group in the Vingunguti area of Dar Es Salaam city. They run various business in Vingunguti market. Two run small restaurants, and the other two have got shops selling various items. They have been together as a group for the past year, ever since they joined Youth Self Employment Foundation. They are jointly in need of a loan in the amount of US$ 1600 of which US$ 400 is meant for each, to help them expand their businesses.

loans.use: to expand their various small businesses

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Youth Self Employment Foundation (YOSEFO) - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Aminjon

texts.ru:
Aminjon A., who is 31, has a high school education, is married, and has 4 children. Aminjon is in the business of selling children's toys and hair accessories, mirrors, and food products. For this purpose, he has a store that he built inside of his house, located in the village of Novobod, in the Yavan region. Using funds from the loan, he plans to increase the assortment of his inventory. His main customers are children and their parents from his village and the surrounding areas. This loan will help local residents to purchase toys, hair clips, and mirrors for girls along with other goods necessary for their homes. At the same time, they will not need to commute to the center of the region and will be able to purchase the products at a location near their homes. Aminion is planning to pay off the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Азимов Аминджон, возраст – 31 год, образование среднее, женат, имеет 4-х детей. Аминчон занимается продажей детских игрушек, женских детских заколок, зеркалец, женских ободков, а также продуктов питания. Для этого он имеет небольшой магазин, который он построил у себя в доме, находящегося в махале Навобод, Яванского района. На полученный кредит он планирует увеличить ассортимент товара. Основными его покупателятми являются дети кишлака Навобод, а также близлежащих районов, а также их родители. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать необходимые игрушки для своих детей, заколки и зеркальца для девочек, а также других вещей необходимых для хозяйстива. При этом им не надо будет ездить для этого в центр района или города, они могут будут купить это рядом со своим домом. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Mrs. Bose O., a yam seller, needs a loan of $275 to enable her to buy more yam to sell. She is 45 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Benin City. She learnt her trade over 6 months and started her business in 1992. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more yam to sell

loans.name: Shamsidin

texts.ru:
Shamsidin A., who is 34 years old, has high school education, is married, and has 3 children. Shamsudin has been in this business for 8 years. Using funds from the loan he is planning to purchase 2 young bulls. He will be selling them every 40-45 days and using the revenues to purchase new cattle. After purchasing cattle and repaying his loan, Shamsudin is planning to use the profits to maintain his family. He will be repaying the loan over the next six months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Абдулфайзов Шамсиддин, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Шамсиддин уже в течение 8 лет занимается этим видом деятельности. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести 2 бычков. Он будет продавать его каждые 40-45 дней и на вырученные деньги будет приобретать новый скот. Полученную прибыль после приобретения скота и выплаты кредита он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional cattle for breeding and sales

loans.name: Amonullo

texts.ru:
Amonullo H., who is 52, has high school education, is married and has 6 children. Amonullo has been in the business of selling fuels and lubricants in his home village Havobod during the past 15 years. Since the oil prices are on the rise, he is planning to purchase a large amount of fuels and lubricants for future sales. Because during the winter months in the most distant areas of the village, the electricity is only available for a few hours, residents are using kerosine lamps for that purpose. This loan will give local people an opportunity to purchase benzine and kerosine for lighting and heating of their houses. Amonullo is planning to repay his loan over the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Хасанов Амонулло, возраст – 52 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 6-х детей. Амонулло занимается продажей горюче-смазочных материалов у себя дома, в кишлаке Навобод, уже в течение 15 лет. Так как цены на бензин ежедневно растут, на полученный кредит он хочет приобрести большое количество горюче – смазочоных материалов для дальнейших их реализации.. Так как в зимнее время в дальних районах подача электоэнергии производится по несколько часов и основным источником является керосиновые лампы, жители кишлаков получат возможность приобретать бензин и керосин для освещения и обогрева своих жилищ. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Suhaya

texts.en: Suhaya, 33, has four children. Together with her husband, E., she operates a compressor for inflating tires, earning US$0.10 per tire. They usually service up to 15 tires a day, so they do not have regular income. She is requesting a loan  to expand her business. She is a member of MBK and agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her tire business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. is a trader who owns a cosmetics, gift and cards shop. She is married to a formal head of an institution. They have two children. Their family is surviving through Mary’s hard work.

At the moment Mary wants to increase her income by increasing her capital to purchase more stock for her shop to meet the growing demand for her goods. She is therefore asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more cosmetics, gifts and cards to meet the demand of her costumers.

loans.name: Abdugaffor

texts.ru:
Abdugaffor H. is 34 years old, he has a secondary education. He is married and has 3 children. Abdugaffor has been selling mens shoes for the past 10 years. He is renting a space in the Yavan town market which is called Tidjorat. He is planning to use his loan towards purchasing of a new assortment of shoes for the winter. The loan will also provide the residents the ability to buy shoes in their own town because the next closest market is located more than 80 kilometers from the town of Yavan.

Abdugaffor is planning to pay off the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Хайтов Абдугаффор, возраст – 34 года, образование среднее, женат, имеет 3-х детей. Абдугаффор уже в течение 10 занимается продажей мужской обувью. Для этого он арендуют торговую точку на центральном рынке города Явана под названием «Тиджорат». На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести новый ассортимент зимней обуви. Данный кредит поможет местным жителям приобретать зимную обувь у себя в районе, так как близлежащий рынок находится на расстояние более 80 километров от города Явана.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of shoes for the winter season

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha K. is a trader who deals in the selling of soft drinks , mineral water and others. Agathaa is married with 4 children ages 18, 13, 8 and 6. Her husband is an audit clerk but his monthly income is not sufficient to meet the financial needs of the family. Agatha is helping him with the family’s finances.

Demand for her goods has increased, and for this reason she wants to increase her sales. She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to enable her buy more crates of soft drinks, bags and boxes of mineral water to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: As additional capital to enable her buy more crates of soft drinks, bags and boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Ashurgul

texts.ru:
Ashurgul R. is 48 years old, she has secondary education, married with 4 children. Ashurgul has been breeding cattle for the past 15 years. She plans to use her loan to buy 2 young calves for breeding and sales. She plans to sell them after 40-45 days of feeding. She will use her loan to buy food for the calves and the rest of it to help support her family. Ashurgul's son is also helping her with the business.

She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Рустамова Ашургул, возраст – 48 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Ашургул уже в течение 15 занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. На полученный кредит Ашургул планирует приобрести 2 молодых бычков для их откормки и продажи. Она планирует продавать их в течение 40-45 после. На полученный кредит она будет покупать молодых бычков и корм для них, а оставшуюся сумму будет использовать для оказание помощи в содержание своей семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает сын.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of cattle

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati, 43, is a widow with 4 children. Since her husband passed away she has been running a food stall to support her family, sometimes with the help of her children. She usually earns US$10.5 per day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan US$100 to increase her business capital. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her food stall

loans.name: Niezbibi

texts.ru:
Niezbibi H. is 37 years old, she has secondary education, married with 4 children. Niezbibi has been breeding and selling livestock for the past 12 years. She plans to use her loan to buy several heads of livestock and then sell them after feeding them for 25-30 days. She will use her profits to buy more livestock and food, and use the rest of the income to support her family.

Niezbibi plans to pay off her loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Халимова Ниезбиби, возраст – 37 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 4-х детей. Ниезбиби в течение 12 лет занимается разведением и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота и через каждые 25-30 продавать его. Тем самым на вырученные деньги она будет приобретать молодой скот и корм для него, а оставшиеся деньги будет использовать на содержание своей семьи.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.ru:
Shamsiya B. is 43 years old, she has secondary education, married and has 11 children. Shamsiya has been breeding and selling livestock for the past 10 years. She plans to use her loan to buy several heads of livestock for breeding and sales. Because of such a large family, she plans to use the profits from sales to pay off her loan and the rest to support her family.

Shamsiya plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Боймонова Шамсия, возраст – 43 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 11-ть детей. Шамсия в течение 10 лет занимается разведением и продажей мелкого рогатого скота. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести несколько голов мелкого рогатого скота для их откормки и продажи. Так как у нее семья большая, получаемую прибыль от продажи скота она использует для погашения кредита и оказание помощи в содержание семьи.

Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Breeding and sales of livestock

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for MLF HUMO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Samuel K A

texts.en:
Samuel K.A. O. is a trader who deals in selling building materials. He is married and has 2 children ages 4 and 1 year 6 months old. His wife is a caterer and she is working very hard to help her husband with the family’s finances.

Demand for his goods has increased but he does not have enough capital to buy more goods for his shop to satisfy all his costumers. Samuel is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more iron sheets, wire mesh, nails, cellulose thinners, paints and so on, which are highly demanded from his shop.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more iron sheets, wire mesh, nails, cellulose thinners, paints and so on

loans.name: Asmah

texts.en: Asmah, 35, has two children, 17 and 12. She has a small store where she sells household goods, snacks, etc., earning US$10.5 per day. Her husband, M. H., is a laborer who earns US$3 per day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$100 to buy more inventory for her store so she can pay tuition for her children. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Sayati

texts.en: Sayati, 18, has 2 children. She and her husband, S., work as blacksmiths in their workshop. They make steel fences, etc., earning US$5 per day. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$75 to buy more tools so they can increase their income and provide for their children's education. She will repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more tools for her workshop

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana’s husband is a businessman like her; however sales aren’t going very well as the sales were low and the money not sufficient to pay the children’s school expenses. As time passed the children needed more things like clothing and school supplies. This was the reason that Ana decided to start to sell groceries outside her home. Little by little people were realizing that she sold basic products in her little store. She began to quickly acquire clients, and thanks to this she was able to invest more and more in new merchandise to be able to offer more variety to her clients.

Nevertheless today consider she is at the point of needing to be able to buy more items, so she is asking for a loan and that will enable her to increase her earnings. For this reason Ana is asking for a loan of US $375 that will be repaid in 6 months, and with this money Ana will be able to buy new merchandise in order to have greater income and with this money be able to secure her children’s future so they may study in the university and have better opportunities in their future. With your help Ana will be able to grow little by little as a person and as a mother.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

El esposo de Ana es comerciante igual que ella, sin embargo en las ventas no le va muy bien puesto que vende a menudeo y la cantidad de dinero no le era suficiente como para pagar los gastos que sus hijos estaban teniendo al estudiar. Y conforme pasaba el tiempo sus dos hijos necesitaban más cosas como ropa y artículos escolares. Fue por eso que Ana decidió comenzar a vender productos de abarrotes a las afueras de su casa. Poco a poco la gente se fue dando cuenta que ella vendía productos básicos para la despensa. Y comenzó rápidamente a adquirir clientas, gracias a esto pudo ir invirtiendo más y más en nueva mercancía para poder ofrecerle más variedad a sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente considera que está en el punto necesario para poder comprar más artículos que le están solicitando y así incrementar sus ganancias. Es por eso que Ana está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Ana podrá comprar nueva mercancía para poder tener mayores ingresos y así con este dinero poder sacar a sus hijos adelante para que estudien una carrera universitaria y tengan mejores oportunidades. Con tu ayuda Ana podrá crecer poco a poco como persona y como madre de familia.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva A. tries to think about the future. 5 years ago she saw the necessity of having extra income, with what her husband was making they wouldn’t be able to cover their children’s school expenses. So 5 years ago she began to sell jewelry to neighbors and friends. Little by little she became known in the neighborhood, thanks to recommendation that she received from her customers. Eva provides excellent customer service.

Nevertheless today she doesn’t have sufficient stock to be able to offer new items to her customers so Eva is asking for a US $200 loan in order to buy new merchandise and therefore provide better customer service and product to her customers. Eva is going to repay the loan in 6 months. And she hopes with your help she will be able to obtain sales of this merchandise in order to be able to gain customers from other neighborhoods to expand her clientele base.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Eva A. trata de pensar en el futuro. Puesto que hace 5 años que vio la necesidad de tener unos ingresos extras. Puesto que con lo que gana su esposo no les iba a alcanzar para cubrir todos los gastos de sus hijos en la escuela. Fue por eso que hace 5 años comenzó a vender productos de joyería entre sus vecinas y amigas. Fue así como poco a poco se fue dando a conocer entre los de su colonia, gracias a las recomendaciones que obtiene de sus clientes. Puesto que el servicio que ofrece Eva es de mucha atención.

Sin embargo actualmente no cuenta con suficiente surtido para poder ofrecerle novedades a sus clientes es por eso que Eva está solicitando un crédito de US $200 para poder comprar nueva mercancía y así brindarles una mejor atención y surtido para sus clientes. Eva está dispuesta a pagar este dinero en un plazo de 6 meses. Y espera con tu ayuda poder obtener ventas de estas mercancías para asó poder obtener clientes de otras colonias para ampliar su mercado.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in order to have a good supply of product.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
More than four years ago, Felipa D. L. C. started to sell beauty products and novelties to her neighbors and family. Although he works hard as a bricklayer, Felipa’s husband does not earn enough to pay for the expenses of Felipa and her three children. Little by little, Felipa was making her way among her customers and they recommended her to others. Currently, she has a long list of clients.

Nevertheless, various customers have maD. orders which, unfortunately, Felipa has not been able to buy since she doesn’t have enough funds. As a result, Felipa is soliciting a credit of US $275 which she will repay in 6 months. With this money, Felipa will be able to purchase the orders and begin to earn more. With your help, Felipa will be able advance her family and help her husband with home expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Hace más D. 4 años que Felipa D. L. C. comenzó a vender productos D. belleza y novedades entre sus vecinas y familiares. Puesto que su esposo a pesar D. esforzarse mucho trabajando como albañil, no gana lo suficiente como para poder pagar los gastos D. Felipa y sus 3 hijos. Poco a poco Felipa se fue abriendo camino entre sus clientes. Y ellos L. recomendaban con otros. Actualmente ya tiene una cartera D. clientes amplia.

Sin embargo varios D. ellos le hicieron pedidos que desgraciadamente Felipa no pueD. comprar puesto que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente como para desembolsarlos. Es por eso que Felipa está solicitando un crédito D. US $275 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo D. 6 meses y con este dinero Felipa podrá comprar los pedidos para poder comenzar a obtener mayores ganancias. Con tu ayuda Felipa podrá sacar adelante a su familia y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos D. hogar.

loans.use: Furnish orders

loans.name: Anah

texts.en: Anah is 44. Her husband, U., has been unemployed for a long time, so the support of the family falls to her. She sells vegetables and fruits such as cassava leaves and jackfruit door-to-door around villages, earning US$10.5 per day. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to increase her business capital so that she can earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Umsiah

texts.en: Umsiah, 51, is a seamstress who works at home, earning US$26.5 every two weeks. She will get more orders during the festive season. Her husband, E., has no fixed job, so their family depends on her income. She is asking for a loan of US$150 to buy dress-making supplies and increase business capital. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy dress-making supplies

loans.name: Irma Guadalupe

texts.es:
After Irma’s husband passed away 18 years ago, she began to sell fried foods, sweets and to make crafts. Little by little, she became interested in more things in order to make more money. In this manner, she turned around her financial situation. Due to her enthusiasm, she was able to pay for her son’s education, who is now married. It is because of this that Irma no longer has as many problems because she is single and her expenses are minimal. She needs to earn money only for eating and paying housing expenses.

Irma comments, “Because life goes on and one also must make her way in the face of problems and tragedies that occur in life.” This phrase is one of the principles that governs her life. It is due to this that Irma currently finds herself very enthusiastic: To have the ability to grow her business a little and buy material to make new crafts, which will allow her to have new products that she can offer to her customers. Irma is soliciting a credit of US $475 which she will repay within 6 months. With this money, Irma will be able to grow her business, continue selling in order to save for her expenses and not depend on other people.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Después de que el esposo de Irma murió hace 18 años, comenzó a vender frituras, dulces y a hacer manualidades; poco a poco fue metiéndole más cosas para sacar más dinero y así le iba dando vuelta al dinero. Gracias a su entusiasmo pudo ofrecerle estudios a su hijo el cual ya se encuentra casado. Es por eso que Irma ya no tiene tantos problemas porque está sola y sus gastos son mínimos, solo se preocupa por sacar dinero para comer y pagar los gastos de la casa.

“Porque la vida sigue y uno también tiene que abrirse camino antes los problemas y tragedias que pasan en la vida” comenta Irma. Esta frase es una de las principales que rigen su vida. Es por eso que actualmente Irma se encuentra muy entusiasmada de poder crecer un poco su negocio y comprar material para poder elaborar nuevas manualidades para así poder tener productos nuevos que ofrecerle a sus clientes. Irma está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Irma podrá crecer su negocio y seguir vendiendo para poder sacar para sus gastos y no depender de otras personas.

loans.use: Purchase material to make her crafts and buy more new products

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
The job that María del Carmen’s husband has did not provide sufficient money to pay for her and her son’s expenses. As a result, María began to look for alternatives so that they could make more money. It was through this route that she began to sell fashion accessories such as tiaras, glasses, and bracelets. Little by little, women started spreading the word about what she sold, and her sales started to increase.

Currently, she has an order that she has not been able to fulfill since she does not have enough capital to buy and resell the goods to her customers. As a result, María is soliciting a credit of US $375, which she will repay within 6 months. With this money, María will be able to stock her business, attract more customers and make more money in order to pay for her son’s school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

El trabajo que tiene el esposo de María del Carmen no le deja suficiente dinero como para pagar los gastos de ella y su hijo. Es por eso que María comenzó a buscar alternativas para poder obtener ingresos extras. Fue ahí como comenzó a vender artículos personales de moda, como diademas, lentes, pulseras, y poco a poco las mujeres se fueron dando cuenta de lo que vendía y los pedidos se le fueron incrementando.

Actualmente tiene un pedido que no a podido surtir puesto que no cuenta con el capital suficiente como para poder comprarlo y revenderlo entre sus clientes. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá surtir su negocio y así poder atraer mayor clientela para poder sacar dinero y pagar las necesidades que tiene su hijo en los gastos de la escuela.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz is a hard working mother of three young children. Ever since her husband left her she has been running a small restaurant from her own home where she offers simple yet delicious meals. With this job she has been able to manage the daily expenditures that her three children require and she has been able to provide them with a secure household. Now that her customers are demanding more, she would like to increase her investment capital in order to fulfill all of her clients' needs. Her restaurant is the sole source of income for the family. Let's help Beatriz get on with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Beatriz, es una trabajadora madre de tres pequeños niños, desde que su esposo se marchó para no regresar instalo en casa un pequeño restaurante en el que ofrece platos muy simples pero deliciosos. Con esta labor ha podido suplir los gastos que demandan sus pequeños a diario y les ha podido otorgar seguridad.Debido a que la demanda de sus clientes va en aumento desea incrementar su capital de inversión para cumplir cada una de las demandas de sus clientes ya que esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta esta familia.Ayudemos a Beatriz para siga con su labor.

loans.use: Purchase of a greater quantity of basic necessity products

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Every day Guillermina starts work very early and works tirelessly to see the fruits of her labor. She is an expert baker who makes a wide variety of goods such as empanadas and flour pastries which she sells to different stores throughout the city. Guillermina learned the art of baking while studying at an occupational training center. When she was satisfied with the training she had received, she decided to install her production center at home so as to generate enough income for the benefit of her family. Right now she rents an oven to cook her bakery goods, and she wants to install her own oven to increase production. The price of flour, the raw material needed for her work, has increased considerably as of late, naturally causing her production to decrease. Her desire to own an oven so that she can sell her treats, as well as her desire to build a soda fountain in the near future, has led her to apply for a loan with which she will quickly make her plans a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Guillermina, trabaja incansablemente cada día desde muy temprano para ver los frutos de su trabajo.Ella es una experta pastelera que produce una inmensa variedad de productos como: empanadas y bocaditos a base de harina; para distribuirlos a las diferentes tiendas de su ciudad.Guillermina aprendió el arte panadero cuando estudió en un centro de formación laboral; al culminar con satisfacción esta etapa de aprendizaje decidió implementar su centro de producción en casa a fin de generar ingresos en beneficio de su familia. Por ahora alquila un horno para la cocción de sus bocaditos y anhela construir su propio horno para incrementar su producción debido a que la harina materia prima de su trabajo durante estas semanas ha sufrido un incremento en su valor muy notable y desde luego su producción ha disminuido.Este deseo en especial y el de construir muy pronto una fuente de soda para ofrecer sus delicias la conducen a solicitar un préstamo para cristalizar en corto tiempo sus planes.

loans.use: To renovate her home oven in order to increase production.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela is a very hard-working, honest woman. Every morning she leaves her home to walk the city streets selling her delicious desserts. She walks to sell her desserts because she does not have enough capital to rent a comfortable, safe business locale. Many times Graciela's work provides the only income for her dear family since her husband does temporary jobs. Through her work, this hard-working woman wants to improve her two small children's way of life, and this is why she is asking for your generous help. The amount she is asking for will be used to buy more containers and ingredients so she can continue making her delicious desserts. Let's make Graciela's request happen so that she can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

Graciela, es una dama muy trabajadora y honrada. Todas las mañanas abandona su pequeña morada para desplazarse por las calles de su ciudad ofertando sus deliciosos postres; realiza esta actividad de esta forma debido a que no cuenta con un capital suficiente que le permita alquilar un espacio cómodo y seguro ya que muchas veces esta actividad es la única fuente de ingresos económicos de su querida familia; debido a que su esposo se desempeña en trabajos eventuales.Esta trabajadora mujer desea incrementar el nivel de vida de sus dos pequeños con su labor y por esta razón acude en búsqueda de la ayuda de tu bondadoso corazón a fin de obtener la cantidad que solicita para invertirlos en la compra de mayor cantidad de recipientes e ingredientes para seguir produciendo sus deliciosos postres.Posibilitemos su petición para que Graciela consiga su propósito.

loans.use: More capital will help increase production.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Four years ago and after completing the contract with the company that she was working for, Cecilia decided to open a shop in her home where she offers an large variety of products for the office, home and other. During this time her situation has improved greatly and this hard working mother is planning to acquire a larger amount of products in order to improve her business for the benefit of her small son. Let us fulfill her request so that this worried mother can reach her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Cecilia, hace cuatro años y luego de terminar su contrato con la empresa para la cual laboraba decidió aperturar en casa un pequeño bazar en el que ofrece una inmensa variedad de artículos para la oficina, casa y demás.Durante el tiempo de su desempeño las cosas en casa han mejorado notablemente y el plan de esta trabajadora madre es adquirir mayor cantidad de artículos para consolidar su pequeño espacio de ventas en beneficio de su pequeño hijo.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta preocupada madre alcance la meta que se ha propuesto.

loans.use: Additional capital to acquire more inventory

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda is a mother of two small school age children. Her wishes to improve her living conditions in her home have steered her to open a beauty shop at her residence where she provides haircuts and styling. This activity has in a short period of time made her able to reach her goal and now she is working towards another one. The number of appointments has been increasing as well as the request for additional services. She is planning to acquire a large number of beauty products to improve her business. She also wants to enlarge the area for her pretty customers. Let us fulfill her request so that this small shop can turn into the most important one in the city.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Yolanda, es madre de dos pequeños niños que aún se encuentran en etapa escolar, su deseo de incrementar su nivel de vida en casa la condujeron a implementar en su domicilio un espacio para brindar servicios de cortes y peinados.Con esta actividad en poco tiempo ha podido conseguir su propósito y ahora se ha planteado uno nuevo; debido a que el número de visitas ha ido incrementándose al igual que las solicitudes y peticiones de nuevos servicios. Tiene en mente adquirir un gran número artículos de belleza para implementar su espacio de servicios, además de ampliar el espacio al que acuden sus bellas clientas.Posibilitemos su petición para que esta pequeña estética pronto se convierta en la mejor y más importante de su ciudad.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products and expansion of place of business

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
Maria De La Luz is a single mother of two children. She is putting them through school so that they would have a better future. She can do this thanks to the fact that she has started a small business selling natural consumer products. At first she tried these products herself and noted that they worked, this made her realize that these products could sell and with the help of her family, little by little attracted customers that currently seek her out, to sell them these dietary supplements.

In December, however, her sales decreased and she currently does not have enough money to replenish her inventory. This is the reason for Maria to be requesting a USD $525 loan that she is going to repay in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy merchandise to offer to her customers. With your help Maria will be able to improve the future of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

María de la Luz es madre soltera de dos hijos. A quienes tiene estudiando para que sean personas de bien, los mantiene estudiando gracias a que María decidió comenzar su propia microempresa de venta de productos naturales para consumo personal. Primero María utilizó estos productos y se dio cuenta que servían, fue así como se convenció de que estos productos los podía vender y asó poco a poco empezando con su familia comenzó a hacerse de clientes que actualmente la buscan para poder venderles estos complementos a sus dietas.

Sin embargo en Diciembre las ventas para María disminuyeron, y es por eso que maría actualmente no cuenta con dinero suficiente como para resurtir su negocio. Es por eso que María está solicitando un crédito de US $525 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar mercancía para poder ofrecerle a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa Idalia arrived in the city of Reynosa 3 years ago. Her first job was helping her brother work in a taco shop during the afternoon. As time passed, she decided to start her own business. She started in her house, selling school supplies. This generated good earning and with those she began to grow her business. Now she has a store separate from her home.

Nonetheless, she needs to purchase display cases and merchandise in order to complete her remodeling. For this reason, Rosa Idalia is requesting a credit of $550 which she will pay within 6 months and with this money purchase display cases and merchandise needed to offer a greater selection to her customers. With your help, Rosa will be able to succeed and build equity for the moment when she decided to begin a family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Idalia llegó a la ciudad de Reynosa hace ya 3 años, su primer trabajo fue ayudándole a su hermano atendiendo una taqueria por las tardes. Con el paso del tiempo ella decidió poner su propio negocio, inicio en su casa vendiendo artículos para la escuela, esto le generaba buenos ingresos y conforme a ellos se ha ido ampliando, ahora ya tiene un local afuera de su casa.

Sin embargo necesita comprar mostradores y mercancía para poder completar su remodelación. Es por eso que Rosa Idalia está solicitando un crédito de US $550 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar mostradores y comprar la mercancía necesaria para poder ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Rosa podrá salir adelante y formar un patrimonio para cuando desee formar una familia.

loans.use: Purchase furniture and materials for expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more sandal making materials and accessories

loans.name: Laura Elena

texts.es:
In preparatory school, Laura Elena took a sewing class, which she liked very much. Also, she was motivated to take up this career choice due to the fact that classmates who had taken this course and who were working in this field informed her that they earned good money while still having free time to enjoy other activities. Consequently, she was encouraged to start her own tailoring business. Little by little, she is becoming known in her area.

It is for this that Laura Elena is soliciting a credit of US $375, which will be repayed within 3 months. With this money, Laura will buy materials such as fabric, thread, and other products needed to make her products. She can then continue growing her business and give better service to her customers. With your help, Laura will be able to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Laura Elena en la preparatoria tomó un curso de corte y confección ya que a ella le gusta mucho. También otra motivación que la llevó a esta actividad fue que sus compañeras que tomaron este curso ya estaban trabajando en esta actividad y le comentaron que les dejaba buenos ingresos y hasta un tiempo libre para más actividades. Fue así como se animó a poner un taller de costura. Poco a poco se está dando a conocer en sus alrededores.

Es por eso que Laura Elena está solicitando un crédito de US $ 375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero Laura comprará mercancía como telas, hilos, y otros productos necesarios para poder elaborar sus productos y así seguir creciendo su negocio y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Laura podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Diversify her inventory with more products

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Carmen began her business selling candies, mandarin oranges and dried shrimp from her parents who had dedicated their life to the business for 40 years with good returns. Along with what her husband earned, they were not able to make enough to pay for the school expenses of their two children. For this reason, she decided to begin this business since it produces good earnings and can help with the financial expenses of her household and her children’s school expenses.

Nonetheless, Maria del Carmen is requesting a loan of US$275 that she will be able to payback in 6 months and with this money Maria will be able to purchase more merchandise to offer a greater assortment of products. In this manner, offer her children a better future by being able to pay for their studies. With your help, Maria will make her dream a reality by seeing the progress of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Ma Carmen inicio el negocio de la venta de Dulces, mandarinas y camarón seco motivada por sus padres ya que ellos se han dedicado al comercio desde hace más de 40 años obteniendo muy buenas utilidades. Además de que lo que gana su esposo no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus dos hijos. Es por eso que decidió iniciar este tipo de negocio ya que le deja buenas ganancias y puede apoyar en los gastos económicos de su hogar y en los gastos escolares de sus hijos.

Sin embargo Ma. Del Carmen está solicitando un crédito de US $275 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero María podrá comprar más mercancía para poder tener variedad en sus productos. Y así poderles brindar a sus hijos un mejor futuro gracias a que les podrá pagar los estudios. Con tu ayuda María podrá hacer su sueño realidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to applify the assortment in her business

loans.name: Rosanna Francisca

texts.en: Rosanna is a friendly entrepreneur who wants to open her own beauty slaon for the women and girls of Palavé, a comunity of San Cristobal.  She will be twenty-six years old tomorrow and is ready to celebrate with her two children and her loyal customers. Rosanna has been running a nail salon for four years.  She offers services such as manicures, pedicures, nail polish, drawing on nails, nail repair and more.  She explains that she constantly has to invest in materials such as acrylic, artificial nails, varnish, nail scissors, and nailfiles. She also says that she has a well established clientele, and Rosanna would like funds to expand her business.  With the loan requested, she will purchase a new nail polish machine so she can hire one more girl so she can care for more than one customer at a time.The entrepreneur mentions that she hopes her business will be successful enough so that she will attract more customers and hire at least five more employees.

loans.use: Loan will be used to open a beauty salon, purchase a new nail polish machine, and hire one employee .

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a greater variety of products

loans.name: Juana María

texts.en: Juana María is 45 years old.  She lives with her husband and four children in Palavé, in San Cristobal.  Juana is a versatile businesswoman.  She has been running a grocery store in her community for three years.  She also prepares and sells traditional Dominican foods for lunch.   She will use the loan to expand her business so that she will be able to send her children to a university so that they will get a better education.  She thanks you in advance for the loan.

loans.use: This second loan will be invested to replenish a small grocery store.

loans.name: Iris Tavera

texts.en:
Iris is an eighteen year old girl that struggles to make a living.  She goes to a private school and she will enter the university in two years.  Currently, Iris sells gold and silver-plated jewel.  She explains that she began selling jewels by catalog for a company, two years ago.  She acquired a lot of experiences, and as she wanted to earn more, she decided to start her own business.  With her partner’s help, she invested in the purchase of the jewels, and she is running the business within her house in Palavé, community of San Cristobal.
Iris hopes she can achieve success with her business enterprise.  She wants to increase her income so that she can put aside money to support her forthcoming university studies.  The entrepreneur is asking for a loan to spend in the buy of more jewels to keep meeting her customers’ demand.  Iris is living with her young partner and she has to work hard to help him support the couple expenses.

loans.use: To purchase gold-plated and silver-plated jewels for a small business.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Guillermina began her business on the advice of her parents who had a similar business in the city where she was born, Veracruz. She began the business after she was let go after two years at from a factory job. With the little money she had saved she bought a small grinder and installed it in her house, where she began to sell masa (corn flour) for tamales and tortillas, then she began to provide merchandise for a small grocery store. This is how she began her small business to support her husband with the household expenses and her three children.

Nevertheless the grocery business doesn’t have enough stock, as various customers have stopped coming because she doesn’t have the products they seek. Therefore Guillermina is asking for a loan of US $650 that will be repaid in 6 months to be able to buy more merchandise so her clients don’t go to her competitors. With your help Guillermina will be able to provide a future for her children and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Guillermina empezó su negocio por consejo de sus padres que tienen un negocio similar en su pueblo natal Veracruz, esto sucedió a raíz de que la despidieron del trabajo que tuvo por más de 2 años en una maquiladora. Con el poco dinero que ahorró compró un pequeño molino y lo instaló en su casa, donde empezó a vender masa para tamales y tortillas, posteriormente empezó a surtir mercancía para poner una tienda de abarrotes en general. Y fue así como se hizo de su pequeño negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de sus tres hijos.

Sin embargo el negocio que tiene de abarrotes no cuenta con suficiente surtido, puesto que varios clientes se han retirado ya que no encuentran los productos que andan buscando. Es por eso que Guillermina está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Guillermina podrá comprar más mercancía para que sus clientes no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda Guillermina podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante y crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Cruz María

texts.en:
Cruz María is the proprietor and operator of a casual clothing store which she started three years ago.  Cruz is thirty-three years old, and she and her husband have two children.  She is currently pregnant.
Cruz mentions that in the beginning things were not easy and she was very worried about finding money to start the small store.  “Obtaining funds for my business have never been so stress-free”, she says showing a hearty smile, referring  to the loan she got from FSMA a few months ago.  She used her loan to buy men and women’s clothing for her store.  She has also remodeled a room of her house and there she is operating the store.  Cruz María hopes her business can keep growing so that she can continue on supporting her children's studies.
With her loan, the entrepreneur will get clothing in bulk to move her business forward.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk for a small business.

loans.name: Elva Elisa

texts.es:
Mrs. Elva started a business of selling jewelry and shoes with the intent of earning extra income to be able to cover her household costs and the education of her son. This has provides her with good income and does not take all her time, allowing her to attend to her other duties and the care of her son, keeping him out of any trouble.

Elva wishes to buy merchandise in wholesale quantities for a lower cost. For this reason she is requesting a loan of USD $375, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money she will be able to buy shoes wholesale and offer better prices to her customers as February 14th approaches. With your help she will be able to move her family ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elva inicio el negocio de venta de joyería y venta de calzado con el propósito de tener un ingreso extra, para poder mantener los gastos económicos en su hogar y de la escuela de su hijo. Esta actividad le ha dejado buenos ingresos y aparte no le dedica todo su tiempo ya que le permite realizar otras actividades y no descuidar a su hijo para que no se meta en malos pasos.

Elva desea comprar mercancía de por volumen de mayoreo para poder obtener un costo más bajo. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $375 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elva podrá comprar por mayoreo los zapatos y así poderles dar un mejor precio a sus clientes ya que se acerca el 14 de Febrero. Con tu ayuda Elva podrá sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elvia Celina

texts.es:
Elvia Celina began giving bus service for two reasons, the main reason being helping her husband with finances. The second reason was to help the neighborhood moms who didn'thave a way to transport their children to school. She's been able in improve her financial life and at the same time help others in her town.

However, the bus she uses to transport the children needs repairs. This is why Celina is requesting a credit of $650 which she is willing to repay in 6 months. With this money she will be able to give maintenance to the bus, get new tires, among other things. With your help she will be able to improve her bus and offer her own children a better future

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Elvia Celina comenzó a brindar servicio de transporte escolar por dos razones, la principal fue para poder ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y sus dos hijos y la segunda razón fue para ayudar a las madres de familia que se encuentran en su colonia y no tienen en qué llevar a sus hijos a la escuela en con la confianza de que no les pase nada. Hasta hoy ha ido creciendo poco a poco y así a podido salir adelante a su familia en todas las cuestiones económicas.

Sin embargo la camioneta en la que transporta a los niños ya necesita reparación es por eso que Elvia Celina está solicitando un crédito de US $650 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Elvia podrá comprar refacciones, y darle mantenimiento en pintura, llantas, entre otras cosas. Con tu ayuda Elvia podrá sacar adelante su negocio y así poder brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos.

loans.use: Maintenance for her school bus

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio S. is originally from Tuxpan Veracruz and has traveled to Reynosa Tamaulipas to be able to offer his family a better future. Upon reaching this city, however he could not find work for he has only completed primary school. Because of this, he decided to start a business selling sweets which has given him good income and family stability. Additionally, depending on the season, he sells corn on the cob, snow cones, toys and other items.

Eusebio would like to establish a business in his home and increase the variety of merchandise to include groceries and clothing. This is the reason for his request of a loan of USD $325 which he will repay in 3 months. With this money he will buy more merchandise which will allow him to increase his income and be able to pay for his children’s schooling. With your help Eusebio can fulfill his dream of getting ahead through his hard work and the dedication.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Eusebio S., es originario de Tuxpan Veracruz, y viajó a Reynosa Tamaulipas con el propósito de ofrecerle a su familia un mejor futuro, sin embargo al llegar a esta ciudad no encontraba trabajo debido a que únicamente concluyo su educación primaria. Es por ese motivo que decidió emprender un negocio de venta de dulces que le dejara buenos ingresos y estabilidad familiar, además de ofrecer dependiendo de la temporada, también vende elotes, raspas, venta de juguetes entre otras cosas.

Sin embargo Eusebio desea establecerse en su casa y ampliar el repertorio de sus ventas introduciendo abarrotes y venta de ropa, es por tal motivo que está solicitando un crédito de US $325 que está dispuesto a pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero poder comprar la mercancía y así con este dinero poder obtener mayores ingresos para pagar los gastos de la escuela de sus hijos. Con tu ayuda Eusebio podrá cumplir su sueño de salir adelante con el esfuerzo y dedicación que le tiene a las ventas.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries and clothing for sale

loans.name: Herlinda's Group

texts.en:
Herlinda, Victoria, y Lidia Aydee are all resent members of the community bank “Solución”.  Herlinda is 28 years old and Lidia Aydee is 29, they both have small children.  Victoria is 52 and has seven children.
They all agreed that in their community bank they have learned values such as, to save, to be responsible, punctual, and to respect women.  They said that as well, they have learned a lot from the lessons given by the bank.  In their bank they can relax and forget about their problems.
Herlinda has sold vegetables in the market since April of last year.
On the other hand, Victoria sells prepared food in the Nery Garcia market.  She has been doing this for the last ten years.  On the holidays she travels to different communities to sell her food.  Meanwhile, Linda Aydee sells cheese in several different markets.
Their loans are for 400, 600, and 600 soles respectively.  They will be invested in buying vegetables, oil, potatoes, sausage, chicken, cheese, and transportation.  
Herlinda, Victoria, and Lidia Aydee will use their savings to buy land and build houses from solid materials, and to improve the education of their children.
The dreams of Herlinda, and Victoria are to have their own car to help transport vegetables between Lima and Ayacucho.  Lidia Aydee’s dream is to run a grocery store from her house.

loans.use: Their loans are for 400, 600, and 600 soles respectively.  They will be invested in buying vegetables, oil, potatoes, sausage, chicken, cheese, and transportation.

loans.name: Maria Rocio's Group

texts.en:
Maria Rocio, Maria Victoria, and Edilberta have been part of the community bank “Solución” for five, five, and three years respectively.  They commented that in the community bank they have learned discipline, to be responsible, punctual, and to save.
Maria Rocio is 33 years old and has one son who is still in school.  She sells juices from a stand in the central market.  She also collects a local fruit called a “tuna” which comes from a cactus and travels to Lima on the weekends to sell it.
Maria Victoria is 40 years old and has four children who are all students.  She sells clothing in an open-air market in the town of Huamanga.
Edilberta is 75 years old and has a business selling candies from a cart.  
Their loans are for 2000, 400, and 200 respectively.  Their loans will be invested in expanding their businesses by buying new fruits, vegetables, clothing, and different types of candies.
Maria Rocio, Maria Victoria, and Edilberta think that they will use their savings to improve their houses, to educate their children, to buy medicines which they need, and to improve the quality of life for their families.  Their dreams are to own their own car to help transport merchandise, and to help their children receive an education in order to work as professionals.

loans.use:
Edilberta is 75 years old and has a business selling candies from a cart.  
Their loans are for 2000, 400, and 200 respectively.  Their loans will be invested in expanding their businesses by buying new fruits, vegetables, clothing, and different types of candies.

loans.name: Olga's Group

texts.en:
Olga and Maria Alejandra have been part of the community bank “Solución” for the past four and three years respectively.  Olga is 34 years old and has seven children, meanwhile Maria Alejandra is 54 years old and has five children.  Both Olga and Maria Alejandra are single mothers.  They commented that in their community bank they have learned to save, to care for their families, to educate their children, to run their business, and how to bring in clients.  
Olga has sold desserts in the Nery Garcia public market since she was very young.  With this job Olga has been able to care for her children.  On the other hand, Maria Alejandra travels every Sunday to the market in Vinchos, a small town about an hour away from the town of Huamanga by bus.  There she sells fish, rice, sugar, fruits and vegetables.  Sometimes Maria Alejandra prepares and sells fixed meals at the market.  During the week she runs a business washing laundry.  
Both Olga and Maria Alejandra have requested loans of 600 soles with which they will buy, gelatin, sugar, cups, plates, fish, vegetables, fruits, and other types of grocery items.  
Olga is waiting to use her savings and build an adobe house.  Maria Alejandra will use her savings to par for medical care for her youngest son.  Eventually, she hopes to save enough to buy a minibus that her other son will drive.  
Olga’s dream is to start a new business selling plastic wares, the same as her sisters.  On the other hand Maria Alejandra dreams of buying a house in the center of the city where she can open a grocery store.  Where she lives now is far away and not a good place for a business.  Also, she would like to buy a small piece of land where she can grow vegetables.

loans.use: Both Olga and Maria Alejandra have requested loans of 600 soles with which they will buy, gelatin, sugar, cups, plates, fish, vegetables, fruits, and other types of grocery items

loans.name: Yeny's Group

texts.en:
Yenny, Haydee, and Julia have been associates in the community bank “Palmeras” for the last year and a half, three years, and eight years respectively.  Yenny is 26 years old and single, meanwhile Haydee is 20 and lives with her partner and one-year-old child.  Julia is 60 years old and is married with eight children.
Yenny and Haydee have worked in the Nery Garcia public market for the last 15 years selling meat.  They buy live animals and then butcher them.
As a change, Julia has a small grocery store where she has sold vegetables for the past 30 years.  Furthermore, she makes and sells meals from her house.
Yenny, Haydee, and Julia each need loans of 400 soles, which will be invested in buying cattle and expanding their business to incluD. corn, fava beans, rice, sugar, soap, detergent and other things to broaden the variety of meals they offer.
Yenny, Haydee, and Julia have learned to be responsible and punctual, to work together and solve problems.  They have learned about self-esteem, to believe in themselves, and that they have personal value.  Yenny’s dream is to be happy as a woman, and an excellent professional.  She hopes that her family will be happy, healthy, and safe.  Haydee dreams that one day she will be a better mother and have a job as a professional.  While Julia hopes to see her children have better lives

loans.use: Yenny, Haydee, and Julia each need loans of 400 soles, which will be invested in buying cattle and expanding their business to include corn, fava beans, rice, sugar, soap, detergent and other things to broaden the variety of meals they offer.

loans.name: Zenovia's Group

texts.en:
Zenovia and Lourdes are new members of the community bank “Palmeras”.  Zenovia is 55 years old, is married and has six children, three of which are boys and three girls.  The youngest three are still in high school.  For the last two years Zenovia has had a grocery store where she sells potatoes and meat in the small town of Mollepata.
On the other hand, Lourdes is 20 years old and lives with her partner and eight month old baby.  She has sold food from her house in the town of Wari Accopampa for the last year.
Zenovia and Lourdes need loans of 200 and 400 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying potatoes from local farmers, improving their houses, and buying supplies for their businesses.
Zenovia is very happy to be part of the community bank.  They have taught her how to run her business more efficiently.  She has learned the importance of saving.  Furthermore, Lourdes has learned to be responsible, punctual, and how to communicate effectively.  She is much less timid and has learned how to make connections with the people around her.  Zenovia’s dream is to make her business constantly more profitable.  Lourdes dreams of opening a large restaurant in Huamanga

loans.use: Zenovia and Lourdes need loans of 200 and 400 soles respectively, which will be invested in buying potatoes from local farmers, improving their houses, and buying supplies for their businesses.

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma, And Maria, and Eudosia have been part of the community bank “Solución” for four, five, two years respectively.  In their community bank they have learned to be responsible, how to care for their children, how to have healthy relationships with their husbands, and to be punctual. 
Vilma is 28 and has one 12-year-old son.  She sells groceries, vegetables, and meats in the markets of the Ayacuchan jungle.  She has done this for the past 11 years, since she was very young.  From the jungle she brings coco, peanuts, and coffee, which she sells on the return trip.  On the other hand, Ana Maria is 38 and has four children.  She has three stands where she sells CDs and DVDs.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  Now she is helping her daughters who need to work.  Meanwhile Eudosia is 51 years old and has one 18-year-old son.  She sells groceries from her friend’s house in the Belén neighborhood.  Before she sold grains at open-air markets in the region.  She chose to start a new business in order to spend more time with her children.
Vilma, Ana Maria, and Eudosia need loans of 400, 600, and 100 soles, which they will invest in buying fish, celery, onion, chilli, carrots, sugar, beans, shoes, dies, soap, detergents, oil, milk and condiments.  Their savings are to expand the merchandise in their businesses, to educate their children, and to improve the roof on their house.  Ana Maria’s dream is to have a second business, and that her children can be professionals.  On the other hand Vilma dreams of having a car and a piece of land.  Meanwhile, Eudosia’s dream is to have a bigger business.

loans.use: Vilma, Ana Maria, and Eudosia need loans of 400, 600, and 100 soles, which they will invest in buying fish, celery, onion, chilli, carrots, sugar, beans, shoes, dies, soap, detergents, oil, milk and condiments.

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma and Basilia have been part of the community bank “solución” for two years.  In their bank they have learned to save, to be punctual, how to avoid getting sick and how to avoid domestic violence.  
Vilma is 25 years old.  She is married and has one four-year-old son.  She started selling vegetables in different markets because her son was very young and she could not travel with him.  Now she rents cell phones to people on the main streets of Ayacucho.
On the other hand Basilia is 34 and lives with her partner and three children who are 20, 17, and 13 years old.  Bastilia has sold fruits at the Inca Market for three years.  Furthermore Bastilla makes bricks for construction.  She learned this activity from her husband, but now runs the business.
Vilma and Basilia need loans of 400 and 600 soles respectively.  These will be invested in buying wood to run the kilns that fire the bricks and to add a new telephone line.  They are saving to buy a piece of land and build a house.  Vilma’s dream is to start a business as a seamstress and that her children will be professionals.  Meanwhile, Basilia dreams of having her own house and opening a restaurant.

loans.use: Vilma and Basilia need loans of 400 and 600 soles respectively.  These will be invested in buying wood to run the kilns that fire the bricks and to add a new telephone line.

loans.name: Teodomira's Group

texts.en:
Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael are members of the community bank “Palmeras”.  They have been members for 12, 12, and 1 year respectively.
In their community bank they have learned to be better business people by saving and being punctual.  Their bank has also taught them about solidarity and working together. Alicia told us that going to the meetings and completing the tasks gives her a sense of accomplishment and dignity.  
Teodomira is 60 years old and has three children.  She sells meat which she has done all of her life. She learned this business from her parents.  
Alicia is 42 years old and has four daughters aged 12, 10, 6, and 3.  She sells grocery items at various open-air markets.  She did not finish school and started this business out of necessity.  She hopes that her children will not have to work so hard.  
On the other hand Rapfael has two children.  He rents traditional clothing for use in folkloric dances and festivals.  He learned how to make clothing from his mother who is a respected artisan.  Before starting his business he worked for a bigger company, but is much happier being his own boss.
Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, respectively to expand their business.  Teodomira needs to buy cows, chickens and other live animals.  Alicia hopes to expand her business by buying beans, rice, and sugar.  Rafhael wants to buy raw materials such as cloth, and thread as well as traditional hats in order to prepare for the up coming carnival.
Their dreams are all that their children can be professionals and not have to work in the conditions that their parents had to.

loans.use: Teodomira, Alicia, and Rafhael need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 1400 soles, respectively to expand their business.  Teodomira needs to buy cows, chickens and other live animals.  Alicia hopes to expand her business by buying beans, rice, and sugar.  Rafhael wants to buy raw materials such as cloth, and thread as well as traditional hats in order to prepare for the up coming carnival.

loans.name: Donatilda's Group

texts.en:
Donatilda, Rayda, and Ana have been members of the community bank “Palmeras” for less than a year. 
Donatilda is 42 years old and has five children.  She prepares traditional food, which she sells from a small stand in the country.  She has had her stand for three years but has been cooking all of her life.
Rayda is 22 years old.  She started selling ceviche, a traditional dish made from fish, when she was in high school in order to be able to continue her education.  With a loan from the community bank she was able to start a small grocery store.  
Ana is 31 and has a nine-year-old son.  At the moment Ana sells a traditional drink made from herbs native to the region from a small stand.  She started this business seven years ago in order to better care for her son.  
They need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles,  Donatilda needs to buy oil, rice, sugar, and potatoes to prepare food.  Rayda wants to expand her grocery store to include rice, beans, and sugar.  Ana is hoping to use this loan to help her open a café. 
They are all very happy to be part of the community bank.  They have learned valuable things such as responsibility, punctuality, and savings.  They all said that they look forward to coming to meetings and learning new things.    
Their dreams for the future are different.  Donatilda hopes to be able to help her children continue their studies.  Rayda wants to get married and have her own home.  Meanwhile Ana hopes to study tailoring and expand her business.

loans.use: They need loans of 600 soles, 400 soles, 600 soles,  Donatilda needs to buy oil, rice, sugar, and potatoes to prepare food.  Rayda wants to expand her grocery store to include rice, beans, and sugar.  Ana is hoping to use this loan to help her open a café.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her inventory, particularly with beach clothing and items

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
I. Muhabbat is 44 years old. She's married and has two school-aged children.

Muhabbat has been running her business for three years. She sells children's clothes including national dresses for girls. The store is located in a very busy part of the city. Muhabbat has a pleasant disposition and has many clients. The business is quite stable and the revenue that is generated serves as a significant source of income for the family.

Muhabbat has been a client of IMON for more than 1 year. She's managed to repay all her loans on a timely basis. Muhabbat is requesting an additional loan of $300 to purchase children's winter clothes for her store. She thanks everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan in two months.

loans.use: Purchase additional children's clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Marsani

texts.en: Marsani is a 50-year-old woman, whose husband, S., is unemployed. She has been supporting her family by selling chickens, earning US$10.5 per day. She is requesting a loan of US$150 to expand her business. She is a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sumiati

texts.en: Sumiati is a 37-year-old woman, who sells chickens to provide for her family's needs. She usually earns US$15.7 per day and earns a small profit. Her husband, A., has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to add to her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Sahati

texts.en: Sahati is a 51-year-old woman who sells snacks, coffee, candies, etc. at her small food stall. She earns upto US$9.5 per day. Her husband, S. has been unemployed for a long time, so she is now supporting her family's daily needs. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to buy more goods for her food stall. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her food stall

loans.name: Rohaeni

texts.en: Rohaeni is a 33-year-old woman who sells ice, snacks, etc. at her food stall, earning US$5 a day.  Her husband, J., does not work anymore, so the family depends on her business. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$125 to fill her stall. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her food stall

loans.name: Rohat

texts.en:
S. Rohat is 47 years old. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is married.

Rohat has been running her clothing store for three years. She sells and rents traditional wedding dresses including the national wedding dress. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large. Consequently, there are lots of marriages and Rohat has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to the family’s income.

During the previous loan cycle she repaid the loan on time. Rohat is now requesting $300.00 in order to purchase a new wedding dress that she can rent to her clients. She gives her assurance that the loan will be fully paid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase a new wedding dress for rent.

loans.name: Cicih

texts.en: Cicih M. is a 36-year-old woman, who sells chickens to support her family's needs. She cleans the chickens before selling them at the market, earning US$10.5 a day and earns a small profit. Her husband, Muhadis, does not work anymore, so she is the only one who supports the family. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$125 to add to her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti Y. is a 26-year-old mother, who has a small grocery store where she sells snacks, candies, household goods, etc., and also fresh food. She earns US$16 a day while her husband, Rusnadi, has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$100 to add her business so she could earn more income for her children's education. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Nuryanah

texts.en: Nuryanah is a 45-year-old widow. She sells crispy snacks such as biscuits, etc. door-to-door, earning US$8 a day with a small profit. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$100 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Jaamah

texts.en: Jaamah is a 48-year-old woman who sells fresh food at her wagon such as meat balls and noodles, earning US$16 a day and earns a small profit. She has to work hard to support her family because her husband, A., is unemployed. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$150 to add to her working capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add her business capital

loans.name: Melih

texts.en: Melih T. is a 36-year-old woman who has a snack stall where she sells crispy chips, candies, snacks, etc. She earns US$8 a day and makes a small profit. She has to work hard to support her family because her husband, Atmaja, has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$75 to fill her stall with more goods. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her stall with more goods

loans.name: Sati

texts.en: Sati is a 50-year-old woman who sells chickens at the market to support her family needs since her husband, S., has been unemployed for a long time. She earns upto US$10.5 a day. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$150 to add her working capital. She will repay this loan within period of 12 months.

loans.use: To add to her working capital

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang A., 43 year old, lives in Manistutu Village, West Bali with her husband and three children. Two of her children are in middle school, while her third child is still an infant. Her husband is a farmer who works his land daily. To fill her spare time, Ni Komang opened a kiosk in her home. With $550 loan, Ni Komang A. plans to complete her kiosk offering with various food and drink items like rice, oil and various spices. Because of her kioskś strategic location, Ni KOmangś kiosk grew quickly. Ni Komang can earn about $3.30 daily. Ni Komang is so grateful that her earnings can help support her familyś income. She hopes to be able to save in addition to paying the loan on time.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Komang A., 43 tahun, tinggal didesa Manistutu, Bali Barat bersama suami dan tiga orang anaknya. Dua orang anaknya sudah duduk dibangku SMP dan SD, sedangkan anak yang ketiga masih balita. Suaminya berprofesi sebagai seorang petani yang kesehariannya mengerjakan lahan persawahan miliknya. Untuk mengisi hari –harinya dirumah, Ni Komang A. membuka usaha warung dirumahnya. Dengan modal pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.-, Ni Komang A. melengkapi warungnya dengan berbagai kebutuhan sehari – hari, seperti aneka makanan dan minuman ringan, beras, minyak dan berbagai jenis bumbu dapur. Karena letak usahanya yang strategis, warung Ni Komang A. cepat berkembang. Dalam sehari Ni Komang A. bisa mendapat keuntungan bersih sebesar Rp. 30.000.- Ni Komang A. sangat bersyukur akan hal itu, karena penghasilannya bisa membantu menopang perekonomian keluarganya, menabung dan mengembalikan pinjaman tepat waktu.

loans.use: Fixture Improvement

loans.name: Jaemah

texts.en: Jaemah is a 37-year-old woman. She earn her income by making and selling flavoured ice at her house. She produces various flavours, puts them into plastic bags, freezes them and then sells them, earning US$2 a day. Her husband, U., has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$150 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nursanah

texts.en: Nursanah is a 42-year-old mother, and with her husband, E., runs a chicken livestock. They raise chickens to get eggs. Every month they sell these eggs to the market for US$0.9 per kg.  Nursanah is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to buy more chicks. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more chicks

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
It is the norm in Indonesian villages that women should stay home to take care of children and clean home while waiting for husbands to come home from work. This is not the case for Ni Made S.. She lives in a village, and her husband works for the local government. Ni Made S. wants to help her husband in earning better living for her family. With startup funding of $110, Ni Made S. opened a kiosk selling snacks and soft drinks. She bought small racks, thermos flasks and various snacks and drinks. Because her location is close to the village primary school, there are many school kids that buys her products. In a day, Ni Made S. can earn $3 profit. Ni Made S. is seeking $550 loan from Dinari Foundation. This fund will be used to renovate her kiosk as it needs improvement and has no walls.
