Besides that the loan will be used to increase offering variety such as instant noodle and meatballs that her clients often requested. She hopes that she will earn more business with better and more hygienic kiosk condition and with better product offerings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sudah menjadi opini publik, khususnya di pedesaan, bahwa seorang wanita hanya tinggal dirumah untuk merawat anak dan membersihkan rumah sambil menunggu suami datang dari tempat kerja. Hal ini tidak berlaku bagi Ni Made S.. Walaupun tinggal di pedesaan dan suaminya bekerja pada Instansi Pemerintahan, Ni Made S. ingin membantu perekonomian keluarganya dan memiliki hasil dari jerih payahnya sendiri sehingga ia tidak hanya mengandalkan penghasilan suaminya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 1.000.000.- , Ni Made S. membuka usaha warung yang khusus menjual aneka kue dan minuman ringan. Modal itu ia belikan sebuah rak kecil, gelas, termos es, aneka kue dan minuman ringan. Karena lokasinya dekat dengan Sekolah Dasar, banyak anak – anak yang berbelanja diwarungnya sehingga dalam sehari Ni Made S. bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 25.000.- Saat ini Ni Made S. memohon pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- di Yayasan Dinari. Dana ini akan ia gunakan untuk memperbaiki warungnya, karena yang saat ini kondisinya kurang baik dan belum ada dindingnya. Selain itu, dana tersebut akan digunakan untuk menambah fasilitas warung berupa mie instant dan bakso sesuai permintaan dari pelanggannya. Dengan kondisi warung yang lebih baik dan hyeginis serta fasilitas warung yang ditambah, Ni Made S. yakin usahanya akan berkembang lebih maju.

loans.use: To Renovate Kiosk

loans.name: Rohyati

texts.en: Rohyati is a 34-year-old woman who sells chickens to support her family needs, earning US$10.5 a day, while her husband, M. T., has no regular income. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to increase her business capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en: Dewi is a 24-year-old woman who has a small shop where she sells snacks, candies, beverages, etc. to earn extra income for the family. Doing this she earns US$8 a day. Her husband, I., is a laborer who earns a small income. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$75 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion business

loans.name: Ashurov

texts.en:
Ashurov R. lives in Nausky rayon; he is married and has 4 children.  Ashurov R. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he recommended himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mr.Ashurov is very experienced in his business (about 15 years).  He is a driver in the PLC “Nonpaz” by professional background.  He has a wide business including livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  He dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (he supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. 

Now Mr.Ashurov requests a loan of $1050 for a horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow purchase, which will allow him to significantly increase the family income and plan further business development and assortment widening.

loans.use: For the purchase of a horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow

loans.name: Ni Komang

texts.id:
Ni Komang N., 36 year old, trades local commodities like bananas, coconuts and coconut leaves. She has been in the business for a year. Ni Komang travels from one village to another with her motorcycle to buy commodities from local farmers to be resold to wholesaler. At this time, the demand for commodities are significant, especially around Hindu holidays. Those commodities are sold in Denpasar by wholesalers to vendors in local markets. Because of lack of funding, Ni Komang N. often cannot fulfill all orders. WIth a loan of $560, Ni Komang N. should be able to buy more inventories to fulfill all orders. She wants to serve the farmers whom she buys her products from better. Ni Komang always pays cash to the farmers so she earns their trust and prefers to do business with her. In every transactions, Ni Komang N. can reap $11 profit. That earnings can support her familyś needs and she could also save significantly for her familyś future.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Komang N., 36 tahun, mempunyai usaha jual beli hasil bumi yang berupa pisang, kelapa yang dikupas dan daun kelapa muda. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak dua tahun yang lalu. Dengan sepeda motor yang dimilikinya, Ni Komang N. berkeliling dari satu desa ke desa yang lain untuk mencari dagangan yang nantinya akan dijual kembali kepada pedagang besar. Saat ini kebutuhan akan hasil bumi sangat besar terutama menjelang hari raya umay Hindu. Semua hasil bumi itu akan dijual ke Denpasar oleh pedagang besar. Karena kekurangan modal, seringkali Ni Komang N. tidak bisa memenuhi pesanan. Dengan pinjaman sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- , Ni Komang N. bisa membeli hasil bumi dengan jumlah yang cukup lumayan sehingga pesanan akan terpenuhi. Yang paling penting bagi Ni Komang N. adalah pelayanannya kepada petani yang dibeli hasil buminya. Ni Komang N. selalu membayar langsung kepada petani saat membeli dagangannya sehingga petani pun akan merasa puas dan akan kembali menjual kepadanya. Setiap transaksi, Ni Koman N. bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 100.000.- Penghasilan itu bisa untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarganya, untuk modal usaha dan disisihkan untuk ditabung.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Astini

texts.en: Astini is a 33-year-old woman who has a kiosk selling motorcycle spareparts, earning US$5 a day. Her husband, R., has been unemployed for a long time. She is a member of MBK and requesting a loan of US$150 to expand her business. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Saidalieva

texts.en:
Saidalieva M. lives in Nausky rayon; she is married and has 2 children.  Saidalieva M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005.  She recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Saidalieva M. is very experienced in her business (about 10 years) and it is the family business.  She is the security guard in the rayon typography.  She is also engaged in the business of livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (she supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. 

Now Mrs. Saidalieva M. requests a loan of $475 for business development, which will permit her to significantly increase the family income and plan further business development and assortment widening.  She dreams, as any mother, to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Y., 51 year old, realized a terrific business opportunity in her village. Currently there are many traveling buyers that purchases cacao directly from farmers. Many farmers are planting cacao trees in their fields as it provides quick production turnaround and easy to take care of. Ni Wayan Warni does not want to compete directly with other traveling traders, she decided to enter the cacao drying business. Ni Wayan Warni plans to use the loan from DInari to purchase scales and cacao nuts from traders. These cacao nuts are then sold to wholesalers that comes to her home once a week. At this time, dry cacao trades at $1.20 to $ 1.45 per kilograms. Ni Wayan Warni can get profit of up to 5 to 11 cents per kilogram. In one transaction Ni Wayan Warni can purchase 100 kg Cacao nuts and resell it to the wholesaler. So Ni Wayan Warni can gain $11 profit per transaction (once a week).

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Ni Wayan Y., 51 tahun, melihat peluang yang baik di desanya. Saat ini banyak pembeli biji kakao keliling yang membeli kakao langsung ke petani. Memang petani sekarang ini banyak menanami sawahnya dengan pohon kakao karena perawatannya mudah dan cepat mendapat hasil. Karena tidak ingin bersaing dengan pedagang keliling yang lain, Ni Wayan Y. melihat peluang ini untuk menekuni usaha Pengepul Biji Kakao. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Made Y. menggunakannya untuk membeli timbangan dan biji kakao dari pedagang keliling. Biji kakao ini akan dijual kembali kepada pedagang besar yang datang ke rumahnya seminggu sekali. Saat ini biji kakao kering berharga Rp. 11.000.- sampai dengan Rp. 13.000.- per kilogram. Ni Made Y. bisa mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 500.- sampai dengan Rp. 1.000.- per kilogram. Dalam satu transaksi, Ni Wayan Y. bisa membeli 100 kilogram biji kakao dan menjualnya kembali ke pedagang besar. Jadi Ni Wayan Y. bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 100.000.- per transaksi ( 1 minggu sekali ).

loans.use: Increase Capital to Buy More Inventory

loans.name: Cenih

texts.en: Cenih is a 38-year-old tailor. She takes orders at her home and earns US$26 fortnightly.  She receives more orders during the festive season. Her husband, H. Asen, has no regular job, so they depend on her business. She is a member of MBK and asking for a loan of US$175 to buy dressmaking supplies and increase her working capital. She will repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To purchase dress-making supplies

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en: Gladys is 30 years old and is married with three children. She works as a cook in a restaurant but she also has other small businesses like piggery and brick laying. With the extra profits, Gladys plans to invest more in her brick business.

loans.use: To buy food warmers

loans.name: Juraeva

texts.en:
Juraeva M. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 4 children.  Juraeva M. has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2005.  She recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Juraeva M. is very experienced in her business and it is the family business.  She is engaged in vegetable oil and cottonseed oil selling.  Besides this, she is also engaged in the business of livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull.  

Now Mrs. Juraeva M. requests a loan of $850 for business development, which will permit her to significantly increase the family income and widen the business of vegetable oil selling.  She wants to widen the existing business because it will increase the family income and permit her to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Sukmanah

texts.en: Sukmanah is a 43-year-old woman who sells fruits at her food stall, earning US$8 a day. Her husband, S., does not work anymore, so the family depend on her earnings. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$150 to add to her working capital and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence is 45 years old. Her current business is poultry farming. She plans to use the loan to buy corrugated iron sheeting for a poultry house, which is under comstruction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for a chicken coop

loans.name: Ni Made

texts.id:
Living in the village, far from the nearest market, Ni Made W. realized that there was a business opportunity. She decided to open up a food kiosk after realizing that there are only a few food vendors in her village and the villagers need to travel far to the market to buy groceries. With $550 loan from Dinari, Ni Made W. planned to improve and renovate her kiosk. She wanted to fix damaged part of her kiosk, like flooring and wall. Besides that, she planned to buy glass shelves and cabinet to display her merchandise to look more attractive. With all these improvements, Ni Made W. is confident that she can increase her income by attracting more customers.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Tinggal di pedesaan dan jauh dari pasar, membuat Ni Made W. melihat hal itu sebagai sebuah peluang usaha. Salah satu faktor yang membuatnya untuk memutuskan untuk menekuni usaha warung, karena di desanya masih sedikit ada warung dan masyarakat harus jauh pergi ke pasar untuk membeli kebutuhan sehari-hari, seperti beras, minyak, bumbu dapur dan lain – lain. Dengan pinjaman dana sebesar Rp. 5.000.000.- dari yayasan Dinari, Ni Made W. berencana untuk menambah fasilitas warungnya dan yang terpenting adalah memperbaharui kondisi warungnya. Ni Made W. berencana untuk memperbaiki bagian – bagian yang sudah rusak seperti dinding dan lantainya. Selain itu, pinjaman tersebut akan digunakan untuk membeli rak kaca untuk etalase memajang dagangannya sehingga kelihatan lebih menarik. Dengan semua perubahan itu, Ni Made W. yakin pendapatannya akan meningkat, karena pelanggan akan merasa nyaman di warungnya.

loans.use: Fix Kiosk and buy Display Shelves and cabinets

loans.name: Kosimboeva

texts.en:
Kosimboeva S. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 5 children.  Kosimboeva S. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she recommended herself as a serious and strongly-motivated client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mrs. Kosimboeva S. is very experienced in this business (about 14 years) and it is the family business.  She is engaged in the business of the livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  She dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (she supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc.

Now Mrs. Kosimboeva S. requests a loan of $900 for business development that will permit her to significantly increase the family income and improve the existing business.  It will also increase the family income and permit her to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Lucy M..from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with two children, aged 12 and 15, and has two other dependents, who are her nephews. In 2000 Lucy established a tailoring business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional material and accessories. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional material and accessories for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Boimatov

texts.en:
Boimatov M. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has 7 children.  Boimatov M. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and he recommended himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mr. Boimatov M. is very experienced in this business (about 20 years).  He is a foreman by professional background.  He has a wide business assortment including the livestock raising and selling, milk production and work out.  He dreams to purchase a horn pedigree bull and milk cow for further meat and sour-milk goods production (he supplies it to the bazaars).  It is planned to include in the assortment the following milk and sour-milk products: pasteurized milk, sour milk, sour cream, curd, etc. 

Now Mr. Boimatov M. requests a loan of $900 for the horn pedigree bull and the pedigree milk cow purchase that will allow him to significantly increase the family income and permit him to plan further business developments and assortment widening.

loans.use: T purchase a horn pedigree bull and pedigree milk cow.

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en:
Teddy is a 45-year-old widow with five children. She is a livestock farmer and also grows some crops. She would like to purchase more livestock feed with the increased profits she hopes for from her expanded business.

Her four friends, Juliet, Justine, Angela, and Mary, and she will each receive a share of this loan to invest in their individual businesses in the hopes of bettering all their families' financial situations due to their increased profits.

loans.use: To buy a calf for Teddy to raise and also expand  the individual businesses of her friends

loans.name: Yormatova

texts.en:
Yormatova M. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has 4 children.  She has been a client if MicroiInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as an executive and reliable client who trusts the MicroiInvest loan procedures.  

Mrs. Yormatova is the accountant of the rayon department of culture by professional background.  Besides this, she trades in the bazaar where her trade outlet is located.  She is engaged in the business of children's wear selling.  She works with a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.   

Working in bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It will permit her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Now Mrs. Yormatova requests a loan of $475 to widen the existing assortment and to make new business plans.

loans.use: to widen the existing assortment and to make new business plans.

loans.name: Yuldasheva

texts.en:
Yuldasheva G. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has a child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2006 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures.  

She is engaged in the business of food products selling.  She has a wide assortment (milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products and etc) and the repeat customers.  

But working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It will permit her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Mrs. Yuldasheva requests a loan of $850 for business development and assortment widening.

loans.use: For business development and assortment widening.

loans.name: Marx's Group

texts.en: Marx is 38 years old. Her primary business is tailoring. In addtion she offers catering services and does livestock farming. With the extra profits from her businesses, she  intends to  cement her house fully.

loans.use: To buy school uniform material and start sewing uniforms

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en: Margret is 46 years old and married with seven children. She owns a retail shop. She supplements her income with selling firewood and farming. She plans to start a poultry farm with the extra profits.

loans.use: To increase stock in her retail shop

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy is 43 years old. Her current business is brick-making and selling her own bricks. She wants to use the profits from her business to construct a bigger house.

loans.use: To make and burn more bricks

loans.name: Nalongo's Group

texts.en: Nalongo has a piggery. In addtion she practises farming on a small scale. She intends to use the extra profits to buy manure to add to her farmland and also hire more land for cultivation.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets

loans.name: Rose's Group

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old and married with five children ages 20, 18, 12, 9, and 6. Her current business is piggery. She plans to use the profits to purchase more piglets.

loans.use: To buy more land for expanding her piggery

loans.name: Eva's Group

texts.en: Eva sells jewelry and ornaments. These include earrings, necklaces, bangles and chains. She would like to build rental houses with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To add inventory to her business

loans.name: Abdurahmanov

texts.en:
Abdurahmanov I. lives in Spitamen; he is married and has 3 children.  He has been a client of MicroInvest since 2005 and he recommended himself as a serious and strongly-motivated client.  Loan sums are continually increased, which shows business stability and income increase.  

Mr. Abdurahmanov is engaged in food production (preparation of the different pies and doughnuts, national pies named “cheburecky” and sambusa).  He is very experienced in this business.  

Working in the trade sphere he has stiff competition, which is why he wants to widen the existing business by new recipes preparation.  It allows him to increase the family income and to plan new business development.  Mr. Abdurahmanov requests a loan of $300 to further develop his business.

loans.use: For business development

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en: Hasifa is married with four children, two of them twins. Her current business is selling clothes. She wants to start a matooke selling business with the extra profits. Matooke, green bananas, are one of Uganda's most important staple foods.

loans.use: To add to her business inventory

loans.name: Kholiknazarova

texts.en:
Kholiknazarova V. lives in Spitamen; she is married and has a child.  She has been a client of MicroInvest since 2007 and she recommended herself as a serious and executive client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. 

She is engaged in the business of food products selling.  She has a wide assortment (milk-sour products, meat products, sweets, vegetable oil, flour products and etc) and repeat customers.  

But working in the trade sphere she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Mrs. Kholiknazarova requests a loan of $1200 for business development and widening of assortment.

loans.use: For business development and widening assortment.

loans.name: Toshmatova

texts.en: Toshmatova G. lives in Nausky rayon. She is married and has 2 children. She has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006, and she is a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in the business of sales. She sells linens such as tea and bath towels, women's headscarves and tablecloths. Mrs. Toshmatova has a direct supplier. That is why she works with clients of different income levels. Working in the trade sphere, she has stiff competition. That is why she wants to provide the new assortment of goods. She is ready to work intensively to ensure a happy future for her children. Her stable business and income helped to repay her previous loans and to increase her new loan sum. Now Mrs. Toshmatova requests a loan of $925 for business development. She wants to import new designs and increase her family income level.

loans.use: For business development

She is very experienced in this business (about 13 years).  She works with a straight supplier, which is why the prices for her goods are lower than the bazaar prices.  

Working in the bazaar she meets stiff competition and wants to provide a wider assortment of new goods to attract more repeat customers.  It permits her to realize new business plans and to develop the existing business.  Now Mrs. Shamsieva requests a loan of $925 to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

loans.use: to widen the existing assortment and to develop the existing business.

They will support each other in the timely repayment of the loan. Each is intent on improving the financial situation of her family and on helping her friends in their group to do likewise.

She is seeking a loan of $200 to buy more provisions, foodstuff and drink. She started her business in 2004 and acquired her knowledge over 3 months. She has been with LAPO for 1 year as a client.

She and her friends, Sulaina, Jalia, Safina, and Ramla, will each receive a share of this loan so that they can invest in their businesses and increase their profit. They will support each other in repaying the loan in a timely manner. They all are intent on improving the financial situations of their families.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Mrs. Agnes E., 40 years old lady, married with 5 children lives in Benin City, sells cooked food and drinks, She is soliciting for the loan of $275 to buy more foodstuff and drinks for sale. She learnt the trade for 3 years & started hers in 2001. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more Foodstuff for cooking &Drinks for sale

loans.name: Vero

She learnt the trade over a period of six months and started her business in 1994. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more fairly used clothes

loans.name: Thi Thuynh

texts.vi:
Ms Thuynh is 50 years old, she has 2 children who are working. She makes and sells all kind of cakes: "bánh chưng" square glutinous rice cake filled with green bean paste and fat pork, "bánh tẻ" rice cake filled with browned onion, "bánh bao" bbq bun ...etc. She needs capital to buy the ingredients to make these cakes. She also cultivates and raises pigs. This is the first time that she applies for a loan. She has chosen Binh Minh fund (SEDA) because she feels comfortable about the weekly payment arrangement.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Thuynh năm nay 50 tuổi, có hai con đều đã đi làm. Cô mong muốn vay vốn để mua nguyên liệu làm các loại bánh như bánh tẻ, bánh chưng..., bao gồm: gạo, đỗ , thịt, mộc nhĩ, hành... Ngoài công việc làm bánh, cô còn trồng lúa, rau củ quả các loại và chăn nuôi lợn. Đây là lần đầu tiên cô vay vốn, và cô lựa chọn chương trình tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc vì thích hình thức trả góp hàng tuần.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make cakes

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en:

She and her three friends, Jane, Sophia, and Francis, will each receive a share of this loan to invest in their individual businesses so as to earn increased profit that will enable them to better support their families.

loans.name: Mukhtaran's Group

texts.en:
My name is Mukhtaran B.. I was born in a small town, Shiekhpura, and then moved to another small town, Kot Radha Kishan after my marriage. I am a widow and a mother of six: five boys and one girl. All of my sons together operate a cardboard business except one who is a truck driver. My daughter is married. Now my sons feel a need to expand their business for which they request a loan.

My group members are: Irshad B., who needs a loan for their bricks trading; Saira B., who will use this loan for their cardboard business; Rani B., who requires a loan to rent land for growing crops; Mussarat B., who needs a loan to improve their wood business. I trust all these women and have known them for many years.

loans.use: Expand current business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
I live in a three-room brick house in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of six. My husband trades animals and all my sons trade sanitary items. We could not educate our kids much because of our impoverished conditions. But now, as all of my kids are working, our conditions have turned better. My husband now wants to buy a cow for trading and therefore requires a loan.

My group members are very responsible and need loans for their businesses: Sakina B., Rubina B. and Ghulam Fatima, all of whom need loans to expand their milk business and therefore buy a cow; Rehana B. plans to use her loan to buy a donkey cart; Shakila B. requires a loan to get her husband a piece of land on rent for growing crops.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Alveena's Group

texts.en:
I am Alveena Y. M.. I have lived all my life in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two sons and two daughters. We live in a three-room brick house. My husband drives a small two-wheeled cart pulled by a horse known as a tanga, and he transports goods on order. All of my kids attend school except one, who dropped out of school due to lack of interest in studies, and another one is not of school going age yet.

We now require a loan to replace our cart as the older one is in very bad condition. I plan to repair my house when our profits increase.

I have several women in my group and all of us need loans: Azra B. wants a loan to expand their lumberyard. Parveen B. will invest this credit in their salon. Barkat B. needs to buy sheep for their livestock trading. Rukhsana B. plans to buy a cow. Noreen B. needs a loan to buy bricks for their business.

loans.name: Muhbirahon

texts.en:
Muhbirahon was born in 1975.  She is not married and lives with her parents.  She does not have a high education, but she was fond of the trade of dry ftruits after secondary school.  Her aunt is her business patner and helped her to rent her present trade place.  

From childhood, Muhbirahon was a very responsible and kind child.  When she saw how her father earned money and that it was not enough for family needs, she decided to help him.  She asked her aunt to give her part of her goods to sell.  Gradually, Muhbirahon was able to open her own trade place.  Also, her aunt was a client of Microinvest and she got Muhbirahon involved in our organization.

Today, Muhbirahon has a stable business and she repays her loans on time.  When she heard about KIVA, she wished to ask for a loan to buy an additional batch of dry fruits.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Jeni

texts.en:
This is 30 year-old Jeni K. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, aged 2,7, and 10. In 2006 Jeni established a grocery store, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk.

In the days leading up to New Year's (traditional for giving presents in Tajikistan), he drew in many clients and now has a rapid turnover. He wants a loan to increase the quantity of goods sold, with the goal of increasing his profits.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Холматов Хабибулло,женат имеет 3 детей,проживает в городе Душанбе,Таджикистан.В Микроинвесте был зарегистрирован в сентябре 2007 года.Он является владельцем одного маленького сувенирного магазина.В предновогодние дни он привлек огромное количество клиентов и сейчас имеет быстрый оборот товаров. Он хочет получить на увеличение количества товаров с целью получения больше прибыли.

Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Anna K. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is single with four children, aged 12,18, 21, and 24. In 1998 Anna established a catering and clothing business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional ingredients, equipment, and stock. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback

loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients and clothing stock in bulk.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru:
Zafar was born in 1973 and is married with two children. His wife stays home and he is the sole provider for his children. He rents a small space for his business at the Rudaki district market, where he sells equipment and accessories for mobile phones. He purchases his inventory wholesale from China.

Zafar is experienced and has been in business for five years. He has reliable suppliers and many clients. Right now, it's especially important for him to stock mobile phone accessories and DVDs. He plans to use his loan to purchase these goods.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Зафар арендует одно небольшое помешения для своего бизнеса на рынке Рудаки пос Сомониен.Его бизнес торговля орг техникой и аксесуарами к мобилным телефонам.Товары он закупает у оптовиков из Китая большими партиями.Он сам 1973 года рождения, женат и имеет 2 детей.жена домохозайка и семью кормит только он.Этим видом бизнеса он занимается уже 5 лет.Он достаточно опытен и имеет постоянных постовщиков так же у него много клиентов.Особенно хорошо сейчас имеет оборот мобильные аксесуары и DVD.Свой будущий займ он планирует потратить на покупку именно этих товаров.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Erica

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Erica S. from Mbeya, Tanzania!. She is single with two children, aged 9 and 18, and has one other dependent, who is her nephew. In 2004 Erica established a farming business. Erica has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $550 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
This is 42 year-old Queen Simkokofrom Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, aged 18,22, and 25. In 2006 Queen established a charcoal business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Haneefan's Group

texts.en:
I am Haneefan B. from Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I live with my family in a five-room brick mud house here in KRK. I am a mother of seven: four boys and three girls. I stitch and embroider clothes on order from women of my locality. My husband is a cobbler. Earlier, we invested loans in this business and managed to increase our income. With the increased income, I bought a television for my house and built a toilet in my house.

Now, we want to buy a stock of items that are used in repairing shoes in bulk and therefore, we need a loan. I, on my behalf, request loans for few other women who are: Nasreen B., who needs a loan for their used items trading; Asiah B., who supples candies and toffees to various shops in the city and needs a loan to improve their business; Salma B., who requires a loan for their cloth business; Rizwana B., who will invest their loan in their restaurant.

loans.use: Expand our current shoe repairing business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah, the Group Leader, is married with eight children.She has a poultry business. She also sells chicken feed. She wants to use the extra profits to build a house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To begin another business in order to support the family.

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is married with eight children. She has a poultry business. She also sells chicken feed. She wants to use the extra profits to build a house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To begin another business so as to support the family.

loans.name: Rasheeda's Group

texts.en:
I am Rasheeda M. N.. My husband trades vegetables in a local vegetables market. I am a mother of seven: four boys and three girls. Three of my kids are married and live separately. My husband and I both desire our kids to complete their education and hence polish their futures. I embroider and sell clothes at my house for my neighborhood women. My husband last year took a loan for his vegetables business and made decent profits. This year he again needs a loan. He has a nine years experience in this field.

I am a group leader for a few other women and we are mutually responsible for each other's loans. Akhter B. needs a loan to buy a cow. Halima B. requires a loan for their grocery store. Rizwana B. also needs a loan for their grocery store. Nagina B. will invest the loan to improve her clothing sales business. These women are my neighbors and are very honest and responsible.

loans.use: Expand vegetables business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Abduaziz

texts.en: E. Abduaziz has been engaged in the trade of flour for over 10 years.  His business place is located in district Rudaki, Dushanbe, Tajikistan, in the food market "Ganjina."  He is married and has 3 children.All of them go to school and he is the one who earns money for family needs.  He attracts many clients with the high quality of his product.  He sells high, first and second varieties of flour.  He buys his goods in sacks by the ton.  Currently he has fast turnover and he needs extra capital to increase his profit.

loans.use: Buying the next batch of flour.

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:

Magreth owns a take away business, and requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase ingredients and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

loans.name: Rasool's Group

texts.en:
I live in a small town Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. I live here with my husband and kids in a four-room brick house. I am a mother of five girls and two boys. My husband operates a grocery store. All of my kids are done with their studies and three are married.

Currently, we require a loan to expand our grocery store. My husband has been operating this store for the last six years and he makes decent profits.

My group members are: Hajra B., who needs a loan for their used items trading; Anwer B., who needs a loan to expand their milk business; Kalsoom B., who requires a loan for their grocery items wholesale business; Majeedan B., who will invest their loan in their grocery store.

I am the group leader of these women because I want to help them so that their families can also prosper and consequently our community.

loans.use: Expand grocery store

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Asasah, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Madina's Group

texts.en: Madina owns a small beauty salon. With the extra profits, she wants to buy a plot of land and pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy a hair dryer

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en: Ruth is a poultry farmer. She would like to use the business profits to buy more chicks thus expand her business and also pay school fees for the children.

loans.use: Purchase more chicks.

loans.name: Damalie's Group

texts.en: Damalie is 39 years old and married with three children. She owns a cosmetics shop. She intends to buy more cosmetics with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rahimano

texts.en:
Rahimano is a very cheerful woman who loves children very much, as she is the mother of 4 children.  She and her husband try to do all they can for their lovely children.  He is a driver and helps her with the transportation of her goods from their home to her trade place.  

She buys her goods from suppliers from China.  She buys goods in bulk as she receives many orders from her constant clients.  She has a fast turnover and sells her goods in a short time.  

But now she has one problem - her small boy is seriously ill and she needs money for treatment.  She hopes to receive extra capital from KIVA to increase the volume of her goods to recieve more profit, which she plans to spend on her boy.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en: Joan is a single mother of three children of ages, 18, 10 and 3. She has a bakery. She intends to buy baking ingredients, powder, a fridge and a weighing scale with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Hasifa's Group

texts.en: Hasifah is 37 years old. She distributes tap water. With the extra profits, Hasifah intends to pay water bills and more airtime for her public pay phone.

loans.use: To connect another water tap

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Mrs. Margaret O. is 55 years old, married and has 6 children, and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions. this was a business she started in 1996. she is in need of  $875 to enable her to buy more provision for sale.
She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sell

loans.name: Teo's Group

texts.en: Teo is married with 7 children. She has a poultry farm. She intends to use the extra profits constructing another poultry house, buying more chicks and connecting electricity.

loans.use: Enlarge the business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is 55 years old, married to Mr. O.. The two have seven children and live in Benin City. There, she sells provisions and fruit drinks.

At the moment, Ms. O. is soliciting the loan amount of $450 to buy more provision and fruit drinks. She had learned this trade of business for a total of one year before starting her own business in 1996. She has been with LAPO for three years now.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and fruit drinks to sell

loans.name: Jameo's Group

texts.en: Jameo, the Group Leader, is married with three children. Her current business is catering. She makes and sells snacks. She wants to buy another refrigerator with the extra profits from the business and eventually diversify her business into a restaurant.

loans.use: To diversify her business into a restaurant

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Mrs. Beauty Osarekhoe is 33 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. There, she deals with the sales of drinks and gift Items.

She is soliciting the loan amount of $1200 to buy more drinks and gift items for sale. She started this business in 2003 and has been a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and gift items to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Mrs. Jane U. is 61 years old, married and with four children, and lives in Benin City. In Benin City, she has a store where she sells a variety of provisions, fruit drinks, wines and other items; she is soliciting a loan of $875 to buy more of these goods.

She learned this kind of business for three months, and after which she started her own business in 2002. She is a LAPO member.

loans.use: To buy additional provisions, fruit drinks and wine for sale

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en: Josephine, the group leader, is 38 years old and married with five children. She sells charcoal and also has a small poultry farm. She intends to use the profits from her business to finish construction work on her house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transporting charcoal from rural areas to towns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items & drinks for sale

loans.name: Mugongo A2 (I) Group

texts.en: Christine is 47 years old. She is a widow with 6 children. She has a poultry farm. She intends to reinvest the extra profits in her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy feeders and drinkers for poultry and build a hatchery for the chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food Items for cooking and selling

loans.name: Rose Kizito's Group

loans.use: Increase her business profits.

loans.name: Night's Group

texts.en: Night, the Group Leader, sells jewelry and cosmetics. She intends  to use the extra profits to diversify her current business.

loans.use: To increase her jewelry and cosmetics stock

loans.name: Teddy's Group

texts.en: Teddy, the Group Leader, wants a loan to increase her stock of poultry birds and also build a poultry house.  She wants to buy cows with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To increase the amount of poultry birds and also to build a poultry house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O. is 40 years old, married with four children, lives in Benin City where she deals on the sale of Fairly Used Clothes. She is soliciting a loan for the amount of $450 to buy additional cloths. She has been involved in the trade since 1992. She is a committed client of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more Fairly Used Clothes for sale

loans.name: Ruth's Group

texts.en:
Ruth is 23 years old and married with 1 child. She has a crafts shop where she sells various craft pieces.
She intends to buy building materials from the extra profits.

loans.use: Add in stock and increase supplies

loans.name: Brendah's Group

texts.en: Brenda owns a retail hardware shop. She plans to start a poultry farm with the extra business profits.

loans.use: To add stock of hardware

loans.name: Thi Chat

texts.vi:
Ms Chắt is 60 years old. She is a retiree from the army (special task force). She has had sequela from the war: loss of memory, loss of hair, loss of teeth, yellow skin. But today she is reestablished. She is applying for a loan from Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) to buy seeds, fertilizer ...etc to increase her vegetables production thus her income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Cô Chắt, 60 tuổi, là chiến sĩ lực lượng vũ trang Nhân dân Việt nam đã nghỉ hưu. Mặc dù bị di chứng do chiến tranh để lại: bị mất trí nhớ, vàng da, rụng tóc, nay sức khoẻ của cô đã bình phục trở lại. Với số vốn vay từ chương trình tài chính vi mô của Binh Minh cdc, cô đầu tư mua hạt giống, phân bón... nhằm tăng sản lượng cũng như chất lượng rau đem bán.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer

loans.name: Thi Tam

texts.vi:
Mr and Ms Tám are woodworkers for many years, they make furnitures. They have never had a loan before. Since they learned about Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) they applied for a loan of 2006000VND (150 USD) to expand their furniture business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Tám đã làm nghề mộc từ nhiều năm nay, chưa từng vay vốn ở đâu. Biết được những tiện ích khi vay vốn Tài chính vi mô của Binh minh cdc, anh chị đã vay 2006000VND để muốn mở rộng sản xuất kinh doanh.

loans.use: To expand their furniture business

loans.name: Jose Estanilado.

texts.es:
Jose, 27, is a young campesino, born in Bluefields, single with one son. His father died several months ago and he lives with his mother and three sisters. He's head of the house now that his father is gone and he earns a living selling general merchandise. In order to add to the sales he gets from his small general store, he travels to various parts of town to sell his products, too. This young businessman is now studying nights at the university so that his days are free for going around the city selling his products. Like many businesses, this one needs financing to buy the products most required by its customers: sugar, cooking oil, soup, rice, beans, and "meneitos" (a local corn-based snack).

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Jose M. M. es un joven de 27 años de origen campesino, originario de Bluefields, soltero, tiene un hijo, vive con su mama y tres hermanas, ya que su padre fallecio hace algunos meses. Este joven se dedica a actividades de venta de granos basicos y productos varios. Tiene la responsabilidad de ser la cabeza de la familia por la ausencia de su padre. Para vender sus productos ademas de la pulperia que tiene, se dedica a visitar diferentes viviendas y poder incrementar sus ventas. Este joven comerciante esta actualmente estudiando en la universidad en horas de la noche por lo que todo el dia se moviliza por la ciudad ofertando sus productos. Pero al igual que muchos negocios necesita que le financien la compra de los siguientes productos que son los mas requeridos por sus clientes. 3 quintales de azucar la cual compra a US$ 27 dolares el quintal, 3 bidones de aceite a US$ 26 dolares el bidon, 1 cajas de sopa 3 minutos a US$ 24 dolares la caja, 3 quintales de arroz a US$ 44 dolares el quintal, 2 quintal de frijoles a US$ 81 dolar el quintal, y 1/2 bolson de meneitos a US$ 28 dolar el 1/2 bolson.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: La cuota real que pago  es de $ 42.08 dólares
La cuota real que pago es de $ 42.08 dólares.
La cuota real es de $ 42.08 dólares

loans.name: Nashega

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Nashega S. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with four children, ages 11,14,18, and 21. In 2005 Nashega established a grocery business. Nashega has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stcoks for her grocery business in bulk.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Eliza M. is 27 years old. She is married with three children. In 2000, Eliza established a used clothing business.  She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. 

Second-hand clothing comes across the ocean from America and Europe.  They are then washed, ironed and sold in bulk by wholesalers in Dar es Salaam to retailers who then re-wash and re-iron them for sale on the streets.  The clothes are becoming increasingly popular, especially amongst the younger generation, because they are so cheap and because of the general appeal of anything western or modern.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothing in bulk

loans.name: Shakarmo

texts.ru:
Shakarmo H. is 43 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 6 children. Shakarmo fattens and sells livestock. She has been doing this for 8 years and this is her main source of income. Shakarmo will use her loan to purchase several young calves and feed to fatten them. Every 40-45 days she will sell them and purchase new calves. She will use her profits to support her family. Shakarmo’s husband and son help her in her business. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хидирова Шакармо, возраст – 43 лет, образование среднее, замужем, имеет 6-х детей. Шакармо занимается откормкой и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 8 лет и это основной источник приносящий ей доход. На полученный кредит она хочет приобрести несколько молодых бычков, корма для их откорма. Через каждые 40-45 дней она будет продавать их и приобретать молодых бычков. Полученную прибыль от продажи будет использовать для содержание семьи. В этом бизнесе ей помогает муж и сын. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purcahse of calves and feed

loans.name: Holmurod

texts.ru:
Holmurod H. is 50 years old, has a secondary education, is married and has 7 children. Holmurod has been farming for 3 years. He will use his loan to work his land and to purchase wheat seeds to plant. After harvest, local residents will be able to purchase wheat at a lower price than they would pay at the market. They will use the wheat for making flour and bread. Holmurod plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Хакназаров Холмурод, возраст – 50 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Холмурод уже в течение 3 лет занимается земледелием. Полученный кредит он хочелт использовать на обработку земли, а также на покупку семян пшеницы для дальнейшего их посева. После сбора урожая местные жители получат возможность приобрести пшеницу по более низкой цене в отличие от рыночной. Так как большинство жителей этого района покупают пшеницу для дальнейшей ее переработки в муку и выпечки хлеба. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Working the land and planting wheat

loans.name: Shodali

texts.ru:
Shodali H. is 25 years old, has a secondary school education, is married and has 2 children. Shodali has been farming for two years just like his father Holmurod H. (another Kiva loan applicant). He has land where he plants wheat. Shodali will use his loan to fertilize his land and to purchase seeds for planting. After harvest, local residents will be able to purchase wheat at a lower price than they would pay at the market. They will use the wheat for making flour and bread.

Shodali will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Хакназаров Шодали, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 2-х детей. Шодали также как и его отец Хакназаров Холмурод, уже в течение 2 лет занимается земледелием. Он также имеет отдельный участок земли для посева пшеницы. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на обработку земли, а также на покупку семян пшеницы для дальнейшего их посева. loans.name: Thi Son

texts.vi:
Ms Sơn tends a kiosk at the market selling grocery and take out food. She applies to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan which would be invested in expanding her kiosk and buy food ingredients.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Sơn chuyên bán hàng tap hoá và một số đồ ăn sẵn như đậu rán, thịt rán, nem rán... Số tiền vay của Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh Minh cdc sẽ giúp chị Sơn nâng cấp kiốt của mình và mua nguyên liệu làm thức ăn.

loans.use: Expand her kiosk, buy ingredients

He would like to use his loan to purchase several calves and feed for them. Toshtemir plans to sell them every 40-45 days. He will use his revenues to purchase new calves and feed for them. He will use the resulting profits to support his family. After paying back the loan he will be left with a profit of 2 calves. Toshtemir will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Уразов Тоштемир, возраст – 46 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Тоштемир занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На вырученные деньги приобретать молодых бычков и корма для них. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи. После выплаты кредита ему в качестве прибыли должно остаться 2 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock and Feed

In 2002, Paulina established a rice farming business. She now requests a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. loans.name: Shodimurod

texts.ru:
Shodimurod B. is 45years old, he finished high school, has a wife and 9 children. Shodimurod raises cattle. He has been active in this field for 3 years. With his credit Shodimurod wants to purchase several young calves for feeding and resale. He plans to sell them every 40-45 days. He will then purchase more young calves with the money he receives from sales. Shodimurod will use his profit to support his family. After repaying the loan, he should end up with 2 calves as profit.

The client plans to repay the credit within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобиев Шодимурод, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее, женат, имеет 9-х детей. Шодимурод занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 3 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких бычков и корма для них. Он планирует продавать их каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги приобретать молодых бычков и корма для них. Полученную прибыль он будет использовать на содержание своей семьи. После выплаты кредита ему в качестве прибыли должно остаться 2 бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Cattle purchase for raising and resale

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs. Felipa Champi lives in her own home in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz with her husband, Mr. Mario Calle, and their two children. Felipa is employed by a public works microbusiness, and her husband is employed as an independent construction worker.

With previous loans Felipa stabilized her land and built two rooms.

The loan she is seeking is to be used to demolish an old room that is located in the back part of the house and then to construct a new room. This is the sixth time that she seeks a loan and the socioeconomic analysis qualifies them favorably to receive a loan. The five previous loans have been repaid in full.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Felipa C. vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposo, el señor Mario Calle y sus dos hijos. La señora Felipa trabaja como obrera en una microempresa de obras publicas, y su esposo es empleado constructor independiente.

Con anteriores créditos la señora Felipa realizo el trabajo de estabilización de su terreno y la construcción de dos habitaciones.

El crédito solicitado será destinado a la demolición de una habitación antigua que se encuentra en la parte de atrás de la casa y construcción de una nueva habitación. Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. Los cinco préstamos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: Demolition of an old room and construction of a new one.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Thi Lan

texts.vi:
Lan and her husband are owners of a woodshop, they make custom wood furniture. They're requesting a loan to expand their business, increase their production and be more competitive in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Hai vợ chồng chị Lan làm chủ xưởng sản xuất đồ mỹ nghệ. Với số tiền vay Chương trình Tài chính vi mô, anh chị có thể mở rộng xưởng sản xuất của mình, nâng cao sức cạnh tranh trên thị trường.

loans.use: To expand their wood furniture business

loans.name: Jalgash

texts.ru:
Jalgash S. is 45 years old, he has a high school diploma with specialization in machinery, he is a photograph by profession, he has a wife and 8 children. Jalgash has been in agriculture for the past 5 years. He plans to use this credit to purchase fertilizer and wheat seeds for sowing. Jalgash plans to leave part of his crop for personal use and the other half to sell on a market to local people. This way, the locals will have an opportunity to purchase cheaper product because it comes directly from the producer. Here, wheat is used to produce flour and then to bake bread. Flour that is sold in stores is much more expensive than flour produced by Jalgash' method.

The client plans to bay back the loan in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Сафаров Джалгаш, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее-техническое, по специальности – фотограф, женат, имеет 8-х детей. Джалгаш занимается земледелием уже в течение 5 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение удобрений, семян пшеницы для засева земли. Собранный урожай он планирует часть оставить себе на личные нужды, а часть продать на базареместному населению. Таким образом местные жители получат возможность приобрести зерно по более низким ценам, так как прямо из рук производителя. Пшеницу здесь используют для производстива муки и дальнейшей выпечки хлеба. Готовая мука реализуемая в магазинах стоит намного дороже, по сравнению с мукой произведенной по этому методу. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of wheat seeds and fertilizer for sowing

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Justo

texts.es:
Mr. Justo P. owns his house in the area of Belén in the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife and three children. Mr. P. is a painter and works independently. His wife sells food wholesale to the stores in the neighborhood.

With previous loans Mr. P. built a kitchen and the workshop where he works. The loan he is requesting will be used to refinish the terrace's floor.

This is his third time asking for a loan. The socioeconomic analysis conducted rates him favorably and shows that he can have access to a loan.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Justo P. vive en casa propia en la zona Belén de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus tres hijos. El señor Justo es pintor independiente y su esposa vende alimentos al por mayor en las tiendas de barrio.

Con anteriores créditos el señor Justo construyó una cocina y el taller en el que trabaja.

El crédito solicitado será destinado al acabado en obra fina del piso de la terraza.

Esta es la tercera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: To finish the floor of his house's terrace.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
Needing money for her children made Ada begin selling vegetables in the market. 17 years later, she continues selling in the same locale. Now her worry is taking care of her 70 year old father who suffers from rheumatism.

Thanks to her business, Ada has been able to give a good education to her 4 children and one of her nephews.

Since she was young she dreamed of having a restaurant or soda fountain, for which she is asking a loan of 3 thousand soles to be able to achieve this dream.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La necesidad de dinero para sus hijos, hizo que la señora Ada comenzara a vender verduras en un Mercado. 17 años después, sigue vendiendo en el mismo puesto. Ahora su preocupación es cuidar a su padre de 70 años quien sufre de reumatismo.

Gracias a su negocio, Ada ha podido darles una buena educación a sus 4 hijos y a uno de sus sobrinos.

Desde joven su sueño fue tener un restaurante o fuente de soda, por lo que de tener un préstamo de 3 mil soles, podría lograrlo.

loans.use: Open a restaurant

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:

She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA. She now requests a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store in bulk
