Jiyamkul has been working in agriculture for the past 4 years. He plans to use his credit to purchase fertilizers and wheat seeds to sow land. With his bigger crop he plans to leave one part for his personal consumption and another part he plans to sell at a market to local people. This way, people will be able to purchase goods at affordable prices directly from the producer. Here, wheat is used to produce flour and bake bread. The flour is sold in stores for a greater price in comparison with the flour produced by Jiyamkul methods.

He plans to repay credit during 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Авлиякулов Жиямкул, возраст – 45 лет, образование среднее-техническое, по специальности – бухгалтер, женат, имеет 7-х детей. Жиямкул занимается земледелием уже в течение 4 лет. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение удобрений, семян пшеницы для засева земли. Собранный урожай он планирует часть оставить себе на личные нужды, а часть продать на базареместному населению. Таким образом местные жители получат возможность приобрести зерно по более низким ценам, так как прямо из рук производителя. Пшеницу здесь используют для производстива муки и дальнейшей выпечки хлеба. Готовая мука реализуемая в магазинах стоит намного дороже, по сравнению с мукой произведенной по этому методу. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and sow land

loans.name: Seferina

texts.es:
Due to her her dire financial situation, Seferina was one of the first women to work in a stand at the AAHH Laura Caller Market. Thanks to her efforts she was able to provide higher education for her 6 children, build her own house and open a small restaurant.

She has passed on this determination to her children. Her youngest son being an example of that. He works at the stand in his spare time in order to pay for medical school.

Seferina's goal is to be able to expand and stock her restaurant in order to make this her only business.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Fue una de las primeras mujeres que trabajó en el mercado del AAHH Laura Caller, y es que la urgencia de dinero fue grande. Debido a su esfuerzo, Seferina pudo darles educación superior a sus 6 hijos, construir su casa y poder poner un pequeño restaurante.

Este empeño ha sido transmitido a sus hijos, ejemplo de ello es el menor de sus hijos quien trabaja en sus ratos libres en el puesto para poder pagar sus estudios de Medicina.

La meta de Seferina es poder ampliar y surtir su restaurante para solo dedicarse a este negocio.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant business

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Neema S. is 34 years old and is married with four children, ages 7, 11, 13, and 15. She has one other dependent: her nephew. In 2000, Neema established a farm machinery rental business. She now requests a loan of $200 in order to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to expand her farm machinary rental business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
With the goal of helping her household budget, Susana had the idea of opening a hair salon outside her home. Nevertheless, because of worrying about taking care of her 3 children, she moved the salon into her home.

That is how Susana, in addition to offering personal beauty services, sells beauty products as well.

If she had the opportunity, she would expand her business and open a bazaar. But her biggest dream is to open a beauty institute in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

A fin de ayudar con la economía de la casa, Susana tuvo la idea de poner una peluquería fuera de casa. Sin embargo, por la preocupación de cuidar a sus 3 hijos, esta se trasladó a su hogar.

Es así como Susana además de ofrecer servicios de arreglo personal, vende productos de belleza.

De tener la posibilidad, ampliaría su negocio y pondría un bazar. Pero su más grande sueño es poner un instituto de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: Expand her business and open a beauty school in her home.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
In order to help with the household finances, Susana had the idea of setting up a hair salon away from home. However, because she had to look after her three children she decided to move her business to her house.

In this manner, Susana offers beauty treatments and services as well as beauty products for sale.

If she had the resources she would expand her business and open a bazaar. However, her biggest dream is to set up a beauty school at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

A fin de ayudar con la economía de la casa, Susana tuvo la idea de poner una peluquería fuera de casa. Sin embargo, por la preocupación de cuidar a sus 3 hijos, trasladó su negocio a su hogar.

Es así como Susana además de ofrecer servicios de arreglo personal, vende productos de belleza.

De tener la posibilidad, ampliaría su negocio y pondría un bazar. Pero su más grande sueño es poner un instituto de belleza en su casa.

loans.use: To expand her business and start a beauty school

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso O. is 22 years old, she has a high school diploma and is single. Zebonisso sews traditional dresses for local people. She has been doing this during the past 2 years. She plans to use the credit in order to purchase material and thread for her products. These products are supplied to local markets and they are very successful with local public. The credit will give Zebonisso the opportunity to produce more goods, and local people will be able to obtain these products at decent prices.

The client plans to repay the credit in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Одилова Зебониссо, возраст – 22 года, образование среднее, не замужем. Зебониссо занимается пошивом национальных платьев и курпачей для местного населения. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученнй кредит она планирует использовьать на приобретение тканей, ниток для необходимых для производимой продукции. Свою продукцию она поставляет на местные рынки и она пользуется большим спросом среди местного населения. Данный кредит даст возможность Зебониссо производить больше продукции, а местные жители смогут приобретать их по приемлемым ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Obtain material, thread and other products for sewing

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 31083

loans.name: Zelma

texts.es:
Two years ago Zelma noticed that there wasn’t a single salchipapa (a dish made of hotdogs and French fries) business in her neighborhood, so the idea was born to open one in her house

With the income she receives, she can help her husband, who is a taxi driver, raise their two small daughters. And, thinking of their well-being, Zelma would like to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

Hace 2 años, Zelma se dio cuenta que en su barrio no había ningún negocio de salchipapa (platillo hecho en base de hot dog y papas fritas) así le nació la idea de poner uno propio en su casa.

Con los ingresos que recibe, puede ayudar a su esposo taxista a criar a sus 2 pequeñas hijas. Y, pensando en su bienestar, a Zelma le gustaría poner una amplia tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Open a grocery store

loans.name: Feda

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Feda K. is 50 years old and is married with three children, ages 31, 33, and 39. She has two nieces who are dependent on her. In 1997, Feda established a farming business. She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools for farming

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Ibrohim B. is 41 years old, he has a high school diploma and is divorced. Ibrohim has been raising cattle for 2 years. He has a cattle farm. With his new credit Ibrohim would like to purchase several young calves in order to raise and resell. He plans to sell these calves in 40-45 days. With his profit he will purchase new calves and feed for them. According to the forecast prepared for the client, at the end of the credit cycle he should have 3 young calves as profit.

The client plans to repay credit in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Бобоалиев Иброхим, возраст – 41 год, образование среднее, разведен. Иброхим занимается разведением крупного рогатого скота уже в течение 2 лет. Для этого он имеет большой коровник. Полученный кредит он хочет использовать на приобретение нескольких молодых бычков для их откорма и продажи. Он планирует продавать их через каждые 40-45 дней. На вырученные деньги приобретать новых бычков и корма для них. В конце кредитного цикла клиенту, в качестве прибыли, согласно подготовленного пргоноза должно остаться 3 молодых бычка. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Hilda T. is 35 years old and is married with four children, ages 3, 5, 15, and 16. She has an additional dependent: her niece. In 2000, Hilda established a grocery business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA and now requests a loan of $900 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. sells plywood and soft drinks. She is married to a commercial driver. They have 3 children ages 21, 15 and 6. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to take care of the family’s finances. Agnes is working very hard to help with the family’s finances. She wants to increase her sales.

She is therefore asking for $1,200 as additional capital to buy more plywood to meet the increase in demand.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more plywood to meet the increase in demand.

loans.name: Emanuela

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! Emanuela M. is 35 years old and she is married with three children, ages 5, 10, and 14. In 1999 Emanuela established a snack business. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a loan of $200 to purchase the ingredients needed to make mandazi (triangular spiced donuts), chapatis, and chai (tea). She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her snack business in bulk

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania!  Elida M. is a 55 year old woman. She is married with three children, who are between 22 and 35.  She has one other dependent: her nephew. In 2005, Elida established a business selling fish and charcoal.  She now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

Tanzanians rely on charcoal to cook their meals since they still use small coal pots.  They arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is a trader who sells canned foods, washing and toilet soaps. She is married to an electrical engineer but his monthly income is not enough to meet the family’s expenses. Kate is supporting the family financially. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $1,200 as additional capital to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.use: As additional capital to purchase more stock for her shop.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate A. is a trader who sells canned foods, washing and toilet soaps. She is married to an electrical engineer but his monthly income is enough to meet the family’s expenses. Kate is supporting financially with the family needs. She wants to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $1,200 as an additional capital to purchase more stock into her shop.

loans.use: As an additional capital to purchase more stock into her shop.

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Hello from Mbeya, Tanzania! Sara M. is a 49 year old woman who is married with four children, who are between 18 and 23 years of age. In 2000 Sara established a farming business. She now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and tools. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers, and tools for farming

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello from Tanzania! Agnes L. is a 36 year old woman. She is single with four children, ages 7, 10, 15, and 19. In 2002 Agnes established a dry cleaning business and in 2004 she started a grocery business. She now requires a loan of $275 in order to purchase additional stock and equipment. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store and equipment for her dry cleaning business

loans.name: Sister Daison

texts.en:
Sister Daison S. is 29 years old and is married with two children, aged 5 and 10. She also has two nieces, who are also her dependents. In 2007 Sister Daison established a stationary business. She now requires a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of stationary in bulk

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Sero Lease and Finance Ltd. (SELFINA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Glaris Elita

texts.es:
The small business owner Glaris Elita B. is 57 years old and comes from Bluefields and the creole ethnic group. She has 2 children and for over 25 years has sold vegetables at this city's municipal market. Due to her knowledge of the creole language and because she is known for being a native of the region, her stand is visited often by people of creole descent. It is important to note that not many people of creole descent work in the sale of vegetables. These products are in high demand in this city since it is customary for its inhabitants to consume plenty of vegetables.

She needs to purchase the following: 40 units of cabbage at US$ 1 per unit, 500 units of bananas at US$ 0.05 per unit, 500 units of plantains at US$ 0.16 per unit, 100 lbs of onions at US$ 0.42 per lb, 200 units of coconut at US$ 0.42 per unit , 5 sacks of yucca at US$ 8 each sack, 3 sacks of quequisques at US$ 24 per sack and 2 sacks of potatoes at US$ 48 per sack.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

La microempresaria Glaris Elita W. B. tiene 57 años de edad, es originaria de Bluefields, de la etnia creole, es acompañada, tiene dos hijos y se dedica desde hace mas de 25 años a la venta de verduras en el mercado municipal de esta ciudad. Este negocio es bastante visitado por personas de la etnia creole por la facilidad que tiene de la lengua creole doña Glaris y por que es reconocida por ser nativa de la region. Hay que señalar que no son muchas las personas de la etnia creole que se dedican a la venta de verduras. Este producto es consumido mucho en esta ciudad por la costumbre de sus habitantes de comer verduras. Necesita comprar lo siguiente: 40 unidades de repollo a US$ 1 dolar cada unidad, 500 unidades de banano a US$ 0.05 cada unidad, 500 unidades de platanos a US$ 0.16 cada unidad, 100 libras de cebolla a US$ 0.42 cada libra, 200 unidades de coco a US$ 0.42 cada unidad, 5 sacos de yuca a US$ 8 cada saco, 3 sacos de quequisques a US$ 24 cada saco, y 2 sacos de papas a US$ 48 cada saco.

loans.use: To purchase 40 units of cabbage, 500 units of bananas, 500 units of plantains, 100 lbs of onions, 200 units of coconut, 5 sacks of yucca, 3 sacks of quequisques and 2 sacks of potatoes.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 39.92 dólares.
Abono US$ 159.68\r\nCorresponden a las cuotas numero: 08,09,10 y 11.

loans.name: Edith Carolina

texts.es:
Edith, 55, is married with 5 children, three of whom are in school. She is a native of Bluefields and has owned a small general store for more than 20 years. She makes the most of her business, selling green vegetables and "vigorones" (a traditional dish made with yucca), among other things. Her business is located in a well-known spot in the city, known as the Radio Zelaya corner. This has helped her business, as has the range of products she sells. However, she needs a loan so that she can supply her business and increase her earnings. She wants to buy stocks of rice, cooking oil, sugar, flour, yucca, "quesiquiques", cocoa, "repollo" (a native green vegetable), and potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Doña Edtih Carolina B. es una mujer creole de 55 años de edad, casada con 5 hijos, tres se encuentran estudiando, es originaria de Bluefields y tiene una pulperia por mas de 20 años. Esta señora aprovecha para ademas de vender granos basicos, tambien vende verduras y vigorones. Su negocio esta ubicado en una parte de referencia de la ciudad que es conocida como la esquina de radio zelaya. Esto le permite tener buenas ventas de sus productos. La variedad de productos que vende le permite tener unas buenas ventas, sin embargo necesita un financiamiento para poder surtir su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias. Requiere comprar 3 quintales de arroz a US$ 41 cada quintal, 2 bidones de aceite a US$ 25 cada bidon, 2 quintales de azucar a US$ 26 cada quintal, 1 quintal de harina a US$ 34 el quintal, 3 sacos de yuca a US$ 8 el saco, 2 sacos de quequisques a US$ 25 cada saco, 150 unidades de coco a US$ 0.50 cada coco, 35 unidades de repollo a US$ 1 cada unidad y 1 sacos de papas a US$ 47 el saco.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for resale.

payments.comment: La cuota real de pago es de $ 40.83 dólares

loans.name: Francisca Fabiola

texts.es:
I have a small business selling candy our of my home. I would like to purchase groceries and canned goods since my mother now lives with me and can help me. The financial situation is very difficult so we have to find a way to get ahead. This is the reason why I need to buy the merchandise, to sell more and to have a higher income to provide my family with a better quality of life. $700 to be invested in the purchase of merchandise for my business.

Translated from the Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

“Tengo un negocio en mi casa de venta de dulces pero me gustaría invertir en la compra de abarrotes y lata, ya que ahora que mi mamá esta viviendo conmigo y me puede ayudar, la situación económica esta muy difícil así es que hay que buscar la manera de salir adelante, es por eso que necesito comprar la mercancía para vender más y poder tener más ingresos y darle a mi familia una mejor calidad de vida $ 700.00 dlls para invertir en la compra de mercancía para mi negocio.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación para la Vivienda Progresiva (FVP), a partner of CHF International - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 35 years old and has two young children.  She has been part of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for the past four years.  Here she has learned to save, to be punctual, and to be an exceptional associate of the bank.  One year ago Teodora won a special certificate for good conduct from the organization.
For the past two years Teodora has had a small grocery store located near the cemetery in the town of Huamanga.  From the same store she serves breakfast and lunch.
With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk.  She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.
Teodora is saving to be able to buy a car so that her husband can work as a taxi driver
At the moment Teodora and her family live in the store.  For this reason her dream is to own a house.  It would be big and have a garage, and a separate room for each one of her children.

loans.use: With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk.  She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Felicitas' Group

texts.en:
Felicitas and Basilisa are sisters in law who live in the same house with their families.  Together they have been part of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for less than one year.  They are 36 and 27 years old respectively and both have two children. 
Both Felicitas and Basilisa sell different types of grains.  Felicitas buys grains from the markets in the small town of Vinchos, and Basilisa travels to the town of Cajilambras to find different grains she can later sell in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho.  
Together they have each requested loans of 134 dollars to buy different grains such as wheat, quinua, habas, and cebada which are typical of the region.  The loan would also be used to transport the grain.
Their dream is to each buy their own house so they would not have to pay to rent one.
They commented that in their bank they have learned how to educate their children, and have a healthy relationship with their husbands.  They have also learned how to save and how to be more responsible.

loans.use:
Together they have each requested loans of 134 dollars to buy different grains such as wheat, quinua, habas, and cebada which are typical of the region.  The loan would also be used to transport the grain.
T

loans.name: Olga Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia, 40, is single and has no children. For 10 years, she worked selling Avon perfumes and jewelry door to door. A year ago, she received a promotion and she's now an authorized sales rep for Avon; that's to say, she's a distributor for a group of agents. She lives with her father and sister, helping with family expenses, and is pleased to be operating her own business. Her dream is to buy a vehicle so that she can more easily distribute her products to the agents. She's a visionary, able to see how an entrepeneur with her own shop can turn it into a major operation.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Eugenia P., es Soltera de 40 años de edad, sin hijos; desde hace 10 años trabajó como promotora de produtos de Avon (venta de perfumes y joyas), ofreciendo el producto de casa en casa; hace un año, recibio un ascenso en su trabajo, y ahora ella es vendedora autorizada por la empresa Avon; es decir que distribuye a un grupo de promotoras. Actualmente vive con su papá y su hermana; apoya al gasto necesario familiar, es feliz llevando y administrando su propio negocio. Su sueño es poder comprar un vehículo, para poder repartir su produto a las promotoras. Ella es visionaria, se vé como empresaria con su propio local que después sea convertido a un almacen.

loans.use: El préstamo lo utilizara para la a inversión de su negocio.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for FAPE - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Maximiliana's Group

texts.en:
Maximiliana, Lizbeth, and Irene have been part of the community bank “Prosperidad” for the last year. They commented that in their community bank they have learned to be responsible, punctual, to save, and to sand in solidarity.  They feel that the lessons have taught them haw to positively view them selves, their families, their role in society, and their role as business people.  
Maximiliana is 34 years old and has three children who are still students.  She has a stand where she sells grains in the Nery Garcia market in Ayacucho.  On the weekends she travels to different markets around the region to buy more grain.  She uses a van which she owns to transport grain.
Lizbeth is 26 years old and lives with her partner.  She has owned a business selling office supplies out of her garage for one year.  She also sells delicious cakes, and pastries.
Irene is 32 years old and has two small children.  She has had a business selling vegetables in the town of Chiara for two years.  She also raises guinea pigs, which are considered a delicacy in Peru.  
Maximiliana and Irene need loans of 300, and 200 dollars respectively, which they will invest in buying grains typical of the region such as habas, quinua, and cebada.  They will also buy vegetables and cages for the guinea pigs.  Lizbeth has requested a loan of 200 dollars which she will invest in a paper cutter, tools to bind paper, and other office supplies.
Maximiliana plans to use her savings to buy a motorcycle taxi so that her son can work.  Lizbeth is saving to buy a color printer and a laptop computer.  In contrast Irene would like to buy a piece of land in the future.  Maximiliana and Irene dream of buying big modern cars, that their children can finish school, building their own houses, and opening a grocery store.  Lizbeth dreams of having a big office supply store and eventually a soda fountain.

loans.use: Maximiliana and Irene need loans of 300, and 200 dollars respectively, which they will invest in buying grains typical of the region such as habas, quinua, and cebada.  They will also buy vegetables and cages for the guinea pigs.  Lizbeth has requested a loan of 200 dollars which she will invest in a paper cutter, tools to bind paper, and other office supplies.

loans.name: Josefa De La Cruz

texts.es:
Josefa is a strong lady, with a driving spirit to get ahead. She started her business 10 years ago, making and selling tortillas in Managua's Israel Lewites market. She started with a total of C$500 that she used to buy a wooden table that she has to this day. She also bought ingredients for making her delicious tortillas.

It should be noted that Josefa is the mother of three children and, though she keenly feels her responsibility to provide them with an education, her earnings from selling tortillas don't cover the costs of sending them to school. When she realized the difficulties of providing for her children and improving her business, Josefa turned to loans from Ceprodel (2 loans) and, by all accounts, has benefited greatly from them because she's been able to buy bigger quantities of the basic ingredients she needs. Furthermore, she's managed to provide for her children's schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Josefa de la Cruz M. es una dama muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación personal. Desde hace 10 años inició su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas en el mercado Israel Lewites en Managua. Inició con un monto de C$ 500 que los invirtió de manera personal para la compra de una mesa de madera que hasta hoy en día posee, además adquirió los ingredientes para la elaboración de estas sabrosas tortillas.

Es necesario destacar que la señora Josefa es madre de tres hijos que tiene bajo su responsabilidad de brindarle los estudios de primaria y con el ingreso que obtiene de la venta de tortillas no le cubre para estos gastos. Al darse cuenta de la dificultad de mantener a sus hijos y además mejorar las condiciones de su negocio, la señora Josefa ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel (2 créditos) y según cuenta, le han sido de mucho beneficio por el hecho de que ha adquirido mayores cantidades de materia prima y además ha podido apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.

loans.use: Buy maize and wood for food business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
For six years, Sonia has earned a living selling cosmetics and a few cold drinks at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. A mother of 3 children, for whom she has to provide an education, she's a strong and hard-working woman. She's invested in her business in order to improve her economic situation which, by all accounts, has been difficult because she's the only income earner for the household.

Before she had this business, Sonia worked as an assistant in a mill, but she didn't earn much and she decided to save so that she could start her own business selling cosmetics. Now, thanks to loans granted by Ceprodel (3 loans), she has seen ever bigger sales of her cosmetics and beverages. Furthermore, she's managed to buy a display case for showing her products and providing better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace seis años, en el mercado Israel Lewites en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Sonia C. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y algunas bebidas como sodas. Por ser madre de 3 hijos a los que tiene que brindarles educación, ha sido una dama muy esforzada y trabajadora la cual ha invertido en su negocio para el mejoramiento de su situación económica la cual según cuenta ha estado muy difícil por el hecho de que ella es el único sostén en el hogar.

Antes de tener este negocio se dedicaba al trabajo de ayudante en un molino el cual no le generaba buenos ingresos por lo que decide ahorrar para poder implementar su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos y hoy en día, por medio de Créditos realizados en Ceprodel (3 créditos ) ha realizado mayores volúmenes de compra de cosméticos y bebidas. Además ha logrado comprar una vitrina para colocar sus productos y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Ana Fortunata's Group

texts.en:
Ana Fortuna, Nieves and Sabina have been members of the community bank “Prosperidad” for 9, 8, and 12 years respectively.  All of the women are very happy with their experience in the community bank.  They say that the community bank helps them to be self-sufficient.  Through the community bank they have learned to save and run their businesses more efficiently as well as finding companionship.
And Fortuna is 42 years old and has three children aged: 14, 9, and 6.  She runs a school supply store from her house.  She has had this store for the past five years.   Before that she rented VHs tapes.  When tapes became less popular Ana was able to take out a loan from her bank and start a new business.
Nieves is 53 years old and has four adult children and four who have passed away.  She raises animals and sells them at the markets.  She has been doing this all of her life.
Sabina is 47 and has three living children who are 28, 25, and 19.  Three of her children have passed away.  Sabina travels around the region buying grains at various markets and then sells them in Ayacucho.  She has been doing this for the past eight years.  
Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.
They all dream of a better life and a successful business.  Ana dreams of sending her oldest child to medical school.  Nieves hopes to open a second stand, and Sabina wants to continue expanding her merchandise and make sure that her children receive an education.

loans.use: Ana Fortuna, Nieves, and Sabina need loans of 200, 300, and 350 dollars respectively.  Ana needs to go to Lima to buy supplies and prepare for the upcoming school year.  Sabina hopes to expand her business with the loan.  Both she and Nieves would buy animals.

loans.name: Ligia

texts.es:
Ligia Sanchez is a hard-working person who, for 15 years, has earned a living selling shoes at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. She's a widow with a son who still depends on her. Since the death of her husband, she's had to be both father and mother to her son, as well as the sole income earner for the household. Despite her difficult situation, she's been able to forge ahead and improve her business.

The shop where she started her business was, at first, in poor condition, but little by little she's invested in it, even buying racks where she displays the shoes she sells. It's important to note that, 3 years ago, Ligia benefited from Ceprodel loans that she immediately invested in the expansion of her business and that also allowed her small son to continue at school. Her greatest dream is that her son goes on to college.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La dama Ligia S. es una persona muy trabajadora ya que desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos en el mercado Israel Lewites en Managua. Es viuda y madre de un hijo al que tiene que mantener. Desde la partida de su esposo, asumió la responsabilidad de realizar el papel de padre y madre a la vez por lo que es el único sustento de su hogar sin embargo, a pesar de su difícil situación ha podido salir adelante y ha mejorado su negocio.

Su negocio lo inició con un local en mal estado por lo que poco a poco ha venido invirtiendo en su negocio hasta comprar estantes donde colocar los calzados. Es necesario destacar que desde hace 3 años atrás, la señora S. ha sido beneficiada con créditos en Ceprodel los que los ha invertido directamente en la ampliación de su negocio y a la vez para poder darle los estudios a su pequeño hijo. Su mayor sueño es que su hijo llegue a coronar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: Buy footware for resale.

loans.name: Flor Milagro

texts.en:
Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia are members of the community bank “Prosperidad”.  Flor Milagro has been a member for less than one year; Iris Dilalia has been a member for almost five years.  They both joined because their mothers were associates.  Iris Dilalia has four family members who are members of the bank.  They are happy with their experience and say that they have learned to save and that the lessons about healthy relationships, childcare, and self-esteem have been helpful
	Flor Milagro is 25 and has two children.  She has owned a seamstress business for the past six years.  Before that she worked doing the same thing for another person but enjoys having her own business.
	Iris Dilalia is 23 years old and has one seven-year-old child.  She sells cosmetics.  Before, she worked in a factory but decided to go back to school and no longer had time.  She is studying hotel management.  She is saving to be able to travel around the region with her management program.
	Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.
	Flor Milagro dreams of owning a big store and having a happy healthy family.  Iris Dilalia hopes to one day own her own hotel and a house where she can live with her son.

loans.use: Flor Milagro and Iris Dilalia need loans of 175, and 150 dollars respectively, to invest in their business.  Flor Milagro needs to buy fabric, thread, and other supplies.  Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.

loans.name: Flor Milagro's Group

Iris Dilalia wants to expand her business by traveling to Lima to buy clothing and selling it to the many members of her extended family.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.en:
Ana is a persistent and visionary businesswoman. Two years ago, she left her hometown and moved to Palavé, a community of San Cristobal to open a wholesale sandwiches store with her husband. “I’d been visiting many places until I came here, and I knew that I’ve reached my target market. Then, my husband and I, we decided to set up the business here”, she explains. “Naturally, for our sons, it was difficult the adjustment to that new life," she continues saying.

Fortunately, the children gradually got used to the new atmosphere, and Ana’s business has been very dynamic and profitable. Currently, her customers visit the store every day to purchase sandwiches in order to retail in the surroundings. Ana would like to add new goods to diversify her offering and attract new clients. She has requested a loan to purchase raw materials to keep producing her delicious sandwiches and make a good income. That way, the entrepreneur will maintain a comfortable lifestyle for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to continue the production for her wholesale sandwiches store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en:
Irma is in her early thirties, and she and her husband have two children, an 11-year-old boy and an 8-year-old girl. The husband rents heavy trucks.

Irma had begun selling shoes a few years ago. She realized that people where looking for other goods in the community. Thus, she expanded the business and quickly added men and women’s pants, shirts, blue jeans and underwear to her store. This decision was profitable and she saw her clientele growing drastically.

Currently, Irma is selling the shoes by catalog. She says she would like to have a more spacious room to run the business. Her expansion plans consist of adding new goods to the business; she also will finish the small concrete safe room in the second floor of the house and run the store there.

Her husband has already ordered the some materials to finish the work. With her loan, Irma will acquire the materials they lack so that the business can be operated in the new locale. That way, Irma will have a comfortable store where people can purchase handily. The entrepreneur hopes she will achieve success with the business and that she can keep working for the sake of her family.

loans.use: Irma will use her loan to purchase materials to finish a concrete room in her house to run her store.

loans.name: Thi Bac

texts.vi:
Beside tending on her small animal husbandry, Ms Bắc also sells vegetables at the market to be able to put her 4 children in school. She applies to Binh Minh cdc (SEDA) for a loan of 2006000 VND (150 USD). She plans to use the loan to expand her business thus increase her income & improve her family living condition.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Ngoài chăn nuôi, cô Bắc còn đi chợ bán cau để có thể nuôi 4 người con đang đi học. Với số tiền 2006000 vay từ Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Binh minh cdc, cô hy vọng có mở rộng hoạt động kinh doanh của mình, tăng thu nhập, cải thiện đời sống gia đình.

loans.use: Buy vegetables for sales

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is 36 years old and married with four children. She has a poultry farm and also runs a small retail shop business. She would like to build another poultry house and bring more chicks with the extra profits.

loans.use: Add investments in the poultry business

loans.name: Thi Tinh

texts.vi:
Her family has been in the furniture business for a long time. Now they would like to expand their business. Since she learned about Binh Minh cdc (SEDA), she has applied for a loan of 2006000 VNĐ (150 USD) to buy machinery.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị làm nghề mộc lâu năm, nay muốn mở rộng quy mô sản xuất, kinh doanh. Được biết tới những tiện ích mà Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Bình minh cdc đem lại, gia định chi vay 2006000 VNĐ để mua máy làm nghề mộc.

loans.use: To buy machinery

loans.name: Huu Thang

texts.vi:
His main income comes from his work as a woodworker. He also raises pigs at home. His wife sells recycled waste metal. He wishes to improve his family living condition. He's applying for a loan of 354000 VNĐ (25 USD) to buy mash for his pigs, make them grow big and meaty thus selling for a good price.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Công việc tạo thu nhập của anh thắng là chăn nuôi lợn và làm nghề mộc. Chị nhà thì đi chợ đồng nát. Với mong muốn nâng cao đời sống gia đình, gia đình anh vay 354000VNĐ để mua cám cho lợn, tăng năng suất, cho chất lượng thịt tốt, bán được nhiều và giá cao hơn.

loans.use: To buy mash

loans.name: Thi Men

texts.vi:
Her family has various sources of income: a farm supply store, vegetables cultivation, pig raising, carpentry. Ms Men is a state employee, she's applying to Binh Minh (SEDA) for a loan to be invested in pig raising because she wants to demonstrate to her fellow villagers how to use the fund to improve their living condition.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Gia đình chị có rất nhiều hoạt động tạo thu nhập như mở cửa hàng dịch vụ nông nghiệp (bán phân đạm, thuốc trừ sâu...), trồng rau, chăn nuôi, làm nghề mộc... Là cán bộ Phụ nữ thôn, chị vay 354000 VNĐ từ Chương trình Tài chính vi mô Bình minh cdc cho việc chăn nuôi, nêu gương mẫu cho các anh chị khác trong thôn vay để nâng cao đời sống gia đình.

loans.use: Pig raising

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en: Evelyn sells fresh fish in the local market. She intends to pay school fees for the children and to buy a mortocycle with the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy a fridge
